And it followed when Iesus had finished those sayings, he gat him from Galilee, and came in to the coasts off jewry beyond Iordan,

Mt 19:2
and much people followed him, and he healed them there.

Mt 19:3
Then came unto him the pharises to tempt him, and said to him: Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for all manner of causes?

Mt 19:4
He answered, and said unto them: Have ye not read, how that he which made man at the beginning, made them man and woman?

Mt 19:5
and said: for this thing, shall a man leave father and mother, and cleave unto his wife, and they twain shall be one flesh.

Mt 19:6
Wherefore now are they not twain, but one flesh. Let not man therefore put asunder, that which God hath coupled to gydder.

Mt 19:7
Then said they to him: why did Moses command to give unto her a testimonial of divorcement, and to put her away?

Mt 19:8
He said unto them: Moses be cause of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives: But from the beginning it was not so.

Mt 19:9
I say therefore unto you, whosoever putteth away his wife (except it be for fornication) and marrieth another, breaketh wedlock. And whosoever marrieth her which is divorced, doth commit advoutry.

Mt 19:10
Then spake his disciples to him: if the matter be so between man and wife, then is it not good to marry.

Mt 19:11
He said unto them: all men cannot away with that saying but they to whom it is given.

Mt 19:12
There are chaste, which were so born out of their mother's belly. And there are chaste, which be made chaste of men. And there be chaste, which have made themselves chaste for the kingdom of heavens' sake. He that can take it let him take it.

Mt 19:13
Then were brought to him young children, that he should put his hands on them and pray. And his disciples rebuked them.

Mt 19:14
Iesus said unto them: suffer the children, and forbid them not to come to me, for unto such belongeth the kingdom of heaven.

Mt 19:15
And when he had put his hands on them, he departed thence.

Mt 19:16
And behold one came, and said unto him: good master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?

Mt 19:17
He said unto him: why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, and that is God. But and thou wilt enter in to life, keep the commandments.

Mt 19:18
He said: Which? And Iesus said: thou shalt not kill: thou shalt not break wedlock. Thou shall not steal: thou shalt not bear false witness:

Mt 19:19
honour father and mother: and thou shalt love thine neighbor as thyself.

Mt 19:20
The young man said unto him: I have observed all these things from my youth, what have I more to do?

Mt 19:21
Iesus said unto him: if thou wilt be perfect, go and sell that thou hast, and give it to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come and follow me:

Mt 19:22
When the young man heard that saying, he went away mourning. For he had great possessions.

Mt 19:23
Iesus said then unto his disciples: Verily I say unto you, a rich man shall with difficulty enter into the kingdom of heaven.

Mt 19:24
And moreover I say unto you: it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, then for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of Heaven.

Mt 19:25
When his disciples heard that, they were exceedingly amazed, saying: who then can be saved?

Mt 19:26
Iesus beheld them, and said unto them: with men this is unpossible, but with God all things are possible.

Mt 19:27
Then answered Peter, and said to him: Behold we have forsaken all, and have followed thee: what shall we have therefore?

Mt 19:28
Iesus said unto them: verily I say unto you, that ye, which have followed me in the second generation (when the son of man shall sit in the seat of his majesty) shall sit also upon xij. seats, and judge the xij. tribes of Israhel.

Mt 19:29
And whosoever forsaketh house, or brethren, or sisters, other father, or mother, or wife, or children, or livelihood, for my name's sake, the same shall receive an hundred fold, and shall inherit everlasting life.

Mt 19:30
Many that are first, shall be last and the last, shall be first.

Mt 20:1
For the kingdom of heaven is like unto an householder which went out early in the morning to hire laborers into his vineyard.

Mt 20:2
And he agreed with the laborers for a penny a day, and sent them in to his vineyard.

Mt 20:3
And he went out about the third hour, and saw other standing idle in the market place,

Mt 20:4
and said unto them: go ye also into my vineyard, and whatsoever is right, I will give you: and they went their way.

Mt 20:5
Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise.

Mt 20:6
And he went out about the eleventh hour and found other standing idle, and said unto them: Why stand ye here all the day idle?

Mt 20:7
They said unto him: because no man hath hired us. He said to them: go ye also into my vineyard, and whatsoever shall be right, that shall ye receive.

Mt 20:8
When even was come, the lord of the vineyard, said unto his steward: call the laborers, and give them their hire, beginning at the last, till thou come to the first.

Mt 20:9
And they which were hired about the eleventh hour, came and received every man a penny.

Mt 20:10
Then came the first, supposing that they should receive more, and they like wise received every man a penny.

Mt 20:11
And when they had received it, they grudged against the good man of the house, saying:

Mt 20:12
These last have wrought but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us which have borne the burden and heat of the day.

Mt 20:13
He answered to one of them, saying: friend I do thee no wrong: didst thou not agree with me for a penny?

Mt 20:14
Take that which is thy duty, and go thy way. I will give unto this last, as much as to thee.

Mt 20:15
Is it not lawful for me to do as me listeth, with mine own? Is thine eye evil because I am good?

Mt 20:16
So the last shall be first, and the first shall be last. For many are called, and few be chosen.

Mt 20:17
And Iesus ascended to Ierusalem, and took the xij. disciples apart in the way, and said to them:

Mt 20:18
Lo we go up to Ierusalem, and the son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes, and they shall condemn him to death,

Mt 20:19
and shall deliver him to the gentiles, to be mocked, to be scourged, and to be crucified: and the third day he shall rise again.

Mt 20:20
Then came to him the mother of Zebedee's children with her sons, worshipping him, and desiring a certain thing of him.

Mt 20:21
He said unto her: what wilt thou have? She said unto him: Grant that these my two sons may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand in thy kingdom.

Mt 20:22
Iesus answered, and said: Ye wot not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of? And to be baptised with the baptism, that I shall be baptised with? They answered to him: That we are.

Mt 20:23
He said unto them: Ye shall drink of my cup, and shall be baptised with the baptism that I shall be baptised with all. But to sit on my right hand, and on my left hand, is not mine to give you: but to them for whom it is prepared of my father.

Mt 20:24
And when the ten heard this, they disdained at the two brethren.

Mt 20:25
But Iesus called them unto him, and said: Ye know, that the lords of the gentiles have domination over them. And they that are great, exercise power over them.

Mt 20:26
It shall not be so among you: But whosoever will be great among you, let him be your minister,

Mt 20:27
and whosoever will be chief, let him be your servant.

Mt 20:28
Even as the son of man came, not to be ministered unto, but to minister: and to give his life for the redemption of many.

Mt 20:29
And as they departed from Hiericho, much people followed him.

Mt 20:30
And behold, ij. blind men sitting by the wayside, when they heard, that Iesus passed by, cried saying: Master the son of David have mercy on us.

Mt 20:31
And the people rebufed them, because they should hold their peace: But they cried the more, saying: have mercy on us master which art the son of David.

Mt 20:32
Then Iesus stood still, and called them, and said: what will ye that I should do to you?

Mt 20:33
They said unto him: Master, that our eyes may be opened.

Mt 20:34
Iesus pitied them, and touched their eyes. And immediately their eyes received sight: And they followed him.

Mt 21:1
When they drew nye unto Ierusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto mount Olivet: then sent Iesus two of his disciples,

Mt 21:2
saying to them: Go into the town that lieth over against you, and anon ye shall find an ass bound, and her colt with her, loose them and bring them unto me.

Mt 21:3
And if any man say ought unto you, say ye that your master hath need of them, and straight way he will let them go.

Mt 21:4
All this was done, to fulfil that which was spoken by the prophet, saying:

Mt 21:5
Tell ye the daughter of Sion: behold thy king cometh unto thee meek, sitting upon an ass and a colt, the foal of an ass used to the yoke.

Mt 21:6
The disciples went, and did as Iesus commanded them,

Mt 21:7
and brought the ass and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and set him there on.

Mt 21:8
Many of the people spread their garments in the way. Other cut down branches from the trees, and strawed them in the way.

Mt 21:9
Moreover the people that went before, and they also that came after cried saying: Hosianna to the son of David. Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord, hosianna in the hyest.

Mt 21:10
And when he was come in to Ierusalem, all the city was moved, saying: who is this?

Mt 21:11
And the people said: this is Iesus the prophet of Nazareth a city of Galilee.

Mt 21:12
And Iesus went in to the temple of God, and cast out all them that bought and sold in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves.

Mt 21:13
And said to them: it is written, mine house shall be called the house of prayer, but ye have made it a den of thieves.

Mt 21:14
And the blind and the halt came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

Mt 21:15
When the chief priests and scribes saw the marvels that he did, and the children crying in the temple and saying, Hosianna to the son of David, they disdained,

Mt 21:16
and said unto him: hearest thou what these say? Iesus said unto them: have ye never read, of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast ordained praise?

Mt 21:17
And he left them, and went out of the city unto Bethany, and passed the time there.

Mt 21:18
In the morning as he returned into the city again, he hungered,

Mt 21:19
and spied a fig tree in the way, and came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said to it, never fruit grow on thee hence forwards. And anon the fig tree withered away.

Mt 21:20
And when his disciples saw that, they marvelled saying: How soon is the fig tree withered away?

Mt 21:21
Iesus answered, and said unto them: Verily I say unto you, if ye shall have faith, and shall not doubt, ye shall not only do that which I have done to the fig tree: but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, take thyself away, and cast thyself into the sea, it shall be done.

Mt 21:22
And whatsoever thing ye shall ask in your prayers if ye believe, ye shall receive it.

Mt 21:23
And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the seniors of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said: by what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this power?

Mt 21:24
Iesus answered, and said unto them: I also will ask of you a certain question, which if ye assoil me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

Mt 21:25
Whence was the baptism of Ihon? from heaven, or of men? And they thought in themselves, saying: if we shall say, from heaven, he will say unto us: why did ye not then believe him?

Mt 21:26
But and if we shall say of men, then fear we the people. For all men held Ihon as a prophet.

Mt 21:27
And they answered Iesus, and said: we cannot tell. He likewise said unto them: neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

Mt 21:28
What say ye to this? A certain man had ij sons, and came to the elder saying: go and work today in my vineyard.

Mt 21:29
He answered and said, I will not: but afterward repented and went.

Mt 21:30
Then came he to the second, and said like wise, and he answered and said: I will sir: yet went he not.

Mt 21:31
Whether of these ij fulfilled their father's will? And they said unto him: the first. Iesus said unto them: verily I say unto you, that the publicans and the harlots shall come into the kingdom of God before you.

Mt 21:32
For Ihon came unto you, in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not. But the publicans and the whores believed him. But ye (though ye saw it) yet were not moved with repentance, that ye might afterward have believed him.

Mt 21:33
Hearken another similitude. There was a certain householder, which set a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and made a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a strange country.

Mt 21:34
And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, to receive the fruits of it,

Mt 21:35
and the husbandmen caught his servants, and beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

Mt 21:36
Again he sent other servants more than the first, and they served them likewise.

Mt 21:37
But last of all, he sent unto them his own son, saying: they will fear my son.

Mt 21:38
When the husbandmen saw his son, they said among them selves: This is the heir, come on let us kill him, and let us take his inheritance, to our selves.

Mt 21:39
And they caught him and thrust him out of the vineyard, and slew him.

Mt 21:40
When the lord of the vineyard cometh: what will he do with those husbandmen?

Mt 21:41
They said unto him: he will evil destroy those evil persons, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall deliver him his fruit at times convenient.

Mt 21:42
Iesus said unto them: did ye never read in the scriptures? The same stone which the builders refused, is set in the principal part of the corner: this was the Lord's doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes.

Mt 21:43
Therefore say I unto you, the kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and shall be given to the Gentiles which shall bring forth the fruits of it.

Mt 21:44
And whosoever shall fall on this stone, shall be alto broken. And whosoever this stone shall fall upon, he shall grind him to powder.

Mt 21:45
And when the chief priests and pharises heard these similitudes they perceived that he spake of them.

Mt 21:46
And they went about to lay hands on him, but they feared the people, because they counted him as a prophet.

Mt 22:1
And Iesus answered and spake unto them again, in similitudes, saying:

Mt 22:2
The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain King, which married his son,

Mt 22:3
and sent forth his servants, to call them that were bid to the wedding, and they would not come.

Mt 22:4
Again he sent forth other servants, saying: tell them which are bidden: Lo I have prepared my dinner, mine oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready, come unto the marriage.

Mt 22:5
They made light of it, and went their ways: one to his firm place, another about his merchandise,

Mt 22:6
the remnant took his servants, and intreated them ungoodly, and slew them.

Mt 22:7
When the king heard that, he was wroth, and sent forth his warriors and destroyed those murderers, and burnt up their city.

Mt 22:8
Then said he to his servants: The wedding was prepared: but they which were bidden thereto, were not worthy.

Mt 22:9
Go ye therefore out into the high ways, and as many as ye find, bid them to the marriage.

Mt 22:10
The servants went out into the ways, and gathered togedder as many as they could find, both good and bad, and the wedding was furnished with guests.

Mt 22:11
The king came in, to visit the guests, and spied there a man which had not on a wedding garment,

Mt 22:12
and said unto him: friend, how camest thou in hither, and * hast not on a wedding garment? and he was even speechless. *<til here the text is from Tyndale's Cologne quarto fragment 1525; the text thereafter is from the octavo edition of 1526.>

Mt 22:13
Then said the king to his ministers: take and bind him hand and foot, and cast him into utter darkness, there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

Mt 22:14
For many are called and few be chosen.

Mt 22:15
Then went the pharises and took counsel, how they might tangle him in his words.

Mt 22:16
And sent unto him their disciples with Herode's servants, saying: Master, we know that thou art true, and that thou teachest the way of God truly, neither carest for any man, for thou considerest not men's estate.

Mt 22:17
Tell us therefore: how thinkest thou? is it lawful to give tribute unto Cesar, or not?

Mt 22:18
Iesus perceived their wickedness, and said: Why tempt ye me ye hypocrites?

Mt 22:19
let me see the tribute money. And they took him a penny.

Mt 22:20
And he said unto them: whose is this image and superscription?

Mt 22:21
They said unto him: Cesar's. Then said he unto them: Give therefore to Cesar, that which is cesar's: and give unto god, that which is godde's.

Mt 22:22
When they heard that they marvelled, and left him and went their way.

Mt 22:23
The same day the sadducees came to him (which say that there is no resurrection) and they asked him

Mt 22:24
saying: Master, Moses bade, if a man die having no children, that the brother marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

Mt 22:25
There were with us seven brethren, the first married and died without issue, and left his wife unto his brother.

Mt 22:26
Likewise the second and the third, unto the seventh:

Mt 22:27
Last of all the woman died also.

Mt 22:28
Now in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the vij.? for all had her.

Mt 22:29
Iesus answered and said unto them: ye are deceived, and know not what the scripture meaneth, nor yet the virtue of God.

Mt 22:30
For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are married: but are as the angels of God in heaven.

Mt 22:31
As touching the resurrection of the dead: have ye not read what is said unto you of God, which sayeth:

Mt 22:32
I am Abraham's God, and Isaac's God, and the God of Iacob? God is not the God of the dead: but of the living.

Mt 22:33
And when the people heard that, they were astonied at his doctrine.

Mt 22:34
When the pharises had heard, how that he had put the sadducees to silence, they drew togedder,

Mt 22:35
and one of them which was a doctor of law asked him a question tempting him and saying:

Mt 22:36
Master which is the great commandment in the law?

Mt 22:37
Iesus said unto him: thou shalt love thy Lord God with all thine heart, with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

Mt 22:38
This is the first and that great commandment.

Mt 22:39
And there is another like unto this. Thou shalt love thine neighbor as thyself.

Mt 22:40
In these two commandments, hang all the law and the prophets.

Mt 22:41
While the pharises were gathered together Iesus asked them

Mt 22:42
saying: what think ye of Christ? whose son is he? they said unto him: the son of David.

Mt 22:43
He said unto them: how then doth David in spirit call him Lord, saying?

Mt 22:44
The Lord said to my Lord, sit on my right hand: till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

Mt 22:45
If David call him Lord: how is he then his son?

Mt 22:46
And none of them could answer him again one word. Neither durst any from that day forth, ask him any more questions.

Mt 23:1
Then spake Iesus to the people, and to his disciples,

Mt 23:2
saying: The scribes and the pharises sit in Moses' seat,

Mt 23:3
whatsoever they bid you observe, that observe and do: but after their works do not: for they say, and do not.

Mt 23:4
Yea and they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay them on men's shoulders: but they themselves will not heave them with one finger.

Mt 23:5
All their works they do, for to be seen of men. They set abroad their phylacteries, and make large borders on their garments,

Mt 23:6
and love to sit uppermost at feasts, and to have the chief seats in the synagogues,

Mt 23:7
and greetings in the markets and to be called of men Rabbi.

Mt 23:8
But ye shall not suffer yourselves to be called Rabbi, for one is your master, that is to wit Christ, and all ye are brethren.

Mt 23:9
And call ye no man your father upon the earth, for one is your father, and he is in heaven.

Mt 23:10
Be not called masters, for one is your master, and he is Christ.

Mt 23:11
He that is greatest among you, shall be your servant.

Mt 23:12
But whosoever exalteth himself, shall be brought low. And he that submiteth himself, shall be exalted.

Mt 23:13
Woe be unto you scribes and pharises dissemblers, for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven before men: ye yourselves go not in, neither suffer ye them that come to enter in.

Mt 23:14
Woe be unto you scribes and pharises, for ye devour widows' houses, and that under a colour of praying long prayers, wherefore ye shall receive greater damnation.

Mt 23:15
Woe be unto you scribes and pharises hypocrites, for ye compass sea and land, to bring one into your belief: and when ye have brought him ye make him two fold more the child of hell, than ye yourselves are.

Mt 23:16
Woe be unto you blind guides, for ye say: whosoever swear by the temple, it is nothing: but whosoever swear by the gold of the temple, he is debtor.

Mt 23:17
Ye fools and blind? whether is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold.

Mt 23:18
And whosoever sweareth by the altar it is nothing: but whosoever sweareth by the offering that lieth on the altar is debtor.

Mt 23:19
Ye fools and blind: whether is greater the offering, or the altar which sanctifieth the offering?

Mt 23:20
whosoever therefore sweareth by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all that thereon is.

Mt 23:21
And whosoever sweareth by the temple sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.

Mt 23:22
And he that sweareth by heaven, sweareth by the seat of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.

Mt 23:23
Woe be to you scribes and pharises dissemblers, for ye tithe mint, annise, and cummin, and leave the weightier matters of the law undone: judgement, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to have left the other undone.

Mt 23:24
Ye blind guides, which strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel.

Mt 23:25
Woe be to you scribes and pharises hypocrites, for ye make clean the outer side of the cup, and of the platter: but within they are full of bribery and excess.

Mt 23:26
Thou blind pharise, cleanse first, that which is within the cup and the platter, that the outside may also be clean.

Mt 23:27
Woe be to you scribes, and pharises hypocrites, for ye are like unto painted tombs which appear beautiful outwards: but are within full of dead men's bones and of all filthiness.

Mt 23:28
So are ye, for outward ye appear righteous unto men, when within ye are full of dissimulation and iniquity.

Mt 23:29
Woe be unto you scribes and pharises hypocrites, for ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchers of just men,

Mt 23:30
and say: If we had been in our fathers' time, we would not have been partners with them in the blood of the prophets.

Mt 23:31
So are ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them, which killed the prophets.

Mt 23:32
Fulfil ye likewise the measure of your fathers:

Mt 23:33
yea serpents and generation of vipers, how shall ye scape the damnation of hell?

Mt 23:34
Wherefore behold I send unto you, prophets wise men and scribes, and of them some shall ye kill and crucify, and some shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city,

Mt 23:35
that all righteous blood may fall upon you, which was shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel, unto the blood of Zacharias the son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar:

Mt 23:36
Verily I say unto you, all these things shall light upon this generation.

Mt 23:37
Hierusalem, Hierusalem which killest prophets, and stonest them which are sent to thee: how often would I have gathered thy children togedder, as the hen gathereth her chickens under her wings? but ye would not?

Mt 23:38
behold your habitation shall be left unto you desolate.

Mt 23:39
For I say unto you, ye shall not see me henceforth, till that ye say: blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

Mt 24:1
And Iesus went out and departed from the temple: and his disciples came to him, for to shew him the building of the temple.

Mt 24:2
Iesus said unto them: see ye not all these things? Verily I say unto you: There shall not be here left one stone upon another, that shall not be destroyed.

Mt 24:3
And as he sat upon the mount Olivet, his disciples came unto him secretly saying: Tell us, when this shall be? and what sign shall be of thy coming, and of the end of the world?

Mt 24:4
and Iesus answered, and said unto them: take heed that no man deceive you,

Mt 24:5
for many shall come in my name saying: I am Christ: and shall deceive many.

Mt 24:6
Ye shall hear of wars, and of the noise of wars, but see that ye be not troubled, for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.

Mt 24:7
For nation shall rise against nation, and realm against realm: and there shall be pestilence, and hunger, and earthquakes in all quarters.

Mt 24:8
All these are the beginning of sorrows.

Mt 24:9
Then shall they put you to trouble, and shall kill you, and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name's sake:

Mt 24:10
and then shall many fall, and shall betray one another, and shall hate one the other,

Mt 24:11
and many false prophets shall arise, and shall deceive many:

Mt 24:12
and because iniquity shall have the upper hand, the love of many shall abate.

Mt 24:13
But he that endureth to the end shall be safe.

Mt 24:14
And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world, for a witness unto all nations, and then shall the end come.

Mt 24:15
When ye then shall see the abomination and desolation (spoken of by Daniel the prophet) stand in the holy place: whosoever readeth it, let him understand it.

Mt 24:16
Then let them which be in jury fly into the mountains.

Mt 24:17
And let him which is on the housetop, not come down to take anything out of his house.

Mt 24:18
Neither let him which is in the field, return back to fetch his clothes.

Mt 24:19
Woe be in those days to them that are with child, and to them that give suck.

Mt 24:20
But pray that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the Sabbath day.

Mt 24:21
For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not from the beginning of the world to this time, nor shall be.

Mt 24:22
Yea and except those days should be shortened, should no flesh be saved: But for the chosens' sake those days shall be shortened.

Mt 24:23
Then if any man shall say unto you: lo, here is Christ, or there is Christ: believe it not:

Mt 24:24
for there shall arise false christs, and false prophets and shall give great signs and wonders. So greatly that if it were possible, even the chosen should be brought into error.

Mt 24:25
Take heed I have told you before.

Mt 24:26
If they shall say unto you: lo, he is in the desert, go not forth: lo, he is in the secret places, believe not.

Mt 24:27
For as the lightning cometh out of the east, and shineth unto the west: so shall the coming of the son of man be.

Mt 24:28
For wheresoever a dead body is, even thither will the eagles resort.

Mt 24:29
Immediately after the tribulations of those days, shall the sun be darkeneth: and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven shall move.

Mt 24:30
And then shall appear the sign of the son of man in heaven. And then shall all the kindreds of the earth mourn, and they shall see the son of man come in the clouds of heaven with power and great majesty:

Mt 24:31
And he shall send his angels with the great voice of a trumpet, and they shall gather togedther his chosen from the four winds, and from the one end of the world to the other.

Mt 24:32
Learn a similitude of the fig tree: when his branches are yet tender, and his leaves sprung, ye know that summer is nye.

Mt 24:33
So likewise when ye see all these things, be ye sure that it is near even at the doors.

Mt 24:34
Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all be fulfilled.

Mt 24:35
Heaven and earth shall perish: but my words shall abide.

Mt 24:36
But of that day and hour knoweth no man, no not the angels of heaven, but my father only.

Mt 24:37
As the time of Noe was, so likewise shall the coming of the son of man be.

Mt 24:38
For as in the days before the flood: they did eat and drink, marry, and were married, even unto the day that Noe entered in to the ship,

Mt 24:39
and knew of nothing till the flood came and took them all away. So shall also the coming of the son of man be.

Mt 24:40
Then two shall be in the fields, the one shall be received, and the other shall be refused,

Mt 24:41
two shall be grinding at the mill: the one shall be received, and the other shall be refused.

Mt 24:42
Wake therefore, because ye know not what hour your master will come.

Mt 24:43
Of this be sure, that if the good man of the house knew what hour the thief would come: he would surely watch, and not suffer his house to be broken up.

Mt 24:44
Therefore be ye also ready, for what hour ye think least on, in the same shall the son of man come.

Mt 24:45
Who is a faithful servant and wise, whom his master hath made ruler over his household, for to give them meat in season convenient?

Mt 24:46
happy is that servant whom his master (when he cometh) shall find so doing.

Mt 24:47
Verily I say unto you, he shall make him ruler over all his goods.

Mt 24:48
But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart, my master will defer his coming,

Mt 24:49
and begin to smite his fellows: yea and to eat and to drink with the drunken:

Mt 24:50
that servants master will come in a day when he looketh not for him: and in an hour that he is not ware of,

Mt 24:51
and will divide him, and give him his reward with hypocrites. There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

Mt 25:1
Then the kingdom of heaven shall be likened unto x. virgins, which took their lamps, and went to meet the bridegroom:

Mt 25:2
five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

Mt 25:3
The foolish took their lamps, but took none oil with them.

Mt 25:4
But the wise took oil with them in their vessels with their lamps also.

Mt 25:5
While the bridegroom tarried, all slumbered and slept.

Mt 25:6
And even at midnight, there was a cry made: behold, the bridegroom cometh, go and meet him.

Mt 25:7
Then all those virgins arose, and prepared their lamps.

Mt 25:8
And the foolish said to the wise: give us of your oil, for our lamps go out?

Mt 25:9
But the wise answered, saying: not so, lest there be not enough for us and you, but go rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.

Mt 25:10
In conclusion while they went to buy, the bridegroom came: and they that were ready, went in with him to the wedding, and the gate was shut up.

Mt 25:11
Afterwards came also the other virgins, saying: master, master open to us.

Mt 25:12
But he answered, and said: verily I say unto you: I know you not:

Mt 25:13
look that ye watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor yet the hour, when the son of man shall come.

Mt 25:14
Likewise as a certain man ready to take his journey to a strange country, called his servants to him, and delivered to them his goods.

Mt 25:15
And unto one he gave v. talents, to another ij. and to another one: to every man after his ability, and straight way departed.

Mt 25:16
Then he that had received the five talents, went and bestowed them, and won other five.

Mt 25:17
Likewise he that received ij. gained other ij.

Mt 25:18
But he that received one, went and digged a pit in the earth and hid his master's money.

Mt 25:19
After a long season the lord of those servants came, and reckoned with them.

Mt 25:20
Then came he that had received five talents, and brought other five saying: master, thou deliveredst unto me five talents, lo I have gained with them five more.

Mt 25:21
His master said unto him: well good servant and faithful, Thou hast been faithful in little, I will make thee ruler over much: enter in into thy master's joy.

Mt 25:22
Also he that received ij. talents came, and said: master, thou deliveredest unto me ij. talents: lo I have won ij. other talents with them.

Mt 25:23
His master said unto him, well good servant and faithful thou hast been faithful in little, I will make thee ruler over much, go in into thy master's joy.

Mt 25:24
He which had received the one talent came also, and said: master, I considered that thou wast an hard man, which reapest where thou sowedst not, and gatherest where thou strawedst not,

Mt 25:25
and was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, thou hast thine own.

Mt 25:26
His master answered, and said unto him: evil servant and slothful, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I strawed not:

Mt 25:27
thou oughtest therefore to have had my money to the changers, and then at my coming should I have received my money with vantage.

Mt 25:28
Take therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him which hath x. talents.

Mt 25:29
For unto every man that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance. And from him that hath not, shall be taken away, even that he hath.

Mt 25:30
And cast that unprofitable servant into utter darkness, there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

Mt 25:31
When the son of man shall come in his majesty, and all his holy angels with him, then shall he sit upon the seat of his majesty,

Mt 25:32
and before him shall be gathered all nations. And he shall sever them one from another, as a shepherd putteth asunder the sheep from the goats.

Mt 25:33
And he shall set the sheep on his right hand, and the goats on the left hand.

Mt 25:34
Then shall the King say to them on his right hand: Come ye blessed children of my father, inherit ye the kingdom prepared for you from the beginning of the world.

Mt 25:35
For I was an hungered, and ye gave me meat. I thirsted, and ye gave me drink. I was harborless, and ye lodged me. I was naked and ye clothed me:

Mt 25:36
I was sick and ye visited me. I was in prison and ye came unto me.

Mt 25:37
Then shall the just answer him saying: master, when, saw we thee an hungered, and fed thee? or a thirst, and gave thee drink?

Mt 25:38
when saw we thee harborless, and lodged thee? or naked and clothed thee?

Mt 25:39
or when saw we thee sick, or in prison and came unto thee?

Mt 25:40
And the king shall answer and say unto them: verily I say unto you: in as much as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren: ye have done it to me.

Mt 25:41
Then shall the king say unto them that shall be on the left hand: depart from me ye cursed, into everlasting fire, which is prepared for the devil and his angels.

Mt 25:42
For I was an hungered, and ye gave me no meat. I thirsted, and ye gave me no drink. I was harborless, and ye lodged me not.

Mt 25:43
I was naked, and ye clothed me not. I was sick and in prison, and ye visited me not.

Mt 25:44
Then shall they also answer him saying: master, when saw we thee an hungered, or a thirst, or harborless, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and have not ministered unto thee?

Mt 25:45
then shall he answer them, and say: Verily I say unto you, in as much as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to me.

Mt 25:46
And these shall go into everlasting pain: And the righteous into life eternal.

Mt 26:1
And it followed: when Iesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples:

Mt 26:2
ye know that after ij. days shall be ester, and the son of man shall be delivered to be crucified.

Mt 26:3
Then assembled together the chief priests and scribes and seniors of the people into the palace of the high priest, called Caiphas:

Mt 26:4
and held a counsel, how they might take Iesus by subtlety, and kill him.

Mt 26:5
but they said, not on the holy day, lest any trouble arise among the people.

Mt 26:6
When Iesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

Mt 26:7
there came unto him a woman, which had an alabaster box of precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat at the board.

Mt 26:8
When his disciples saw that, they had indignation saying: what needed this waste?

Mt 26:9
This ointment might have been well sold, and given to the poor.

Mt 26:10
When Iesus understood that, he said unto them: why trouble ye the woman? she hath wrought a good work upon me.

Mt 26:11
For ye shall have poor folk always with you: but me shall ye not have always.

Mt 26:12
And in that she casted this ointment on my body, she did it to bury me withall.

Mt 26:13
Verily I say unto you, wheresoever this gospel shall be preached throughout all the world, there shall also this that she hath done, be told for a memorial of her.

Mt 26:14
Then one of the twelve called Iudas Iscariot went unto the chief priests,

Mt 26:15
and said: what will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they appointed unto him thirty pieces of silver.

Mt 26:16
And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

Mt 26:17
The first day of unleavened bread the disciples came to Iesus saying unto him: where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the ester lamb?

Mt 26:18
And he said: Go into the city, unto such a man, and say to him: the master saith, my time is almost come, I will keep mine ester at thy house with my disciples.

Mt 26:19
And the disciples did as Iesus had appointed them, and made ready the ester lamb.

Mt 26:20
When the even was come, he sat down with the xij.

Mt 26:21
And as they did eat, he said: Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

Mt 26:22
And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him: is it I master?

Mt 26:23
He answered and said: he that dippeth his hand with me in the dish, shall betray me.

Mt 26:24
The son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe be to that man, by whom the son of man shall be betrayed. It had been good for that man, if he had never been born.

Mt 26:25
Then Iudas which betrayed him, answered and said: is it I master? He said unto him: thou hast said.

Mt 26:26
As they did ate, Iesus took bread and gave thanks, brake it, and gave it to the disciples, and said: Take, eat, this is my body.

Mt 26:27
And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it them, saying: drink of it every one.

Mt 26:28
This is my blood of the new testament, which shall be shed for many, for the forgiveness of sins.

Mt 26:29
I say unto you: I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine tree, until that day, when I shall drink it new with you in my father's kingdom.

Mt 26:30
And when they had said grace, they went out into mount olivet.

Mt 26:31
Then said Iesus unto them: all ye shall fall this night because of me. For it is written: I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.

Mt 26:32
But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galile.

Mt 26:33
Peter answered, and said unto him: though all men should be hurt by thee, yet would I not be hurt.

Mt 26:34
Iesus said unto him: verily I say unto thee, that this same night before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

Mt 26:35
Peter said unto him: If I should die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.

Mt 26:36
Then went Iesus with them into a place, which is called Gethsemane, and said unto his disciples: sit ye here while I go and pray yonder.

Mt 26:37
And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebede, and began to wax sorrowful and to be in agony.

Mt 26:38
Then said Iesus unto them: my soul is heavy even unto the death. Tarry ye here: and watch with me.

Mt 26:39
And he went away a little apart, and fell flat on his face, and prayed saying: O my father, if it possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless, not as I will, but as thou wilt.

Mt 26:40
And he came unto the disciples, and found them asleep, and said to Peter: what, could ye not watch with me one hour?

Mt 26:41
watch and pray, that ye fall not into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.

Mt 26:42
He went away once more, and prayed, saying: O my father, if this cup cannot pass away from me, but that I drink of it, thy will be fulfilled.

Mt 26:43
And he came, and found them asleep again. For their eyes were heavy.

Mt 26:44
And he left and went again, and prayed the third time saying the same words.

Mt 26:45
Then came he to his disciples and said unto them: Sleep henceforth, and take your rest. Take heed the hour is at hand, and the son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of sinners.

Mt 26:46
Rise, let us be going, he is at hand that shall betray me.

Mt 26:47
While he yet spake, lo, Iudas one of the twelve came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, which were sent from the chief priests and seniors of the people.

Mt 26:48
He that betrayed him, gave them a token, saying: whosoever I kiss, that same is he, lay hands on him.

Mt 26:49
And forthwithall he came to Iesus, and said: hail master. And kissed him.

Mt 26:50
And Iesus said unto him: friend, wherefore art thou come? Then came they and laid hands on Iesus and took him.

Mt 26:51
And behold, one of them which were with Iesus, stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest, and smote off his ear.

Mt 26:52
Then said Iesus unto him: put up thy sword into his sheath. For all they that lay hands on the sword, shall perish with the sword.

Mt 26:53
Either thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my father, and he shall give me more than xij. legions of angels?

Mt 26:54
how then should the scriptures be fulfilled, for so must it be.

Mt 26:55
The same time said Iesus to the multitude: ye be come out as it were unto a thief, with swords and staves for to take me: daily I sat among you teaching in the temple, and ye took me not.

Mt 26:56
All this was done that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him and fled.

Mt 26:57
And they took Iesus and led him to Caiphas the high priest, where the scribes and the seniors were assembled.

Mt 26:58
Peter followed him afar off, unto the high priest's place: and went in, and sat with the servants to see the end.

Mt 26:59
The chief priests, and the seniors, and all the council, sought false witness against Iesus, for to put him to death,

Mt 26:60
and they found none: in so much that when many false witnesses came, yet found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,

Mt 26:61
and said: This fellow said: I can destroy the temple of God, and build the same in iij. days.

Mt 26:62
And the chief priest arose, and said to him: answerest thou nothing? How is it that these bear witness against thee?

Mt 26:63
but Iesus held his peace. And the chief priest answered, and said to him: I charge thee in the name of the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be Christ the son of God.

Mt 26:64
Iesus said to him: thou hast said. Nevertheless I say unto you, hereafter shall ye see the son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and come in the clouds of the sky.

Mt 26:65
Then the high priest rent his clothes saying? He hath blasphemed: what need we of any more witnesses? Lo, now have ye heard his blasphemy:

Mt 26:66
what think ye? They answered and said: he is worthy to die.

Mt 26:67
Then spat they in his face, and beat him with their fists. And other smote him with the palm of their hands on the face,

Mt 26:68
saying: areede to us Christ, who is he that smote thee?

Mt 26:69
Peter sat without in the palace, and a damsel came to him, saying: Thou also wast with Iesus of Galilee:

Mt 26:70
he denied before them all saying: I wot not what thou sayest.

Mt 26:71
When he was gone out into the porch, another wench saw him, and said unto them that were there: This fellow was also with Iesus of Nazareth:

Mt 26:72
And again he denied with an oath, and said: I know not the man.

Mt 26:73
And after a while came unto him they that stood by, and said unto Peter: surely thou art even one of them, for thy speech betrayeth thee.

Mt 26:74
Then began he to curse and to swear, that he knew not the man. And immediately the cock crew.

Mt 26:75
And Peter remembered the words of Iesu, which he said unto him: before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice: and went out at the doors and wept bitterly.

Mt 27:1
When the morning was come, all the chief priests and seniors of the people held a counsel against Iesu, to put him to death,

Mt 27:2
and brought him bound and delivered him unto Pontius Pilate the deputy.

Mt 27:3
Then when Iudas which betrayed him, saw that he was condemned, he repented himself, and brought again the xxx. plates of silver to the chief priests and seniors

Mt 27:4
saying: I have sinned betraying the innocent blood. And they said: what is that to us? see thou to that.

Mt 27:5
And he cast down the silver plates in the temple, and departed, and went and hung himself.

Mt 27:6
The chief priests took the silver plates and said: it is not lawful for to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.

Mt 27:7
And they took counsel, and bought with them a potter's field to bury strangers in.

Mt 27:8
Wherefore that field is called, the field of blood, until this day.

Mt 27:9
Then was fulfilled, that which was spoken by Ieremy the prophet, saying: and they took xxx. silver plates, the value of him that was priced, whom they bought of the children of Israhel,

Mt 27:10
and they gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord appointed me.

Mt 27:11
Iesus stood before the deputy: and the deputy asked him, saying: Art thou the king of the jews? Iesus said unto him: Thou sayest.

Mt 27:12
When he was accused of the chief priests and seniors, he answered nothing.

Mt 27:13
Then said Pilate unto him: hearest thou not how many things they lay against thee?

Mt 27:14
and he answered him to never a word: in so much that the deputy marvelled very sore.

Mt 27:15
At that feast, the deputy was wont to deliver unto the people a prisoner whom they would choose.

Mt 27:16
He had then a notable prisoner called Barabbas.

Mt 27:17
And when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them: whether will ye that I give loose unto you, Barabbas, or Iesus which is called Christ?

Mt 27:18
For he knew well, that for envy they had delivered him.

Mt 27:19
When he was set down to give judgement, his wife sent to him, saying: have thou nothing to do with that just man, I have suffered many things this day in my sleep about him.

Mt 27:20
The chief priests and the seniors had persuaded the people, that they should ask Barabbas, and should destroy Iesus.

Mt 27:21
The deputy answered and said unto them: whether of the twain will ye that I let loose unto you? And they said, Barabbas.

Mt 27:22
Pilate said unto them: what shall I do then with Iesus, which is called Christ? They all said to him: let him be crucified.

Mt 27:23
Then said the deputy: what evil hath he done? And they cried the more saying: let him be crucified.

Mt 27:24
When Pilate saw that he prevailed nothing, but that more business was made, he took water and washed his hands before the people saying: I am innocent of the blood of this just person, and that ye shall see.

Mt 27:25
Then answered all the people, and said: his blood fall on us, and on our children.

Mt 27:26
Then let he Barabbas loose unto them, and scourged Iesus, and delivered him to be crucified.

Mt 27:27
Then the soldiers of the deputy took Iesus unto the common hall, and gathered unto him all the company.

Mt 27:28
And they stripped him, and put on him a purple robe,

Mt 27:29
and plaited a crown of thorns and put upon his head, and a reed in his right hand. And bowed their knees before him, saying: hail king of the jews,

Mt 27:30
and spitted upon him, and took the reed and smote him on the head.

Mt 27:31
And when they had mocked him, they took the robe off him again, and put his own raiment on him, and led him away to crucify him.

Mt 27:32
And as they came out, they found a man of Cyren, named Simon: him they compelled to bear his cross.

Mt 27:33
And came unto the place, which is called Golgotha (that is to say a place of dead men's skulls)

Mt 27:34
they gave him vinegar to drink mixt with gall. And when he had tasted thereof, he would not drink.

Mt 27:35
When they had crucified him, they parted his garments, and did cast lots. To fulfil that was spoken by the prophet: They divided my garments among them: and upon my vesture have cast lots.

Mt 27:36
And they sat and watched him there.

Mt 27:37
And they set up over his head the cause of his death written: This is Iesus the king of the jews.

Mt 27:38
And there were two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left hand.

Mt 27:39
They that passed by, reviled him wagging their heads

Mt 27:40
and saying: Thou that destroyest the temple of God, and buildest it in three days save thyself. If thou be the son of God, come down from the cross.

Mt 27:41
Likewise also the prelates mocking him with the scribes and seniors said:

Mt 27:42
He saved other, himself he cannot save. If he be the king of Israhell: let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.

Mt 27:43
He trusted in God, let God deliver him now if he will have him, for he said, I am the son of God.

Mt 27:44
That same also the thieves, which were crucified with him cast in his teeth.

Mt 27:45
From the sixth hour was there darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.

Mt 27:46
And about the ninth hour Iesus cried with a loud voice, saying: Eli Eli lama sabathani. That is to say, my God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

Mt 27:47
Some of them that stood there, when they heard that said: This man calleth for Helias.

Mt 27:48
And straightway one of them ran and took a sponge and filled it full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.

Mt 27:49
Other said let be, let us see whether Helias will come and deliver him.

Mt 27:50
Iesus cried again with a loud voice and yielded up the ghost.

Mt 27:51
And behold the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom, and the earth did quake,

Mt 27:52
and the stones did rent, and graves did open, and the bodies of many saints which slept, arose:

Mt 27:53
and came out of the graves after his resurrection, and came into the holy city, and appeared unto many.

Mt 27:54
When the petty captain, and they that were with him watching Iesus, saw the earthquake and those things which happened, they feared greatly saying, Of a surety this was the son of God.

Mt 27:55
And many women were there, beholding him afar off, which followed Iesus from Galile, ministering unto him:

Mt 27:56
among the which was Mary Magdalen, and Mary the mother of Iames and the mother of Ioses, and the mother of Zebede's children.

Mt 27:57
When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathia named Ioseph, which same also was Iesus' disciple.

Mt 27:58
He went to Pilate and begged the body of Iesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

Mt 27:59
And Ioseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

Mt 27:60
and put it in his new tomb, which he had hewn out even in the rock, and rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre and departed.

Mt 27:61
And there was Mary Magdalene and the other Mary sitting over against the sepulchre.

Mt 27:62
The next day that followeth good friday, the high priests and pharises got themselves to Pilate,

Mt 27:63
and said: Sir, we remember, that this deceiver said while he was yet alive. After three days I will arise again,

Mt 27:64
command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest peradventure his disciples come, and steal him away, and say unto the people, he is risen from death: And then the last error shall be worse than the first was.

Mt 27:65
Pilate said unto them: Take watchmen: Go and make it as sure as ye can.

Mt 27:66
They went and made the sepulchre sure with watchmen, and sealed the stone.

Mt 28:1
The sabbath day at even which dawneth the morrow after the saboth, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the sepulchre.

Mt 28:2
And behold there was a great earthquake. For the angel of the Lord descended from heaven: and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.

Mt 28:3
His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow.

Mt 28:4
For fear of him the keepers were astunned, and became as dead men.

Mt 28:5
The angel answered, and said to the women: Fear ye not. I know well ye seek Iesus which was crucified:

Mt 28:6
he is not here: he is risen as he said. Come, and see the place where the Lord was put.

Mt 28:7
And go quickly and tell his disciples that he is risen from death. And behold, he will go before you into Galile, there ye shall see him. Lo I have told you.

Mt 28:8
And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great Joy. And did run to bring his disciples word.

Mt 28:9
And as they went to tell his disciples: behold, Iesus met them saying: God speed you. They came and held him by the feet and worshipped him.

Mt 28:10
Then said Iesus unto them: be not afraid. Go and tell my brethren, that they go into Galile, and there shall they see me.

Mt 28:11
When they were gone: behold, some of the keepers came in to the city, and shewed unto the prelates, all the things which had happened.

Mt 28:12
And they gathered them together with the seniors, and took counsel, and gave large money unto the soldiers,

Mt 28:13
saying: Say that his disciples came by night, and stole him away while ye slept.

Mt 28:14
And if this come to the ruler's ears, we will pease him, and make you safe.

Mt 28:15
And they took the money and did as they were taught. And this saying is noised among the jews unto this day.

Mt 28:16
Then the xj. disciples went away into Galile, into a mountain where Iesus had appointed them.

Mt 28:17
And when they saw him, they worshipped him. But some of them doubted.

Mt 28:18
Iesus came and spake unto them, saying: All power is given unto me in heaven, and in earth.

Mt 28:19
Go therefore and teach all nations, baptising them in the name of the father, and the son, and the holy ghost:

Mt 28:20
Teaching them to observe all things, whatsoever I commanded you. And lo, I am with you alway even until the end of the world. <Here endeth the gospell off S. Mathew.>

Mk 1:1
The beginning of the Gospell of Iesu Christ the son of God,

Mk 1:2
as it is written in the prophets, behold I send my messenger before thy face which shall prepare thy way before thee.

Mk 1:3
The voice of one that crieth in the wilderness: prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

Mk 1:4
Ihon did baptise in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance, for the remission of sins.

Mk 1:5
And all the land of jewry, and they of Ierusalem went out unto him, and were all baptised of him in the river Iordan, knowledging, their sins.

Mk 1:6
Ihon was clothed with camel's hair, and with a girdle of a beast's skin about his loins. And he ate locusts and wild honey,

Mk 1:7
and preached saying: a stronger then I cometh after me, whose shoe latchet I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.

Mk 1:8
I have baptised you with water: but he shall baptise you with the holy ghost.

Mk 1:9
And it came to pass in those days, that Iesus came from Nazareth, a city of Galile: and was baptised of Ihon in Iordan.

Mk 1:10
And immediately he came out of the water, and saw the heavens open, and the holy ghost descending upon him like a dove.

Mk 1:11
And there came a voice from heaven: Thou art my dear son, in whom I delight.

Mk 1:12
And immediately the spirit drove him into a wilderness:

Mk 1:13
and he was there in the wilderness xl. days, and was tempted of Satan, and was with wild beasts. And the angels ministered unto him.

Mk 1:14
After that Ihon was taken, Iesus came into Galile, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,

Mk 1:15
and saying: the time is ful come, and the kingdom of God is even at hand, repent and believe the gospel.

Mk 1:16
As he walked by the sea of Galile, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting nets into the sea, for they were fishers.

Mk 1:17
And Iesus said unto them: follow me, and I will make you to be fishers of men.

Mk 1:18
And they straightway forsook their nets, and followed him.

Mk 1:19
And when he had gone a little further thence, he saw Iames the son of Zebede, and Ihon his brother, even as they were in the ship dressing their nets.

Mk 1:20
And anon he called them. And they left their father Zebede in the ship with his hired servants, and went their way after him.

Mk 1:21
And they entered into Capernaum, and straight way on the Sabbath days he entered into the synagogue and taught.

Mk 1:22
And they marvelled at his learning. For he taught them as one which had power with him, and not as the scribes did.

Mk 1:23
And there was in the Synagogue, a man vexed with an unclean spirit, and he cried

Mk 1:24
saying: let me alone: what have we to do with thee Iesus of Nazareth? Art thou come to destroy us? I know what thou art, thou art that holy man promised of God.

Mk 1:25
And Iesus rebuked him, saying: hold thy peace and come out of the man.

Mk 1:26
And the unclean spirit tare him, cried out with a loud voice, and came out of him.

Mk 1:27
And they were all amazed, insomuch that they demanded one of another among themselves, saying: what thing is this? what new doctrine is this? for he commandeth the foul spirits with power, and they obey him.

Mk 1:28
Anon his name spread abroad throughout all the region bordering on Galile.

Mk 1:29
And immediately as soon as they were come out of the Synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew with Iames and Ihon.

Mk 1:30
Simon's motherinlaw lay sick of a fever, and anon they told him of her.

Mk 1:31
And he came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and the fever forsook her by and by: And she ministered unto them.

Mk 1:32
And at even when the sun was down, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils,

Mk 1:33
and all the city gathered together at the door,

Mk 1:34
and he healed many that were sick of divers diseases. And he cast out many: devils and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.

Mk 1:35
And in the morning very early, Iesus arose and went out into a solitary place, and there prayed.

Mk 1:36
And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.

Mk 1:37
And when they had found him, they said unto him: all men seek for thee.

Mk 1:38
And he said unto them: let us go in to the next towns, that I may preach there also: for truly I came out for that purpose.

Mk 1:39
And he preached in their synagogues, throughout all Galile, and cast devils out.

Mk 1:40
And there came a leper to him beseeching him, and kneeled down unto him, and said unto him: if thou wilt, thou arte able to make me clean.

Mk 1:41
Iesus had compassion on him, and put forth his hand, touched him, and said unto him: I will, be clean.

Mk 1:42
And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.

Mk 1:43
and he charged him and sent him away forthwith

Mk 1:44
and said unto him: See that thou tell no man, but get thee hence and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, those things which Moses commanded, for a testimonial unto them.

Mk 1:45
But he (as soon as he was departed) began to tell many things and to publish the deed, insomuch that Iesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places, and they came to him from every quarter.

Mk 2:1
After a few days he entered into Capernaum again, and it was noised that he was in a house:

Mk 2:2
And anon many gathered togedder, insomuch that now there was no room to receive them: no, not in places about the door. And he preached unto them.

Mk 2:3
And there came unto him that brought one sick of the palsy, borne of four men:

Mk 2:4
and because they could not come nye unto him for press: They opened the roof of the house where he was. And when they had broken it open, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.

Mk 2:5
When Iesus saw their faith, he said to the sick of the palsy, son thy sins are forgiven thee.

Mk 2:6
There were certain of the scribes sitting, and reasoning in their hearts:

Mk 2:7
how doth this fellow so blaspheme? Who can forgiven sins, but God only?

Mk 2:8
And immediately when Iesus perceived in his spirit, that they so reasoned in themselves, he said unto them: why think ye such things in your hearts?

Mk 2:9
Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, thy sins are forgiven thee: or to say, arise, take up thy bed and walk?

Mk 2:10
That ye may know that the son of man hath power in earth to forgive sins, he spake unto the sick of the palsy:

Mk 2:11
I say unto thee, arise and take up thy bed, and get thee hence into thine own house.

Mk 2:12
And by and by he arose, took up his bed, and went forth before them all: in so much that they were all amazed, and glorified God saying: we never saw it on this fashion.

Mk 2:13
And he went out again unto the sea, and all the people resorted unto him, and he taught them.

Mk 2:14
And as Iesus passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphey, sit at the receipt of custom and said unto him: follow me. And he arose and followed him.

Mk 2:15
And it came to pass, as Iesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat at meat also with Iesus and his disciples. For there were many that followed him.

Mk 2:16
And when the scribes and pharises saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples: how is it, that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?

Mk 2:17
When Iesus heard that, he said unto them. The whole have no need of the Physician: but the sick. I came to call the sinners to repentance, and not the just.

Mk 2:18
And the disciples of Ihon and of the pharises did fast, and they came and said unto him: Why do the disciples of Ihon and of the pharises fast, and thy disciples fast not.

Mk 2:19
And Iesus said unto them: can the children of a wedding fast, while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.

Mk 2:20
But the days will come when the bridegroom shall be taken from them and then shall they fast in those days.

Mk 2:21
Also no man soweth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for then taketh he away the new piece from the old, and so is the rent worse.

Mk 2:22
In like wise, no man poureth new wine into old vessels, for if he do the new wine breaketh the vessels, and the wine runneth out, and the vessels are marred. But new wine must be poured into new vessels.

Mk 2:23
And it chanced that he went thorow the corn fields on the saboth day, and his disciples as they went on their way, began to pluck the ears of corn.

Mk 2:24
And the pharises said unto him: Take heed why do they on the saboth day that which is unlawful?

Mk 2:25
And he said to them: have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungered both he and they that were with him?

Mk 2:26
How they went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the hallowed loaves, which is not lawful but for the priests only to eat: and gave also to them which were with him?

Mk 2:27
And he said to them: the saboth day was made for man, and not man for the saboth day.

Mk 2:28
Wherefore is the son of man Lord even of the saboth day.

Mk 3:1
And he entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man which had a withered hand:

Mk 3:2
and they watched him to see, if he would heal him on the saboth day, that they might accuse him.

Mk 3:3
And he said unto the man which had the withered hand: arise and stand in the midst.

Mk 3:4
And he said to them: whether is it lawful to do a good deed on the saboth day, or an evil? to save a man's life, or to kill? But they held their peace.

Mk 3:5
And he looked round about on them angerly mourning on the blindness of their hearts. And said to the man: stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it forth: And the hand was restored, even as whole as the other.

Mk 3:6
The pharises departed, and straightway gathered a counsel with them that belonged to Herode against him, that they might destroy him.

Mk 3:7
And Iesus avoided with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude followed him from Galilee and from Jewry,

Mk 3:8
and from Hierusalem, and from Idumea, and from beyond Iordan: and they that dwelled about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude: which when they had heard what things he did, came unto him.

Mk 3:9
And he commanded his disciples, that a ship should wait on him, because of the people, lest they should throng him.

Mk 3:10
For he had healed many, in so much that they pressed upon him, for to touch him, as many as had plagues.

Mk 3:11
And when the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down before him, and cried saying: thou art the son of God:

Mk 3:12
And he straightly charged them that they should not utter him.

Mk 3:13
And he went up into a mountain, and called unto him whom he would, and they came unto him.

Mk 3:14
And he ordained the twelve that they should be with him, and that he might send them to preach.

Mk 3:15
And that they might have power to heal sicknesses and to cast out devils.

Mk 3:16
And he gave Simon, to name, Peter.

Mk 3:17
And he called Iames the son of Zebedee, and Ihon Iames brother, and gave them Bonargs to name, which is to say the sons of thunder.

Mk 3:18
And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartelemew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and Iames the son of Alphey, and Taddeus, and Simon of Cane,

Mk 3:19
and Iudas Iscarioth, which same also betrayed him.

Mk 3:20
And they came unto house, and the people assembled together again, so greatly that they had not leisure so much as to eat bread.

Mk 3:21
And when they that longed unto him heard of it, they went out to hold him. For they said, he is too fervent.

Mk 3:22
And the scribes which came from Ierusalem, said: he hath Beelzebub, and by the power of the chief devil, casteth out devils.

Mk 3:23
And he called them unto him, and in similitudes said unto them. How can Satan drive out Satan?

Mk 3:24
For if a realm be divided against itself, that realm cannot endure.

Mk 3:25
And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot continue:

Mk 3:26
So if Satan make insurrection against himself, and be divided, he cannot continue, but hath an end.

Mk 3:27
No man can enter into a strong man's house, and take away his goods, except he first bind that strong man and then spoil his house.

Mk 3:28
Verily I say unto you all sins shall be forgiven unto men's children: and blasphemy, wherewith they blaspheme:

Mk 3:29
but he that blasphemeth the holy ghost, shall never have forgiveness: but is in danger of eternal damnation.

Mk 3:30
For they said, he had an unclean spirit.

Mk 3:31
And there came his mother and his brethren, and stood without, and sent unto him and called him:

Mk 3:32
And the people sat about him, and said unto him: behold thy mother and thy brethren seek for thee without.

Mk 3:33
And he answered them, saying: who is my mother, and my brethren?

Mk 3:34
And he looked round about on his disciples, which sat in compass about him, and said: behold my mother, and my brethren:

Mk 3:35
For whosoever doeth the will of God, he is my brother, my sister and mother.

Mk 4:1
And he began again to teach by the seaside. And there gathered together unto him much people, so greatly that he entered in to a ship, and sat in the sea, and all the people was by the seaside on the shore:

Mk 4:2
And he taught them many things in similitudes, and said unto them in his doctrine.

Mk 4:3
Hearken to. Behold, The sower went out to sow,

Mk 4:4
and it fortuned as he sowed, that some fell by the wayside, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

Mk 4:5
Some fell on a stony ground: where it had not much earth: and by and by sprang up, because it had not depth of earth,

Mk 4:6
and as soon as the sun was up it caught heat: and because it had not rooting it withered away.

Mk 4:7
And some fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, so that it gave no fruit.

Mk 4:8
And some fell upon good ground: and did yield fruit that sprang and grew: and brought forth some thirty fold, some forty fold, and some an hundred fold.

Mk 4:9
And he said unto them: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

Mk 4:10
When he was alone, they that were, about him with the twelve asked him of the similitude.

Mk 4:11
And he said unto them: To you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: But unto them that are without, shall all things be done in similitudes:

Mk 4:12
that when they see, they shall see, and not discern: and when they hear they shall hear, and not understand: lest at any time they should turn, and their sins should be forgiven them.

Mk 4:13
And he said unto them: Perceive ye not this similitude. And how ye shall know all similitudes?

Mk 4:14
The sower soweth the word.

Mk 4:15
These be they which are by the ways side, where the word is sown, to whom as soon as they have heard it, cometh the devil and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.

Mk 4:16
And these also are they that are sown on the stony ground: which when they have heard the word, at once they receive it with joy,

Mk 4:17
yet have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a season: afterward as soon as any trouble or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, anon they fall.

Mk 4:18
And these are they that are sown among the thorns, which hear the word of God,

Mk 4:19
and the care of this world and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things enter in, and choke the word, and it is made unfruitful.

Mk 4:20
And these that were sown in good ground, are they that hear the word and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirty fold some sixty fold, some an hundred fold.

Mk 4:21
And he said unto them: is the candle lighted, to be put under a bushel, or under the bord: is it not therefore lighted that it should be put on a candlestick?

Mk 4:22
For there is nothing so privy, that shall not be opened: neither so secret, but that it shall come abroad.

Mk 4:23
If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

Mk 4:24
And he said unto them: take heed what ye hear. With what measure ye mete, with the same shall it be measured unto you again. And unto you that have shall more be given.

Mk 4:25
For unto him that hath, shall it be given: And unto him that hath not, shall be taken away, even that he hath.

Mk 4:26
And he said: so is the kingdom of God, even as if a man should sow seed in the ground,

Mk 4:27
and should sleep and rise up night and day: and the seed should spring, and grow up while he is not ware.

Mk 4:28
For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself, first the blade, then the ears, after that full corn in the ears.

Mk 4:29
And as soon as the fruit is brought forth, anon he thrusteth in the sickle because that harvest is come.

Mk 4:30
And he said: whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?

Mk 4:31
It is like a grain of mustard seed, which when it is sown in the earth, is the least of all seeds that be in the earth:

Mk 4:32
And after that it is sown it groweth up, and is greatest of all herbs: and beareth great branches so that the fowls of the air may dwell under the shadow of it.

Mk 4:33
And with many such similitudes he preached the word unto them, after as they might hear it.

Mk 4:34
And without similitude spake he nothing unto them. But when they were apart, he expounded all things to his disciples.

Mk 4:35
And the same day when even was come he said unto them: let us pass over into the other side.

Mk 4:36
And they late the people depart and took him even as he was in the ship. There were also with him other ships.

Mk 4:37
And there arose a great storm of wind, and dashed the waves into the ship, so that it was full.

Mk 4:38
And he was in the stern asleep on a pillow. And they awoke him, and said to him: Master, carest thou not that we perish?

Mk 4:39
And he rose up and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea: peace and be still. And the wind allayed, and there followed a great calm:

Mk 4:40
and he said unto them: why are ye fearful? How is it that ye have no faith?

Mk 4:41
And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another: what fellow is this? for both wind and sea obey him.

Mk 5:1
And they came over to the other side of the sea into the country of the Gaderens.

Mk 5:2
And when he was come out of the ship, anon met him out of the graves a man possessed of an unclean spirit,

Mk 5:3
which had his abiding among the graves. And no man could bind him with chains,

Mk 5:4
because that when he was often bound with fetters and chains, he plucked the chains asunder, and brake the fetters in pieces: Neither could any man tame him.

Mk 5:5
And always both night and day he cried in the mountains and in the graves and beat himself with stones.

Mk 5:6
When he had spied Iesus afar off, he ran, and worshipped him,

Mk 5:7
and cried with a loud voice and said: what have I to do, with thee Iesus the son of the most highest God? I require thee in the name of God, that thou torment me not.

Mk 5:8
For he had said unto him: Come forth of the man thou foul spirit.

Mk 5:9
And he asked him: what is thy name? and he answered him, my name is Legion, for we are many.

Mk 5:10
And he prayed him instantly, that he would not send them away out of that region.

Mk 5:11
There was there nye unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding,

Mk 5:12
and all the devils besought him saying: send us into the herd of swine, that we may enter into them.

Mk 5:13
And anon Iesus gave them leave, And the unclean spirits went out and entered into the swine. And the herd startled, and ran headlong into the sea. They were about ijM. swine, and they were drowned in the sea.

Mk 5:14
And the swine herders fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they came out for to see, what had happened.

Mk 5:15
And they came out to Iesus, and they saw him that was vexed with the fiend and had the legion sit, both clothed and in his right mind, and were afraid.

Mk 5:16
And they that saw it told them, how it had happened unto him that was possessed with the devil: and also of the swine.

Mk 5:17
And they began to pray him, that he would depart from their coasts.

Mk 5:18
And when he was come into the ship, he that had the devil prayed him that he might be with him.

Mk 5:19
Iesus would not suffer him but said unto him: go home into thine own house and to thy friends, and shew them what things the Lord hath done unto thee, and how he had compassion on thee.

Mk 5:20
And he departed, and began to publish in the ten cities, what things Iesus had done unto him, and all men did marvel.

Mk 5:21
And when Iesus was come over again in the ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him, and he was nye unto the sea.

Mk 5:22
And behold, there came unto him one of the rulers of the Synagogue, whose name was Iairus: and when he saw him, he fell down at his feet,

Mk 5:23
and besought him greatly saying: my daughter lieth at point of death, I would thou wouldst come and lay thy hand on her, that she might be safe and live.

Mk 5:24
And he went with him, and much people followed him, and thronged him.

Mk 5:25
And there was a woman, which was diseased of an issue of blood twelve year,

Mk 5:26
and had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and felt none amendment at all: But waxed worse and worse.

Mk 5:27
When she had heard of Iesus: she came into the press behind him, and touched his garment.

Mk 5:28
For she said: If I may but touch his clothing, I shall be whole.

Mk 5:29
And straight way her fountain of blood was dried up, and she felt in her body, that she was healed of the plague.

Mk 5:30
And Iesus immediately felt in himself, the vertue that went out of him, and turned him round about in the press, and said: Who touched my clothes?

Mk 5:31
And his disciples said unto him: thou seest the people thrusting thee on every side, and yet sayest: who did touch me?

Mk 5:32
And he looked round about, for to see her that had done that thing.

Mk 5:33
The woman feared and trembled, for she knew what was done within her. And she came and fell down before him and told him the truth of everything.

Mk 5:34
And he said unto her: Daughter, thy faith hath saved thee, go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.

Mk 5:35
While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's house, certain which said: thy daughter is dead: why diseasest thou the Master any further?

Mk 5:36
As soon as Iesus heard that word spoken, he said unto the ruler of the Synagogue: Be not afraid, only believe.

Mk 5:37
And he suffered no man to follow him more than Peter, and Iames and Ihon Iames brother.

Mk 5:38
And he came unto the house of the ruler of the Synagogue, and saw the wondering and them that wept and wailed greatly.

Mk 5:39
And he went in and said unto them: Why make ye this ado and weep? The maiden is not dead, but sleepeth.

Mk 5:40
And they laughed him to scorn. Then he put them all out, and took the father and the mother of the maiden, and them that were with him, and entered in where the maiden lay,

Mk 5:41
And took the maiden by the hand, and said unto her: Tabitha, cumi: which is by interpretation: maiden I say unto thee, arise.

Mk 5:42
