He said also unto his disciples. There was a certain rich man, which had a steward, that was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.

Lk 16:2
And he called him, and said unto him: How is it, that I hear this of thee? Give accounts of thy stewardship. For thou mayest be no longer my steward.

Lk 16:3
The steward said within himself: what shall I do? for my master will take away from me the stewardship. I cannot dig, and to beg, I am ashamed.

Lk 16:4
I wot what to do, that when I am put out of my stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

Lk 16:5
Then called he all his master's debtors, and said unto the first: how much owest thou unto my master?

Lk 16:6
And he said: an hundred tuns of oil, and he said to him: take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.

Lk 16:7
Then said he to another: what owest thou? And he said: an hundred quarters of wheat. He said to him: Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

Lk 16:8
And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely. For the children of this world, are in their kind, wiser then the children of light.

Lk 16:9
And I say also unto you: make you friends of the wicked mammon, that when ye shall have need they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

Lk 16:10
He that is faithful in that which is least: the same is faithful in much.

Lk 16:11
So then if ye have not been faithful in the wicked mammon? who will believe you in that which is true?

Lk 16:12
and if ye have not been faithful in another man's business: who shall give you your own?

Lk 16:13
No servant can serve two masters, for either he shall hate the one and love the other, or else he shall lean to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God, and mammon.

Lk 16:14
All these things heard the pharises also which were covetous. And they mocked him,

Lk 16:15
and he said unto them: Ye are they, which justify yourselves before men: but God knoweth your hearts. For that which men magnify, is abominable in the sight of God.

Lk 16:16
The law, and the prophets reigned until the time of Ihon: Since that time, the kingdom of God is preached, and every man striveth to go in.

Lk 16:17
Sooner shall heaven and earth perish, than one tittle of the law shall perish.

Lk 16:18
Whosoever forsaketh his wife, and marrieth another, breaketh matrimony. And every man which marrieth her that is divorced from her husband committeth advoutry also.

Lk 16:19
There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple, and fine rayons, and fared deliciously every day.

Lk 16:20
And there was a certain beggar, named Lazarus, which lay at his gate full of sores

Lk 16:21
desiring to be refreshed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's board. Nevertheless, the dogs came, and licked his sores.

Lk 16:22
And it fortuned that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: The rich man also died, and was buried in hell.

Lk 16:23
When he lift up his eyes, as he was in torments, he saw Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom,

Lk 16:24
And cried and said: father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue, for I am tormented in this flame.

Lk 16:25
Abraham said unto him: Son remember, that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy pleasure, and contrariwise Lazarus pain. Now therefore is he comforted, and thou art punished.

Lk 16:26
Beyond all this between you and us there is a great space set, so that they which would go from hence to you, cannot: neither from thence come hither.

Lk 16:27
And he said: I pray thee therefore father, send him to my father's house.

Lk 16:28
For I have five brethren: for to warn them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

Lk 16:29
Abraham said unto him: they have Moses and the prophets, let them hear them.

Lk 16:30
And he said: nay father Abraham, but if one from the dead came unto them they would repent.

Lk 16:31
He said unto him: If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they believe, though one rose from death again.

Lk 17:1
Then said he to his disciples, it cannot be avoided, but that occasions of evil come. Nevertheless woe be to him throwe whom they come.

Lk 17:2
It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and that he were cast into the sea, rather then he should offend one of these little ones.

Lk 17:3
Take heed to your selves, if thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him: and if he repent, forgive him.

Lk 17:4
And though he sin against thee seven times in one day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee saying: it repenteth me, forgive him.

Lk 17:5
And the apostles said unto the Lord: increase our faith.

Lk 17:6
The Lord said: if ye had faith like a grain of mustard seed, and should say unto this sycamine tree, pluck thyself up by the roots, and plant thyself in the sea: he should obey you.

Lk 17:7
Which of you having a servant a plowing, or feeding cattle, would say unto him when he were come from the field: Go quickly and sit down to meat.

Lk 17:8
And rather sayeth not to him, dress wherewith I may sup, and appoint thyself and serve me, till I have eaten and drunk: and afterward, eat thou, and drink thou?

Lk 17:9
Doeth he thank that servant because he did that which was commanded unto him? I trow not.

Lk 17:10
So likewise ye, when ye have done all those things which are commanded unto you: say, we are unprofitable servants. We have done that which was our duty to do.

Lk 17:11
And it chanced as he went to Ierusalem, that he passed thorow Samaria and Galile.

Lk 17:12
And as he entered into a certain town, there met him ten men, that were lepers, which stood afar off,

Lk 17:13
and put forth their voices, and said: Iesu master, have mercy on us.

Lk 17:14
When he saw them, he said unto them: Go and shew yourselves to the priests. And it chanced as they went, they were cleansed.

Lk 17:15
And one of them, when he saw that he was cleansed, turned back again, and with a loud voice praised God,

Lk 17:16
and fell down on his face at his feet, and gave him thanks. And the same was a Samaritan.

Lk 17:17
Iesus answered and said: Are there not ten cleansed? But where are those nine?

Lk 17:18
There are not found that returned again, to give God praise, save only this stranger.

Lk 17:19
And he said unto him: Arise, and go thy way, thy faith hath saved thee.

Lk 17:20
When he was demanded of the pharises, when the kingdom of God should come: he answered them and said: The kingdom of God cometh not with waiting for.

Lk 17:21
Neither shall men say, Lo here, lo there. For behold, the kingdom of God is within you.

Lk 17:22
And he said unto the disciples: The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one day of the son of man, and ye shall not see it.

Lk 17:23
And they shall say to you: See here, See there. Go not after them, nor follow them,

Lk 17:24
for as the lightning that appeareth out of the one part of the heaven, and shineth unto the other part of heaven. So shall the son of man be in his days.

Lk 17:25
But first must he suffer many things, and be reproved of this nation.

Lk 17:26
As it happened in the time of Noe So shall it be in the time of the son of man.

Lk 17:27
They ate, they drank, they married wives and were married even unto the same day that Noe went into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

Lk 17:28
Likewise also, as it chanced in the days of Lot. They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built.

Lk 17:29
And even the same day that Lot went out of Zodom, it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.

Lk 17:30
After these ensamples, shall the day be, when the son of man shall appear.

Lk 17:31
At that day he that is on the house top, and his stuff in the house: let him not come down to take it out. And likewise let not him that is in the fields, turn back again to that he left behind.

Lk 17:32
Remember Lot's wife.

Lk 17:33
Whosoever will go about to save his life, shall lose it: And whosoever shall lose his life, shall quicken it.

Lk 17:34
I tell you: In that night, there shall be two in one bed, the one shall be received, and the other shall be forsaken.

Lk 17:35
Two shall be also a grinding together: the one shall be received, and the other forsaken.

Lk 17:36
Two in the field, the one shall be received, and the other forsaken.

Lk 17:37
And they answered, and said to him: where Lord? And he said unto them: wheresoever The body shall be, thither will the eagles resort.

Lk 18:1
He put forth a similitude unto them, signifying that men ought always to pray, and not to be weary,

Lk 18:2
saying: There was a Judge in a certain city, which feared not God neither regarded man.

Lk 18:3
And there was a certain widow in the same city, which came unto him saying: Avenge me of mine adversary.

Lk 18:4
And a great while he would not. Afterward he said unto himself: Though I fear not God, nor care for man,

Lk 18:5
yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest at the last she come, and rail on me.

Lk 18:6
And the Lord said: hear what the unrighteous judge sayeth.

Lk 18:7
And shall not God avenge his elect, which cry night and day unto him? Yea though he defer them:

Lk 18:8
I tell you, he will avenge them, and that quickly. Nevertheless, when the son of man cometh, suppose ye, that he shall find faith on earth.

Lk 18:9
And he put forth this similitude, unto certain which trusted in themselves, that they were perfect, and despised other.

Lk 18:10
Two men went up into the temple to pray: the one a pharise, and the other a publican.

Lk 18:11
The pharise stood and prayed thus with himself. God I thank thee that I am not as other are, extortioners, unjust, advoutrers, and even as the publican is.

Lk 18:12
I fast twice in the week. I give tithe of all that I possess.

Lk 18:13
And the publican stood afar off, and would not lift up his eyes to heaven, but smote his breast, saying: God be mercyfull to me a sinner.

Lk 18:14
I tell you: this man departed home to his house justified more than the other. For every man that exalteth himself, shall be brought low: And he that humbleth himself, shall be exalted.

Lk 18:15
They brought unto him also babes, that he should touch them. When his disciples saw that, they rebuked them.

Lk 18:16
But Iesus called them unto him, and said: Suffer children to come unto me, and forbid them not. For unto such, belongeth the kingdom of God.

Lk 18:17
Verily I say unto you: whosoever receiveth not the kingdom of God, as a child: he shall not enter therein.

Lk 18:18
And a certain ruler asked him: saying: Good Master: what ought I to do, to obtain eternal life?

Lk 18:19
Iesus said unto him: Why callest thou me good? No man is good, save God only.

Lk 18:20
Thou knowest the commandments: Thou shalt not commit advoutry, thou shalt not kill, thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not bear false witness, Honour thy father, and thy mother.

Lk 18:21
And he said: All these have I kept from my youth.

Lk 18:22
When Iesus heard that, he said unto him: Yet lackest thou one thing. Sell all that thou hast, and distribute it unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come, and follow me.

Lk 18:23
When he heard that, he was heavy, for he was rich.

Lk 18:24
When Iesus saw him mourn, he said: with what difficulty shall they that have riches, enter into the kingdom of God:

Lk 18:25
Easier it is for a camel to pass thorow a needles eye, then for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

Lk 18:26
Then said they that heard that: And who shall then be saved?

Lk 18:27
He said: Things which are unpossible with men: are possible with God.

Lk 18:28
Then Peter said: Lo we have forsaken all, and have followed thee.

Lk 18:29
He said unto them: Verily I say unto you, there is no man that forsaketh house, other father and mother, other brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of Godde's sake,

Lk 18:30
which same shall not receive much more in this world: and in the world to come, life everlasting.

Lk 18:31
He took unto him twelve, and said unto them: Lo we go up to Ierusalem, and all shall be fulfilled that are written by the prophets of the son of man.

Lk 18:32
He shall be delivered unto the gentiles, and shall be mocked, and shall be despitefully entreated, and shall be spitted on:

Lk 18:33
and when they have scourged him, they will put him to death, and the third day, shall he arise again.

Lk 18:34
They understood none of these things. And this saying was hid from them. And they perceived not the things which were spoken.

Lk 18:35
It came to pass, as they were come nye unto Iericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging.

Lk 18:36
And when he heard the people pass by, he asked what it meant.

Lk 18:37
They said unto him that Iesus of Nazareth, went by.

Lk 18:38
And he cried, saying: Iesus the son of David, have mercy on me.

Lk 18:39
And they which went before rebuked him, because he should hold his peace. And he much the more cried, The son of David, have mercy on me.

Lk 18:40
Iesus stood still, and commanded him, to be brought unto him. And when he was come near, he asked him

Lk 18:41
saying: What wilt thou, that I do unto thee? And he said: Lord, that I may receive my sight.

Lk 18:42
Iesus said unto him: Receive thy sight: Thy faith hath saved thee.

Lk 18:43
And immediately he saw, and followed him, praising God. And all the people, when they saw it, gave laud to God.

Lk 19:1
And he entered in, and went thorow Iericho.

Lk 19:2
And behold, there was a man named Zacheus, which was a ruler among the publicans, and rich also.

Lk 19:3
And he made means to see Iesus, what he should be: and he could not for the press, because he was of a low stature.

Lk 19:4
And he ran before, and ascended up, into a sycomore tree, to see him. For he would come that same way.

Lk 19:5
And when Iesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him: Zache, at once come down, for today I must abide at thy house.

Lk 19:6
And hastily he came down, and received him joyfully.

Lk 19:7
And when they saw that, they all grudged saying: He is gone, into tarry with a man that is a sinner.

Lk 19:8
Zache stood forth and said unto the Lord: Behold Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor, and if I have done any man wrong, I will restore him four fold.

Lk 19:9
Iesus said to him: This day is health come unto this house, forasmuch as it also is become the child of Abraham.

Lk 19:10
For the son of man is come to seek, and to save that which was lost.

Lk 19:11
As they heard these things, he added thereto a similitude, because he was nye to Ierusalem, And because also, they thought that the kingdom of God should shortly appear.

Lk 19:12
He said therefore: A certain noble man, went into a far country, to receive a kingdom, and then to come again.

Lk 19:13
He called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds saying unto them: Buy and sell till I come:

Lk 19:14
But his citizens hated him, and sent messengers after him, saying: We will not have this man to reign over us.

Lk 19:15
And it came to pass, when he was come again and had received his kingdom, he commanded his servants, to be called to him (to whom he gave his money) to wit what every man had done.

Lk 19:16
Then came the first saying: Lord, thy pound hath increased ten pounds.

Lk 19:17
And he said unto him: Well good servant, because thou wast faithful in a very little thing, Take thou authority over ten cities.

Lk 19:18
And the other came saying: Lord thy pound, hath increased five pounds.

Lk 19:19
And to the same he said: And be thou also ruler over five cities.

Lk 19:20
And the third came, and said: Lord, behold here thy pound, which I have kept in a napkin,

Lk 19:21
for I feared thee, because thou art a strait man: thou takest up that thou laidst not down, And reapest that thou didst not sow.

Lk 19:22
And he said unto him: Of thine own mouth judge I thee thou evil servant. Knewest thou that I am a strait man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow?

Lk 19:23
Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank? And then at my coming should I have required mine own, with vantage.

Lk 19:24
And he said to them that stood by: Take from him that pound, and give it him that hath ten pounds.

Lk 19:25
And they said unto him: Lord he hath ten pounds.

Lk 19:26
I say unto you, that unto all them that have, it shall be given: and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away.

Lk 19:27
Moreover those mine enemies, which would not, that should reign over them, bring hither, and slay them before me.

Lk 19:28
And when he had thus spoken, he proceeded forth before them, and went up to Ierusalem.

Lk 19:29
And it fortuned, when he was come nye to Bethphage and Bethany, besides mount Olivete, he sent two of his disciples

Lk 19:30
saying: Go ye in to the town which is over against you. In the which as soon as ye are come, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon, yet never man sat. Loose him and bring him hither.

Lk 19:31
And if any man ask you, why that ye loose him: thus say unto him, The Lord hath need of him.

Lk 19:32
They that were sent went their way, and found, even as he had said unto them.

Lk 19:33
And as they were a loosing the colt, the owners said unto them: why loose ye the colt?

Lk 19:34
And they said: for the Lord hath need of him.

Lk 19:35
And they brought him to Iesus. And they cast their raiment on the colt, and set Iesus theron.

Lk 19:36
And as he went they spread their clothes in the way.

Lk 19:37
When he was come where he should go down from the mount Olivete, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice, and to laud God with a loud voice, for all the miracles that they had seen,

Lk 19:38
saying: Blessed be the king that cometh in the name of the Lord: Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

Lk 19:39
And some of the pharises of the company, said unto him: Master rebuke thy disciples.

Lk 19:40
He answered, and said unto them: I tell you, if these hold their peace, the stones will cry.

Lk 19:41
And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept on it

Lk 19:42
saying: If thou hadst known those things which belong unto thy peace, even at this day? But now are they hid from thine eyes.

Lk 19:43
For the days shall come upon thee, And thine enemies shall compass thee about with a bank. And shall besiege thee round about, and keep thee in on every side,

Lk 19:44
And make thee even with the ground, with thy children which are in thee. And they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another, because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.

Lk 19:45
And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought

Lk 19:46
saying unto them, It is written, my house is the house of prayer: But ye have made it a den of thieves.

Lk 19:47
And he taught daily in the temple. The high priests and the scribes and the chief of the people, went about to destroy him:

Lk 19:48
But could not find what to do. For all the people stuck by him. And gave him audience.

Lk 20:1
And it fortuned in one of those days, As he taught the people in the temple, And preached the gospel. The high priests and the scribes came unto him with the seniors,

Lk 20:2
And spake unto him, saying: Tell us by what authority thou doest these things? Other who is he that gave thee this authority?

Lk 20:3
He answered and said unto them: I also will ask you a question, and answer me:

Lk 20:4
was the baptism of Ihon, from heaven, or of men?

Lk 20:5
They thought within themselves saying: If we shall say from heaven: he will say: Why then believed ye him not?

Lk 20:6
But and if we shall say of men, all the people will stone us. For they surely believe that Ihon was a prophet.

Lk 20:7
And they answered that they could not tell whence it was.

Lk 20:8
And Iesus said unto them: Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

Lk 20:9
Then began he to put forth to the people, this similitude: A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to farmers, and went himself into a strange country for a great season.

Lk 20:10
And when the time came, he sent a servant to his tenants that they should give him of the fruits, of the vineyard. The tenants beat him: and sent him away empty.

Lk 20:11
And he ceased not thereby but sent yet another servant. And they beat him, and foul entreated him also, and sent him away empty.

Lk 20:12
Moreover, he sent the third Alsoo, And him they wounded, and cast him out.

Lk 20:13
Then said the lord of the vineyard: what shall I do? I will send my dear son, him peradventure they will reverence, when they see him.

Lk 20:14
When the farmers saw him, they thought in themselves, saying: this is the heir, come let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.

Lk 20:15
And they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him. Now what shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?

Lk 20:16
He will come and destroy those farmers, and will let out his vineyard to other. When they heard that, they said: God forbid.

Lk 20:17
He beheld them and said: what meaneth this then that is written: The stone that the builders refused, is made the head cornerstone?

Lk 20:18
whosoever stumble at that stone, shall be bruised: but on whosoever it fall, it will also break him.

Lk 20:19
And the high priests and the scribes, the same hour went about to lay hands on him, but they feared the people. For they perceived that he had spoken this similitude against them.

Lk 20:20
And they watched him, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves perfect, to take him in his words, and to deliver him unto the power, and authority of the president.

Lk 20:21
And they asked him saying: Master, we know that thou sayest, and teachest right, neither considerest thou any man's degree, but teachest the way of God truly.

Lk 20:22
Is it lawful for us to give Cesar tribute, or no?

Lk 20:23
He perceived their craftiness, and said unto them: Why tempt ye me?

Lk 20:24
Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? They answered and said: Cesar's.

Lk 20:25
And he said unto them: Give then unto Cesar, that which belongeth unto Cesar: And to God, that which pertaineth to God.

Lk 20:26
And they could not reprove his saying before the people. And they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

Lk 20:27
Then came to him certain of the Saduces which deny that there is any resurrection. And they asked him

Lk 20:28
saying: Master Moses wrote unto us, if any man's brother die having a wife, And the same die without issue: that then his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

Lk 20:29
There were seven brethren, and the first took a wife, and died without children.

Lk 20:30
And the second took the wife, and he died childless.

Lk 20:31
And the third took her, and in like wise the residue of the seven, And left no children behind them, and died.

Lk 20:32
Last of all the woman died also.

Lk 20:33
Now at the resurrection whose wife of them shall she be? for vij. had her to wife.

Lk 20:34
Iesus answered and said unto them: The children of this world marry wives, and are married,

Lk 20:35
but they which shall be worthy of that world, and the resurrection from death, neither marry wives,

Lk 20:36
neither are married, nor yet can die any more. For they are equal unto the angels: and are the sons of God, inasmuch as they are the children of the resurrection.

Lk 20:37
And that the dead shall rise again, even Moses signified besides the bush, when he said: the Lord God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Iacob.

Lk 20:38
For he is not the God of the dead, but of them which live. For all live in him.

Lk 20:39
Certain of the pharises answered and said: Master, thou hast well said.

Lk 20:40
And after that durst they not ask him any question at all.

Lk 20:41
Then said he unto them: how say they that Christ is David's son?

Lk 20:42
And David him self saith in the book of the Psalms: The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit on my right hand,

Lk 20:43
till I make thine enemies thy foot stool.

Lk 20:44
David then calleth him Lord: How is he also his son?

Lk 20:45
Then in the audience of all the people, he said unto his disciples,

Lk 20:46
beware of the scribes, which desire to go in long clothing: and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and chief rooms at feasts,

Lk 20:47
which devour widows' houses, and pray long under a colour: The same shall receive greater damnation.

Lk 21:1
As he beheld, he saw the rich men, how they cast in their offerings into the treasury.

Lk 21:2
He saw also a certain poor widow, which cast in thither two mites.

Lk 21:3
And he said: of a truth I say unto you, this poor widow hath put in more than they all.

Lk 21:4
For they all have of their superfluity added unto the offering of God: But she, of her penury, hath cast in all the substance that she had.

Lk 21:5
As some spake of the temple, how it was garnished with goodly stones, and jewels, he said.

Lk 21:6
The days will come, when of these things which ye see, shall not be left stone upon stone that shall not be thrown down.

Lk 21:7
And they asked him, saying: Master when shall these things be. And what signs will there be, when such things shall come to pass.

Lk 21:8
And he said: take heed, that ye be not deceived. For many will come in my name, saying of themselves, I am he. And the time draweth near. Follow ye not them therefore.

Lk 21:9
But when ye hear of war, and of dissension: be not afraid, for these things must first come: but the end followeth not by and by.

Lk 21:10
Then said he unto them: Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom,

Lk 21:11
and great earthquakes shall be in all quarters, and hunger, and pestilence, and fearful things. And great signs shall there be from heaven.

Lk 21:12
But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecute you, delivering you up, to the synagogues, and into prison, and bring you before kings, And rulers for my name's sake.

Lk 21:13
And this shall chance you for a testimonial.

Lk 21:14
Let it stick therefore fast in your hearts, not once to study before, what ye shall answer for yourselves:

Lk 21:15
For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, where against, all your adversaries shall not be able to speak nor resist.

Lk 21:16
Yea and ye shall be betrayed of your fathers and mothers, and of your brethren, and kinsmen, and lovers. And some of you shall they put to death.

Lk 21:17
And hated shall ye be of all men for my name's sake.

Lk 21:18
Yet there shall not one hair of your heads perish.

Lk 21:19
With your patience, possess your souls.

Lk 21:20
And when ye see Ierusalem besieged with an host, then understand, that the desolation of the same is nye.

Lk 21:21
Then let them which are in jewry fly to the mountains. And let them which are in the midst of it, depart out. And let not them that are in other countries, enter there in.

Lk 21:22
For these be the days of vengeance, to fulfil all that are written.

Lk 21:23
But woe be to them that be with child, and to them that give suck in those days, for there shall be great trouble in the land: and wrath over all this people.

Lk 21:24
And they shall fall on the edge of the sword. And they shall be led captive into all nations. And Ierusalem shall be trodden underfoot of the gentiles, until the time of the gentiles be fulfilled.

Lk 21:25
And there shall be signs, in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars: and in the earth the people shall be in such perplexity, that they shall not tell which way to turn themselves. The sea and the waves shall roar,

Lk 21:26
and men's hearts shall fail them for fear, and for looking after those things which shall come on the earth. For the powers of heaven shall move.

Lk 21:27
And then shall they see the son of man come in a cloud with power and great glory.

Lk 21:28
When these things begin to come to pass: then look up, and lift up your heads, for your redemption draweth nye.

Lk 21:29
And he shewed them a similitude: behold the fig tree, and all other trees,

Lk 21:30
when they shoot forth their buds, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is then nye at hand.

Lk 21:31
So likewise ye (when ye see these things come to pass) understand, that the kingdom of God is nye.

Lk 21:32
Verily I say unto you: this generation shall not pass, till all be fulfilled.

Lk 21:33
Heaven and earth shall pass: but my words shall not pass.

Lk 21:34
Take heed to yourselves, lest your hearts be overcome, with surfeiting and drunkenness, and cares of this world: and that, that day come on you unawares.

Lk 21:35
For as a snare shall it come on all them that sit on the face of the earth.

Lk 21:36
Watch therefore continually and pray, that ye may scape all this that shall come. And that ye may stand before the son of man.

Lk 21:37
In the day time taught he in the temple, and at night, he went out, and had abiding in the mount olivete.

Lk 21:38
And all the people came in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.

Lk 22:1
The feast of sweet bread drew nye which is called ester,

Lk 22:2
and the high priests, and scribes sought how to kill Iesus, but they feared the people.

Lk 22:3
Then entered Satan into Iudas, whose sur name was Iscariot (which was of the number of the twelve)

Lk 22:4
and he went his way, and communed with the high priests and officers, how he would betray him to them.

Lk 22:5
And they were glad: and promised to give him money.

Lk 22:6
And he consented, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them, when the people were away.

Lk 22:7
Then came the day of sweet bread, when of necessity the ester lamb must be offered.

Lk 22:8
And he sent Peter, and Ihon saying: Go and prepare us the ester lamb, that we may eat.

Lk 22:9
They said to him. Where wilt thou, that we prepare?

Lk 22:10
And he said unto them. Behold as ye enter into the city, there shall a man meet you bearing a pitcher of water, him follow into the same house that he entereth in,

Lk 22:11
and ye shall say unto the good man of the house. The master sayeth: Where is the guest chamber, where I shall eat mine ester lamb with my disciples?

Lk 22:12
And he shall shew you a great parlour paved. There make ready.

Lk 22:13
They went and found, as he had said unto them: and made ready the ester lamb.

Lk 22:14
And when the hour came, he sat down and the twelve Apostles with him.

Lk 22:15
And he said unto them: I have inwardly desired to eat this ester lamb with you before that I suffer.

Lk 22:16
For I say unto you: henceforth, I will not eat of it any more, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

Lk 22:17
And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said: Receive this, and divide it among you.

Lk 22:18
For I say unto you: I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God be come.

Lk 22:19
And he took bread, gave thanks, and brake it, and gave it unto them, saying: This is my body which is given for you. This do in the remembrance of me.

Lk 22:20
Likewise also, when they had supped, he took the cup saying: This is the cup, the new testament, in my blood, which shall for you be shed.

Lk 22:21
Yet behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me, is with me on the table.

Lk 22:22
And the son of man goeth as it is appointed: But woe be to that man by whom he is betrayed.

Lk 22:23
And they began to enquire among themselves, which of them it should be, that should do that.

Lk 22:24
And there was a strife among them, which of them should seem greatest.

Lk 22:25
And he said unto them: The kings of the gentiles reign over them, And they that bear rule over them, are called gracious lords.

Lk 22:26
But ye shall not be so. But he that is greatest among you, shall be as the youngest: And he that is chief, shall be as the minister.

Lk 22:27
For whether is greater, he that sitteth at meat: or he that serveth? Is not he that sitteth at meat? And I am among you, as he that ministereth.

Lk 22:28
Ye are they which have bidden with me in my temptations.

Lk 22:29
And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my father hath appointed to me:

Lk 22:30
that ye may eat, and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit on seats, and judge the twelve tribes of Israell.

Lk 22:31
And the Lord said: Simon, Simon, behold Satan hath desired you, to sift you, as it were wheat:

Lk 22:32
But I have prayed for thee that thy faith fail not. And when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.

Lk 22:33
And he said unto him. Lord, I am ready to go with thee into prison, and to death.

Lk 22:34
And he said: I tell thee Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, till thou have thrice denied that thou knewest me.

Lk 22:35
And he said unto them: when I sent you without wallet, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye anything? And they said, nothing.

Lk 22:36
And he said to them: But now he that hath a wallet let him take it, and likewise his scrip. And he that hath no sword, let him sell his coat and buy one.

Lk 22:37
I say unto you that yet, that which is written must be performed in me (Even with the wicked was he numbered) for those things which are written of me have an end.

Lk 22:38
And they said: Lord, behold here are two swords. And he said unto them: it is enough.

Lk 22:39
And he came out, and went as he was wont to mount Olivete. And the disciples followed him.

Lk 22:40
And when he came to the place, he said to them: Pray lest ye fall into temptation.

Lk 22:41
And he gat himself from them, about a stone's cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,

Lk 22:42
saying: Father if thou wilt, withdraw this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, But thine be fulfilled.

Lk 22:43
And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, comforting him.

Lk 22:44
And he was in agony, and prayed somewhat longer. And his sweat was like drops of blood, trickling down to the ground.

Lk 22:45
And he rose up from prayer, and came to his disciples, and found them sleeping for sorrow,

Lk 22:46
and said unto them: Why sleep ye? Rise, and pray lest ye fall into temptation.

Lk 22:47
While he yet spake: behold, there came a company, and he that was called Iudas, one of the twelve, went before them, and pressed nye unto Iesus to kiss him.

Lk 22:48
Iesus said unto him: Iudas betrayest thou the son of man with a kiss?

Lk 22:49
When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him. Lord, shall we smite with a sword.

Lk 22:50
And one of them smote a servant of him which was the chief priest of all, and smote off his right ear.

Lk 22:51
Iesus answered and said: Suffer ye thus far forth. And he touched his ear, and healed him.

Lk 22:52
Iesus said unto the high priests and rulers of the temple and the seniors which were come to him. Be ye come out, as unto a thief with swords and staves?

Lk 22:53
When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched not forth hands against me. But this is even your very hour, and the power of darkness.

Lk 22:54
Then took they him, and led him, and brought him to the high priest's house. And Peter followed afar off.

Lk 22:55
When they had kindled a fire in the midst of the palace, and were set down together, Peter also sat down among them.

Lk 22:56
And one of the wenches, as he sat, beheld him by the light and set good eyesight on him, and said: This same was also with him.

Lk 22:57
Then he denied him saying: Woman I know him not.

Lk 22:58
And after a little while, another saw him and said: Thou art also of them. And Peter said: Man I am not.

Lk 22:59
And about the space of an hour after another affirmed saying: Verily even this fellow was with him, for he is of Galile,

Lk 22:60
Peter said: Man I wot not what thou sayest. And immediately while he yet spake, the cock crew.

Lk 22:61
And the Lord turned back and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the words of the Lord, how he said unto him, before the cock crow thou shalt deny me thrice.

Lk 22:62
And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.

Lk 22:63
And the men that stood about Iesus, mocked him, and smote him,

Lk 22:64
and blindfolded him, and smote his face. And asked him saying: Arede who it is that smote thee?

Lk 22:65
And many other things despitefully said they against him.

Lk 22:66
And as soon as it was day, the seniors of the people, and the high priests and scribes, came together, and led him into their council saying:

Lk 22:67
Art thou very Christ? tell us. And he said unto them: if I shall tell you, ye will not believe.

Lk 22:68
And if also I ask you, ye will not answer me. Neither let me go.

Lk 22:69
Hereafter shall the son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.

Lk 22:70
Then said they all: Art thou then the son of God? He said: Ye say that I am.

Lk 22:71
Then said they: What need we any further witness? We ourselves have heard of his own mouth.

Lk 23:1
And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.

Lk 23:2
And they began to accuse him saying: We have found his fellow, perverting the people, and forbidding to pay tribute to Cesar: And sayeth that he is Christ a king.

Lk 23:3
And Pilate opposed him saying: Art thou the king of the jewes? He answered him, and said: thou sayest.

Lk 23:4
Then said Pilate to the high priests, and to the people: I find no fault in this man.

Lk 23:5
And they were the more fierce, saying: He moveth the people teaching thorowout jewry, and began at Galile, even to this place.

Lk 23:6
When Pilate heard mention of Galile, he asked whether the man were of Galilee.

Lk 23:7
And as soon as he knew that he was of Herode's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herode, which was at that time in Ierusalem also.

Lk 23:8
When Herode saw Iesus, he was marvelously glad. For he was desirous to see him of a long season, because he had heard many things of him, and trusted to have seen some miracle done by him.

Lk 23:9
Then questioned he with him of many things: But he answered him not one word.

Lk 23:10
The high priests and scribes, stood forth and accused him straitly.

Lk 23:11
And Herod, with his men of war, despised him, and mocked him, And arrayed him in white, and sent him again to Pilate.

Lk 23:12
And the same day Pilate, and Herod were made friends together. For before, they were at variance.

Lk 23:13
Pilate called together the high priests, and rulers, and the people,

Lk 23:14
and said unto them: Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverted the people. And lo I examined him before you, and have found no fault in this man, of those things whereof ye accuse him.

Lk 23:15
No nor yet Herode. For I sent you to him: and lo no thing worthy of death is done to him.

Lk 23:16
I will therefore chasten him and let him loose.

Lk 23:17
For of necessity, he must have let one loose unto them at that feast.

Lk 23:18
And all the people cried at once, saying: away with him, and deliver to us Barabbas.

Lk 23:19
(which for insurrection made in the city, and murder, was cast into prison)

Lk 23:20
Pilate spake again to them willing to let Iesus loose.

Lk 23:21
And they cried, saying: Crucify him, Crucify him.

Lk 23:22
He said unto them the third time: What harm hath he done? I find no cause of death in him. I will therefore chasten him, and let him go loose.

Lk 23:23
And they cried with loud voice, and required that he might be crucified. And the crying of the high priests prevailed.

Lk 23:24
And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required,

Lk 23:25
and let loose unto them, him that for insurrection, and murder was cast into prison, whom they desired: and delivered Iesus to do with him what they would.

Lk 23:26
And as they led him away, they caught one Simon of Syrene, coming out of the field: And on him laid they the cross to bear it after Iesus.

Lk 23:27
There followed him a great company of people, and of women, which women bewailed, and lamented him.

Lk 23:28
Iesus turned back unto them, and said: Daughters of Ierusalem, weep not for me: but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

Lk 23:29
For mark, the days will come, when men shall say: happy are the barren and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.

Lk 23:30
Then shall they begin to say to the mountains: fall on us. and to the hills cover us.

Lk 23:31
For if they do this to a green tree: what shall be done, to the dry?

Lk 23:32
There were two evil doers led with him to be slain.

Lk 23:33
And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the evil doers, one on right hand, and the other on the left hand.

Lk 23:34
Then said Iesus: Father forgive them, for they wot not what they do. And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.

Lk 23:35
And the people stood and beheld. And the rulers mocked him with them saying: He help other men, let him help himself if he be Christ the chosen of God.

Lk 23:36
The soldiers also mocked him, and came and gave him vinegar

Lk 23:37
and said: if thou be that king of the jews, save thyself.

Lk 23:38
His superscription was written over him, in greek, latin, and ebrue letters: This is the king of the jews.

Lk 23:39
The one of the malefactors which hanged, railed on him, saying: If thou be Christ save thyself and us.

Lk 23:40
The other answered and rebuked him saying: Neither fearest thou God because thou art in the same damnation?

Lk 23:41
We are righteously punished, for we receive according to our deeds: But this man hath done no thing amiss.

Lk 23:42
And he said unto Iesus: Lord remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.

Lk 23:43
And Iesus said unto him: Verily I say unto thee, today shalt thou be with me in paradise.

Lk 23:44
And it was about the sixth hour. And there came a darkness over all the land, until the ninth hour,

Lk 23:45
and the sun was darkened. And the veil of the temple rent even thorow the midst.

Lk 23:46
And Iesus cried with a great voice and said: Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit. And when he thus had said, he gave up the ghost.

Lk 23:47
When the Centurion saw, what had happened, he glorified God saying: Of a surety this man was perfect.

Lk 23:48
And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done: smote their breasts, and returned home.

Lk 23:49
And all his acquaintance stood afar off, and the women, which followed him from Galile, beholding these things.

Lk 23:50
And behold there was a man named Ioseph a senator, which was a good man and a just,

Lk 23:51
He did not consent to their counsel and deed, which was of Aramathia, a city of the jews. Which same also, waited for the kingdom of God:

Lk 23:52
he went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Iesus.

Lk 23:53
And took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid it in an hewn tomb, wherein was never man before laid.

Lk 23:54
And that day was the saboth even, And the saboth drew on.

Lk 23:55
The women that followed after which came with him from Galile, beheld the sepulchre and how his body was laid.

Lk 23:56
And they returned, and prepared odours, and ointments, And the saboth day they rested, according to the commandment.

Lk 24:1
On the morrow after the saboth, early in the morning, they came unto the tomb and brought the odours which they had prepared, and other women with them.

Lk 24:2
And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre,

Lk 24:3
and went in: but found not the body of the Lord Iesu.

Lk 24:4
And it happened, as they were amazed thereat: lo two men stood by them, in shining vestures.

Lk 24:5
And as they were afraid, and bowed down their faces to the earth: they said to them: why seek ye the living among the dead?

Lk 24:6
He is not here: but is risen. Remember how he spake unto you, when he was yet with you in Galile,

Lk 24:7
saying: that the son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

Lk 24:8
And they remembered his words,

Lk 24:9
and returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all other.

Lk 24:10
It was Mary Magdalene and Ioanna, and Mary Iacobi, And other that were with them, which told these things unto the Apostles,

Lk 24:11
and their words seemed unto them feigned things, neither believed they them.

Lk 24:12
Then arose Peter and ran unto the sepulchre, and stooped in, And saw the linen clothes laid by themself. And departed wondering in himself at that which had happened.

Lk 24:13
And behold, two of them went that same day to a town, which was from Ierusalem about three score furlongs, called Emaus:

Lk 24:14
and they talked together of all these things that had happened.

Lk 24:15
And it chanced, as they communed together, and reasoned, that Iesus himself drew near, and went with them.

Lk 24:16
But their eyes were holden, that they could not know him.

Lk 24:17
And he said unto them: What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another as ye walk, and are sad?

Lk 24:18
And the one of them named Cleopas, answered, and said unto him: art thou only a stranger in Ierusalem, and hast not known the things which have chanced therein in these days?

Lk 24:19
To whom he said: what things? And they said unto him: of Iesus of Nazareth which was a prophet, mighty in deed, and word, before God, and all the people.

Lk 24:20
And how the high priests, and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death: and have crucified him.

Lk 24:21
We trusted that it should have been he that should have delivered Israhell. And as touching all these things, today is even the third day, that they were done.

Lk 24:22
Yea and certain women also of our company made us astonied, which came early unto the sepulchre,

Lk 24:23
and found not his body. And came saying, that they had seen visions of angels which said that he was alive.

Lk 24:24
And certain of them which were with us, went their way to the sepulchre, and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.

Lk 24:25
And he said unto them: O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken.

Lk 24:26
Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?

Lk 24:27
And he began at Moses, and at all the prophets, and interpreted unto them, in all scriptures which were written of him.

Lk 24:28
And they drew nye unto the town which they went to. And he made, as though he would have gone further.

Lk 24:29
And constrained him, saying: Abide with us for it draweth towards night, and the day is far passed. And he went in to tarry with them.

Lk 24:30
And it came to pass as he sat at meat with them, he took bread and blessed it, and brake it and gave it unto them.

Lk 24:31
And their eyes were opened. And they knew him. And he vanished out of their sight,

Lk 24:32
and they said between themselves: did not our hearts burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and opened to us the scriptures?

Lk 24:33
And they rose up the same hour, and returned again to Ierusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,

Lk 24:34
saying: The Lord is risen in deed, and hath appeared to Simon.

Lk 24:35
And they told what things was done in the way, and how they knew him, by the breaking of bread.

Lk 24:36
As they thus spake, Iesus himself stood in the midst of them, and said unto them: peace be with you.

Lk 24:37
And they were abashed, and afraid, supposing that they had seen a spirit.

Lk 24:38
And he said unto them: Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

Lk 24:39
Behold my hands and my feet. For it is even I myself. Handle me and see. For spirits have not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.

Lk 24:40
And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them his hands, and his feet.

Lk 24:41
And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them: Have ye here any meat?

Lk 24:42
and they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.

Lk 24:43
And he took it, and ate it before them.

Lk 24:44
And he said unto them: These are the words, which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you: that all must be fulfilled which were written of me in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalmes.

Lk 24:45
Then opened he their wits, that they might understand the scriptures,

Lk 24:46
and said unto them: Thus is it written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise again from death the third day.

Lk 24:47
And that repentance, and remission of sins, should be preached in his name among all nations. And the beginning must be at Ierusalem.

Lk 24:48
And ye are witnesses of these things.

Lk 24:49
And behold, I will send the promise of my father upon you. But tarry ye in the city of Ierusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.

Lk 24:50
And he led them out into Bethany, and lift up his hands, and blest them.

Lk 24:51
And it came to pass, as he blessed them, he departed from them, and was carried up into heaven.

Lk 24:52
And they worshipped him, and returned to Ierusalem with great joy.

Lk 24:53
And were continually in the temple, praising, and lauding God. <Here endeth the gospell off Sanct Luke.>

Jn 1:1
In the beginning was that word, and that word was with god: and god was that word.

Jn 1:2
The same was in the beginning with god.

Jn 1:3
All things were made by it, and without it, was made no thing, that made was.

Jn 1:4
In it was life, And life was the light of men,

Jn 1:5
And the light shineth in the darkness, and darkness comprehended it not.

Jn 1:6
There was a man sent from god, whose name was Ihon.

Jn 1:7
The same came as a witness, to bear witness of the light, that all men through him might believe.

Jn 1:8
He was not that light: but to bear witness of the light.

Jn 1:9
That was a true light, which lighteneth all men that come into the world.

Jn 1:10
He was in the world, and the world by him was made: and the world knew him not.

Jn 1:11
He came among his own, and his received him not.

Jn 1:12
Unto as many as received him, gave he power to be the sons of god: in that they believed on his name:

Jn 1:13
which were born not of blood nor of the will of the flesh, nor yet of the will of man: but of god.

Jn 1:14
And that word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, and we saw the glory of it, as the glory of the only begotten son of the father, which word was full of grace, and verity.

Jn 1:15
Ihon bare witness of him saying: This was he of whom I spake, he that cometh after me, was before me because he was yer then I.

Jn 1:16
And of his fullness have all we received, even favour for favour.

Jn 1:17
For the law was given by Moses, but favour and verity came by Iesus Christ.

Jn 1:18
No man saw god at any time. The only begotten son, which is in the father's bosom, hath declared him.

Jn 1:19
And this is the record of Ihon: When the jewes sent priests, and levites from Ierusalem, to ask him, what art thou?

Jn 1:20
And he confessed, and denied not, and said plainly: I am not Christ.

Jn 1:21
And they asked him: what then? art thou Helias? And he said: I am not. Art thou a prophet? And he answered no.

Jn 1:22
Then said they unto him: what art thou? That we may give an answer to them that sent us? what sayest thou of thy self?

Jn 1:23
he said: I am the voice of a crier in the wilderness, make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Esayas.

Jn 1:24
And they which were sent, were of the pharises.

Jn 1:25
And they asked him, and said unto him: why baptisest thou then, if thou be not Christ, nor Helias, neither a prophet?

Jn 1:26
Ihon answered them saying: I baptise with water: but one is come among you, whom ye know not,

Jn 1:27
he it is that cometh after me, which was before me, whose shoe latchet I am not worthy to unloose.

Jn 1:28
These things were done in Bethabara beyond Iordan, where Ihon did baptise.

Jn 1:29
The next day, Ihon saw Iesus coming unto him, and said: behold the lamb of god, which taketh away the sin of the world.

Jn 1:30
This is he of whom I spake: After me cometh a man, which was before me. For he was yer then I,

Jn 1:31
and I knew him not: but that he should be declared to Israhell, therefore came I baptising with water.

Jn 1:32
And Ihon bare record, saying: I saw the spirit descend from heaven, like unto a dove, and it abode upon him, and I knew him not:

Jn 1:33
But he that sent me to baptise in water, said unto me: Upon whom thou shalt see the spirit descend, and tarry still on him, the same is he which baptiseth with the holy ghost.

Jn 1:34
And I saw it, and bare record, that this is the son of God.

Jn 1:35
The next day after Ihon stood again, and two of his disciples,

Jn 1:36
and he beheld Iesus as he walked by, and said: behold the lamb of God.

Jn 1:37
And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Iesus.

Jn 1:38
Iesus turned about, and saw them follow, and said unto them: What seek ye? They said unto him: Rabbi (which is to say by interpretation, Master) where dwellest thou?

Jn 1:39
He said unto them: come and see. They came and saw where he dwelt: and abode with him that day. For it was about the tenth hour.

Jn 1:40
One of the two which heard Ihon speak, and followed Iesus, was Andrew Simon Peter's brother.

Jn 1:41
The same found his brother Simon first, and said unto him: we have found Messias, which is by interpretation anointed:

Jn 1:42
And brought him to Iesus. And Iesus beheld him and said: thou art Simon the son of Ionas, thou shalt be called Cephas: which is by interpretation a stone.

Jn 1:43
The day following Iesus would go into Galile, and found Philip, and said unto him, follow me.

Jn 1:44
Philip was of Bethsaida the city of Andrew and Peter.

Jn 1:45
Philip found Nathanael, and said unto him: We have found him of whom Moses wrote in the law, and the prophets: Iesus the son of Ioseph of Nazareth.

Jn 1:46
And Nathanael said unto him: Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip said to him: Come and see.

Jn 1:47
Iesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said of him: Behold a right Israelite, in whom is no guile.

Jn 1:48
Nathanael said unto him: From whence knewest thou me? Iesus answered and said unto him: Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

Jn 1:49
Nathanael answered and said unto him: Rabbi, thou art the son of God, Thou art the king of Israhel.

Jn 1:50
Iesus answered and said unto him: Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, thou believest. Thou shalt see greater things than these.

Jn 1:51
And he said unto him: Verily, verily, I say unto you: hereafter shall ye see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending, and descending over the son of man.

Jn 2:1
And the third day, was there a marriage in Cana a city of Galile. And Iesus' mother was there.

Jn 2:2
Iesus was called also and his disciples unto the marriage.

Jn 2:3
And when the wine failed, Iesus' mother said unto him: they have no wine.

Jn 2:4
Iesus said unto her: woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.

Jn 2:5
His mother said unto the ministers: whatsoever he sayeth unto you, do it.

Jn 2:6
And there were standing six waterpots of stone after the manner of the purifying of the jewes, containing two or three firkins apiece.

Jn 2:7
Iesus said unto them: fill the water pots with water, and they filled them up to the harde brim.

Jn 2:8
And he said unto them: Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast. And they bare it.

Jn 2:9
When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was turned unto wine, nother knew whence it was (But the ministers which drew the water knew) He called the bridegroom,

Jn 2:10
and said unto him: all men at the beginning set forth good wine, And when men be drunk, then that which is worse: But thou hast kept back the good wine hitherto.

Jn 2:11
This beginning of miracles did Iesus in Cana of Galile, and shewed his glory, and his disciples believed on him.

Jn 2:12
After that descended he into Capernaum, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: But continued not long there.

Jn 2:13
And the jewes' ester was even at hand, And Iesus went up to Ierusalem,

Jn 2:14
and found sitting in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep, and doves, and changers of money sitting.

Jn 2:15
And he made a scourge of small cords, and drave them all out of the temple, both sheep and oxen, and poured down the changers' money, and overthrew their tables.

Jn 2:16
And said unto them that sold doves: Have these things hence, and make not my father's house, an house of merchandise.

Jn 2:17
His disciples remembered, how that it was written: The zeal of thine house, hath even eaten me.

Jn 2:18
Then answered the jewes and said unto him: what token shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou dost these things?

Jn 2:19
Iesus answered, and said unto them: destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up again.

Jn 2:20
Then said the jewes: In xlvj. years this temple was built: and wilt thou raise it up in three days?

Jn 2:21
But he spake of the temple of his body.

Jn 2:22
As soon therefore as he was risen from death again, his disciples remembered that he thus said unto them. And they believed the scripture, and the words which Iesus had said.

Jn 2:23
When he was at Ierusalem, at ester in the feast, many believed on his name: when they saw the signs which he did:

Jn 2:24
but Iesus put not himself in their hands, because he knew all men,

Jn 2:25
and needed not, that any man should testify of man. For he knew what was in man.

Jn 3:1
There was a man of the pharises named Nicodemus a ruler among the jewes.

Jn 3:2
He came to Iesus by night, and said unto him: Master, we know that thou art, a teacher which art come from God. For no man could do such miracles as thou doest, except God were with him:

Jn 3:3
Iesus answered, and said unto him: Verily verily I say unto thee: except a man be born a new, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

Jn 3:4
Nicodemus said unto him: how can a man be born, when he is old? can he enter into his mother's body and be born again?

Jn 3:5
Iesus answered: verily, verily I say unto thee: except that a man be born of water, and of the spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

Jn 3:6
That which is born of the flesh, is flesh. And that which is born of the spirit, is spirit.

Jn 3:7
Marvel not that I said to thee, ye must be born a new.

Jn 3:8
The wind bloweth where he listeth, and thou hearest his sound: but canst not tell whence he cometh and whither he goeth. So is every man that is born of the spirit.

Jn 3:9
And Nicodemus answered and said unto him: how can these things be?

Jn 3:10
Iesus answered and said unto him: Art thou a master in Israhell, and knowest not these things?

Jn 3:11
Verily verily, I say unto thee, we speak that we know, and testify that we have seen: And ye receive not our witness.

Jn 3:12
If I have told you earthly things and ye have not believe: How should ye believe if I shall tell you of heavenly things?

Jn 3:13
And no man ascendeth up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, that is to say, the son of man which is in heaven.

Jn 3:14
And as Moses lift up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the son of man be lift up,

Jn 3:15
that none which believeth in him perish: but have eternal life.

Jn 3:16
God so loved the world, that he gave his only son for the intent, that none that believe in him, should perish: But should have everlasting life.

Jn 3:17
For God sent not his son into the world, to condemn the world: But that the world through him, might be saved.

Jn 3:18
He that believeth on him shall not be condemned. But he that believeth not, is condemned all ready, because he believeth not in the name of the only son of God.

Jn 3:19
And this is the condemnation: Light is come into the world, and the men have loved darkness more than light, because their deeds were evil.

Jn 3:20
For every man that evil doeth, hateth the light: neither cometh to light, lest his deeds should be reproved.

Jn 3:21
But he that doth truth, cometh to the light, that his deeds might be known, how that they are wrought in God.

Jn 3:22
After that came Iesus and his disciples into the jewes' land, and there abode with them and baptised,

Jn 3:23
and Ihon also baptised in Enon besides Salim, because there was much water there, and they came, and were baptised.

Jn 3:24
For Ihon was not yet cast into prison.

Jn 3:25
There arose a question between Ihon's disciples and the jewes about purifying.

Jn 3:26
And they came unto Ihon, and said unto him: Master, behold he that was with thee beyond Iordan, to whom thou barest witness, baptiseth, and all men come to him.

Jn 3:27
Ihon answered, and said: A man can receive nothing at all except it be given him from heaven.

Jn 3:28
Ye yourselves are witnesses, how that I said: I am not Christ: but am sent before him.

Jn 3:29
He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: But the friend of the bridegroom which standeth by and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly of the bridegroom's voice. Therefore this my joy is fulfilled.

Jn 3:30
He must increase: and I must decrease.

Jn 3:31
He that cometh from on high is above all: he that is of the earth is off the earth, and speaketh of the earth. He that cometh from heaven, is above all:

Jn 3:32
And testifieth that he hath seen, and heard: and his testimony no man receiveth.

Jn 3:33
Whosoever receiveth his witness, the same hath sealed that God is true.

Jn 3:34
For he whom God hath sent, speaketh the words of God. For God giveth not the spirit by measure.

Jn 3:35
The father loveth the son, and hath given all things into his hand.

Jn 3:36
He that believeth on the son, hath everlasting life. And he that beloveth not the son, shall not see life, but the wrath of God abideth on him.

Jn 4:1
As soon as the Lord had knowledge, how that it was come to the ears of the pharises, that Iesus made and baptised more disciples than Ihon

Jn 4:2
(though that Iesus himself baptised not: but his disciples)

Jn 4:3
he left jewry, and departed again in to Galile.

Jn 4:4
And it was so that he must needs go thorow Samaria.

Jn 4:5
Then came he to a city of Samaria called Sichar besides the possession that Iacob gave to his son Ioseph,

Jn 4:6
and there was Iacob's well. Iesus then wearied in his journey, sat thus on the well. It was about the sixth hour:

Jn 4:7
There came a woman of Samaria to draw water. Iesus said unto her: Give me drink.

Jn 4:8
(for his disciples were gone away unto the town to buy meat.)

Jn 4:9
The woman of Samaria said unto him: how is it, that thou being a iewe askest drink of me, which am a Samaritan? (for the iewes meddle not with the Samaritans.)

Jn 4:10
Iesus answered and said unto her: if thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is, that sayeth to thee give me drink: thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee water of life.

Jn 4:11
The woman said unto him: Sir thou hast no thing to draw it withall, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that water of life?

Jn 4:12
Art thou greater then our father Iacob, which gave us the well, and he himself drank thereof and his children and his cattle?

Jn 4:13
Iesus answered and said unto her: whosoever drinketh of this water, shall thirst again.

Jn 4:14
But whosoever shall drink of the water that I shall give him, shall never be more a thirst: But the water that I shall give him, shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.

Jn 4:15
The woman said unto him: Sir give me of that water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

Jn 4:16
Iesus said unto her: Go and call thy husband, and come hither.

Jn 4:17
The woman answered and said to him: I have no husband. Iesus said to her: Thou hast well said, I have no husband.

Jn 4:18
For thou hast had five husbands, and he whom thou now hast, is not thy husband. That saidst thou truly.

Jn 4:19
The woman said unto him: Sir I perceive that thou art a prophet.

Jn 4:20
Our fathers worshipped in this mountain: and ye say that in Ierusalem is the place where men ought to pray.

Jn 4:21
Iesus said unto her: woman trust me, The hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Ierusalem, worship the father.

Jn 4:22
Ye worship ye wot nere what: we know what we worship. For salvation cometh of the iewes.

Jn 4:23
But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the father in spirit, and in verity. For verily such the father requireth to worship him.

Jn 4:24
God is a spirit, and they that worship him, must honour him, in spirit and verity.

Jn 4:25
The woman said unto him: I wot well Messias shall come, which is called Christ. When he is once come, he will tell us all things.

Jn 4:26
Iesus said unto her: I that speak unto thee, am he.

Jn 4:27
And even at that point, came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman. Yet no man said unto him: what meanest thou, or why talkest thou with her?

Jn 4:28
The woman left her water pot behind her, and went her way into the city, and said to the men there:

Jn 4:29
Come see a man which told me all things that ever I did. Is not he Christ?

Jn 4:30
Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.

Jn 4:31
In the meanwhile his disciples prayed him saying: Master eat.

Jn 4:32
He said unto them: I have meat to eat, that ye know not of.

Jn 4:33
Then said the disciples between themselves: hath any man brought him meat?

Jn 4:34
Iesus said unto them: My meat is to fulfill the will of him that sent me. And to finish his work.

Jn 4:35
Say not ye: There are yet four months, and then cometh harvest? Behold I say unto you, lift up your eyes, and look on the regions: For they are white already unto harvest.

Jn 4:36
And he that reapeth receiveth reward, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: That both he that soweth, might rejoice also, and he that reapeth.

Jn 4:37
And herein is the saying true, that one soweth, And another reapeth.

Jn 4:38
I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labor. Other men laboured, And ye are entered into their labors.

Jn 4:39
Many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him, For the woman's saying, which testified: He told me all things that ever I did.

Jn 4:40
Then when the Samaritans were come unto him, They besought him, that he would tarry with them. And he abode there two days.

Jn 4:41
And many more believed because of his own words.

Jn 4:42
And said unto the woman: Now we believe not because of thy saying: for we have heard him ourselves, and know that this is even indeed Christ the saviour of the world.

Jn 4:43
After two days, he departed thence, and went away into Galile.

Jn 4:44
And Iesus himself testified, that a prophet hath none honour in his own country.

Jn 4:45
Then as soon as he was come into Galile, the Galileans received him which had seen all things, that he did at Ierusalem on the feast. For they went also unto the feast day.

Jn 4:46
And Iesus came again into Cana of Galile, where he turned water into wine. And there was a certain ruler, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

Jn 4:47
As soon as the same heard that Iesus was come out of jewry into Galilee he went unto him, and besought him, that he would descend, and heal his son: For he was even ready to die.

Jn 4:48
Then said Iesus unto him: Except ye see signs and wonders, ye believe not.

Jn 4:49
The ruler said unto him: Sir come away or ever that my child die.

Jn 4:50
Iesus said unto him go thy way, thy son liveth. And the man believed the words that Iesus had spoken unto him, and went his way.

Jn 4:51
And anon as he went on his way, his servants met him, and told him, saying: thy child liveth,

Jn 4:52
Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him: Yesterday the seventh hour, the fever left him.

Jn 4:53
And the father knew that it was the same hour in which Iesus said unto him: Thy son liveth. And he believed, and all his household.

Jn 4:54
This is again the second miracle, that Iesus did, after he was come out of jewry into Galilee.

Jn 5:1
After that there was a feast of the iewes, and Iesus went up to Ierusalem.

Jn 5:2
There is at Ierusalem, by the slaughterhouse a pool called in the Hebrew tongue, bethesda, having five porches,

Jn 5:3
in them lay a great multitude of sick folk, of blind, halt, and withered, waiting for the moving of the water.

Jn 5:4
For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool and stirred the water. Whosoever then first after the stirring of the water stepped in, was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.

Jn 5:5
And a certain man was there, which had been diseased xxxviij. years.

Jn 5:6
When Iesus saw him lie, and knew that he now long time had been diseased, he said unto him, Wilt thou be whole?

Jn 5:7
The sick answered him: Sir I have no man when the water is moved, to put me into the pool. But in the mean time, while I am about to come, another steppeth down before me.

Jn 5:8
Iesus said unto him: rise, take up thy bed, and walk.

Jn 5:9
And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and went. And the same day was the saboth day.

Jn 5:10
The iewes therefore said unto him that was made whole: It is the saboth day, it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.

Jn 5:11
He answered them: he that made me whole, said unto me: Take up thy bed, and get thee hence.

Jn 5:12
Then asked they him: what man is that which said unto thee, take up thy bed and walk?

Jn 5:13
And he that was healed, wist not who it was. For Iesus had gotten himself away, because that there was press of people in the place.

Jn 5:14
After that, Iesus found him in the temple, and said unto him: Behold thou art made whole, see thou sin no more, lest a worse thing happen unto thee.

Jn 5:15
The man departed, and told the iewes that it was Iesus, the which had made him whole.

Jn 5:16
And therefore the iewes did persecute Iesus, and sought the means to slay him, because he had done these things on the saboth day.

Jn 5:17
Iesus answered them: My father worketh hitherto, and I work.

Jn 5:18
Therefore the iewes sought the more to kill him, not only because he had broken the saboth: but said also that God was his father and made himself equal with God.

Jn 5:19
Then answered Iesus and said unto them: verily, verily, I say unto you: the son can do no thing of himself: but that he seeth the father do. For whatsoever he doeth, that doeth the son also.

Jn 5:20
For the father loveth the son, and sheweth him all things, whatsoever he himself doeth. And he will shew him greater works than these, because ye should marvel.

Jn 5:21
For likewise as the father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneth them, even so the son quickeneth whom he will.

Jn 5:22
Neither judgeth the father any man: but hath committed all judgement unto the son,

Jn 5:23
because that all men should honour the son, even as they honour the father. He that honoureth not the son, the same honoureth not the father which hath sent him.

Jn 5:24
Verily verily I say unto you: He that heareth my words, And believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into damnation: but is scaped from death unto life.

Jn 5:25
Verily, verily I say unto you: the time shall come, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the son of God. And they that hear, shall live.

Jn 5:26
For as the father hath life in himself, so likewise hath he given to the son to have life in himself.

Jn 5:27
And hath given him power also to judge in that he is the son of man.

Jn 5:28
Marvel not at this, that the hour shall come, in the which all that are in the graves, shall hear his voice,

Jn 5:29
and shall come forth, they that have done good unto the resurrection of life. And they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.

Jn 5:30
I can of mine own self do nothing at all. As I hear I judge, and my judgement is just, because I seek not mine own will: But the will of the father which hath sent me.

Jn 5:31
If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

Jn 5:32
There is another that beareth witness of me. And I am sure that the witness which he beareth of me is true.

Jn 5:33
Ye sent unto Ihon, and he bare witness unto the truth:

Jn 5:34
but I receive no record of man. Nevertheless, these things I say, that ye might be safe.

Jn 5:35
He was a burning, and a shining light, and ye would for a season have rejoiced in his light.

Jn 5:36
But I have greater witness, than the witness of Ihon. For the works which my father hath given me to finish: the same works which I do, bear witness of me, that my father sent me.

Jn 5:37
And my father himself, which hath sent me, beareth witness of me. Ye have not heard his voice at any time, Nor yet have seen his shape.

Jn 5:38
And his words have ye not abiding in you: For ye believe not him whom he hath sent.

Jn 5:39
Search the scriptures, for in them, ye think ye have eternal life: And they are they which testify of me.

Jn 5:40
And yet will ye not come to me that ye might have life.

Jn 5:41
I receive not praise of men:

Jn 5:42
But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.

Jn 5:43
I am come in my father's name, and ye receive me not. If another shall come in his own name, him will ye receive.

Jn 5:44
How can ye believe, which receive praise one of another, and seek not the praise which cometh of God only?

Jn 5:45
Suppose not, that I will accuse you to my father. There is one that accuseth you, verily Moses in whom ye trust.

Jn 5:46
For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: For he wrote of me.

Jn 5:47
But when ye believe not his writing: how shall ye believe my words.

Jn 6:1
After that went Iesus his way over the sea of Galile nye to a city called Tiberias.

Jn 6:2
And a great multitude followed him, because they had seen his miracles that he did on them that were diseased.

Jn 6:3
Iesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

Jn 6:4
(And ester a feast of the jewes, was nye.)

Jn 6:5
Then Iesus lift up his eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, and said unto Philip: whence shall we buy bread that these might eat:

Jn 6:6
This he said to prove him. For he himself knew what he would do.

Jn 6:7
Philip answered him, two hundred pennyworth of bread are not sufficient for them, that every man have a little.

Jn 6:8
Then said unto him, one of his disciples (Andrew Simon Peter's brother.)

Jn 6:9
There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two fishes: but what is that among so many?

Jn 6:10
Iesus said: Make the people to sit down. (There was much grass in the place.) And the men sat down, in number, about five thousand.

Jn 6:11
Iesus took the bread, and gave thanks, and gave to his disciples, and his disciples, to them that were set down. And likewise of the fishes, as much as they would.

Jn 6:12
When they had eaten enough, he said unto his disciples: gather up the broken meat that remaineth: that nothing be lost.

Jn 6:13
They gathered it together, and filled twelve baskets with the broken meat, of the five barley loaves, which broken meat remained unto them that had eaten.

Jn 6:14
Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Iesus did, said: This is of a truth the same prophet which shall come into the world.

Jn 6:15
Iesus knew well enough, that they would come, and take him up, to make him king: and therefore departed he again, into a mountain, himself alone.

Jn 6:16
When even was come his disciples went unto the sea,

Jn 6:17
and entered into a ship. And went over the sea unto Capernaum. And anon it was dark, and Iesus was not come to them.

Jn 6:18
And the sea arose with a great wind.

Jn 6:19
When they had rowed about a xxv. or a xxx. furlongs, they saw Iesus walk on the sea, and to draw nye unto the ship, and they were afraid.

Jn 6:20
And he said unto them: It is I, be not afraid.

Jn 6:21
Then would they have received him into the ship, and the ship was by and by at the land whither they went.

Jn 6:22
The day following, the people which stood on the other side of the sea, saw that there was none other ship there save that one wherein his disciples were entered, and that Iesus went not in with his disciples into the ship: but that his disciples were gone away alone.

Jn 6:23
(There came other ships from Tiberias nye unto the place, where they ate bread, when the Lord had blessed.)

Jn 6:24
Then when the people saw that Iesus was not there neither his disciples, they also took shipping and came to Capernaum seeking for Iesus.

Jn 6:25
And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him: Master when camest thou hither?

Jn 6:26
Iesus answered them and said: verily verily I say unto you: ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles: but because ye ate of the loaves, and were filled.

Jn 6:27
Labor not for the meat which perisheth, but for the meat that endureth unto everlasting life, which meat the son of man shall give unto you. For him hath God the father sealed.

Jn 6:28
Then said they unto him: what shall we do that we might work the works of God?

Jn 6:29
Iesus answered and said unto them: This is the work of God, that ye believe on him, whom he hath sent.

Jn 6:30
They said unto him: what sign shewest thou then? that we may see and believe thee? What dost thou work?

Jn 6:31
our fathers did eat manna in the desert, as it is written: He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

Jn 6:32
Iesus said unto them: verily, verily I say unto you: Moses gave you not bread from heaven: but my father giveth you the true bread from heaven.

Jn 6:33
For he is the bread of God, which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.

Jn 6:34
Then said they unto him: Master ever more give us this bread.

Jn 6:35
And Iesus said unto them: I am that bread of life. He that cometh to me, shall not hunger: and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.

Jn 6:36
But I said unto you: that ye have seen me, and yet believe ye not.

Jn 6:37
