All that my father giveth me, cometh to me: and him that cometh to me, cast I not out at the doors.

Jn 6:38
For I came down from heaven: not to do mine own will: but his will which hath sent me.

Jn 6:39
And this is my fathers will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me, I shall loose no thing: but should raise it up again at the last day.

Jn 6:40
And this is the will of him that sent me: That every man which seeth the son, And believeth on him, have everlasting life. And I will raise him up at the last day.

Jn 6:41
The jewes murmured at it, because he said: I am that bread which is come down from heaven.

Jn 6:42
And they said: Is not this Iesus the son of Ioseph, whose father, and mother we know? How is it then that he sayeth, I came down from heaven?

Jn 6:43
Iesus answered and said unto them. Murmur not between yourselves.

Jn 6:44
No man can come to me except my father which hath sent me, draw him. And I will raise him up at the last day.

Jn 6:45
It is written in the prophets: And they shall all be taught of God. Every man which hath heard, and learned of the father, cometh unto me,

Jn 6:46
not that any man hath seen the father, save he which is of God. The same hath seen the father.

Jn 6:47
Verily verily I say unto you, he that believeth on me hath everlasting life.

Jn 6:48
I am that bread of life.

Jn 6:49
Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead?

Jn 6:50
This is that bread which cometh from heaven, that he which of it eateth, should also not die.

Jn 6:51
I am that living bread which came down from heaven. If any man eat of this bread, he shall live forever. And the bread that I will give, is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.

Jn 6:52
The jewes strove among themselves saying: How can this fellow give us his flesh to eat?

Jn 6:53
Iesus said unto them: Verily, verily I say unto you, except ye eat the flesh of the son of man, and drink his blood, ye shall not have life in you.

Jn 6:54
Whosoever eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, the same hath eternal life: And I will raise him up at the last day.

Jn 6:55
For my flesh is meat indeed: and my blood is drink indeed.

Jn 6:56
He that eateth my flesh and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me and I in him.

Jn 6:57
As my living father hath sent me, even so live I by my father: and he that eateth me, shall live by me.

Jn 6:58
This is the bread which came from heaven: not as your fathers have eaten manna and are dead. He that eateth of this bread, shall live ever.

Jn 6:59
These things said he in the synagogue as he taught in Capernaum.

Jn 6:60
Many of his disciples, when they had heard this, said: this is an hard saying. Who can abide the hearing of it?

Jn 6:61
Iesus knew in himself, that his disciples murmu red at it, and said unto them: Doth this offend you?

Jn 6:62
what and if ye shall see the son of man ascend up where he was before?

Jn 6:63
It is the spirit that quickeneth, the flesh profiteth nothing. The words that I speak unto you are spirit and life.

Jn 6:64
But there are some of you that believe not. For Iesus knew from the beginning, which they were that believed not. And who should betray him.

Jn 6:65
And he said: Therefore said I unto you: that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my father.

Jn 6:66
From that time many of his disciples went away from him, and companied no more with him.

Jn 6:67
Then said Iesus to the twelve: will ye also go away?

Jn 6:68
Simon Peter answered him: Master to whom shall we go? Thou hast the words of eternal life,

Jn 6:69
And we have believed, and known, that thou art Christ the son of the living God.

Jn 6:70
Iesus answered them: Have not I chosen you twelve? And yet one of you is the devil?

Jn 6:71
He spake it of Iudas Iscariot the son of Simon. For he it was that should betray him, and was one of the twelve.

Jn 7:1
After that Iesus went about into Galile, and would not go about in jewry, for the jewes sought to kill him.

Jn 7:2
The jewes' tabernacle feast was at hand.

Jn 7:3
His brethren therefore said unto him: Get thyself hence and go into jewry that thy disciples may see thy works that thou doest.

Jn 7:4
There is no man that doeth any thing secretly, and he himself seeketh to be known. If thou do such things, shew thyself to the world.

Jn 7:5
For as yet his brethren believed not in him.

Jn 7:6
Then Iesus said unto them: My time is not yet come, your time is alway ready.

Jn 7:7
The world cannot hate you. Me it hateth: Because I testify of it, that the works of it are evil.

Jn 7:8
Go ye up unto this feast, I will not go up yet unto this feast, for my time is not yet full come.

Jn 7:9
These words he said unto them, and abode still in Galile.

Jn 7:10
As soon as his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly: but as it were privily.

Jn 7:11
Then sought him the jewes at the feast, and said: Where is he?

Jn 7:12
And much murmuring was there of him among the people. Some said: He is good. Other said nay, but he deceiveth the people.

Jn 7:13
No man spake openly of him, for fear of the jewes.

Jn 7:14
In the midst of the feast, Iesus went up into the temple, and taught.

Jn 7:15
And the jewes marvelled, saying: How knoweth he the scriptures? seeing that he never learned.

Jn 7:16
Iesus answered them, and said: My doctrine is not mine: but his that sent me.

Jn 7:17
If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God: or whether I spake of myself.

Jn 7:18
He that speaketh of himself, seeketh his own praise. But he that seeketh his praise that sent him, he is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

Jn 7:19
Did not Moses give you a law? And yet none of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?

Jn 7:20
The people answered and said: Thou hast the devil. Who goeth about to kill thee?

Jn 7:21
Iesus answered, and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.

Jn 7:22
Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision, not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers. And yet ye on the saboth day circumcise a man.

Jn 7:23
If a man on the saboth day receive circumcision without breaking of the law of Moses: Disdain ye at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the saboth day?

Jn 7:24
Judge not after the utter appearance: but judge righteous judgement.

Jn 7:25
Then said some of them of Ierusalem: Is not this he whom they go about to kill?

Jn 7:26
behold he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing to him. Do not our rulers know indeed, that this is very Christ?

Jn 7:27
But we know this man whence he is, but when Christ cometh, no man shall know whence he is.

Jn 7:28
Then cried Iesus in the temple as he taught saying: And me ye know, and whence I am ye know: and I am not come of myself. But he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.

Jn 7:29
I know him: For I am of him, and he hath sent me.

Jn 7:30
Then sought the jews to take him, but no man laid hands on him, because his time was not yet come.

Jn 7:31
Many of the people believed on him, and said: When Christ cometh: Will he do more miracles than this man hath done?

Jn 7:32
The pharises heard that the people murmured such things about him: and the pharises and scribes sent ministers forth to take him.

Jn 7:33
Then said Iesus unto them: Yet am I a little while with you, and then go I unto him that sent me.

Jn 7:34
Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: And where I am, thither can ye not come.

Jn 7:35
Then said the jewes between themselves: Whither will he go? that we shall not find him. Will he go among the gentiles, which are scattered all abroad, and teach the gentiles?

Jn 7:36
What manner of saying is this that he said: ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: And where I am, thither can ye not come?

Jn 7:37
In the last day, that great day of the feast: Iesus stood and cried saying: If any man thirst, let him come unto me and drink.

Jn 7:38
Whosoever believeth on me, as sayeth the scripture, out of his belly shall flow rivers of water of life.

Jn 7:39
This spake he of the spirit, which they that believed on him should receive. For the holy ghost was not yet there, because that Iesus was not yet glorified.

Jn 7:40
Many of the people, when they heard this saying said: This is, no doubt, a prophet.

Jn 7:41
Other said: this is Christ. Some said: shall Christ come out of Galilee?

Jn 7:42
Saith not the scripture that Christ shall come of the seed of David: and out of the town of Bethlehem where David was?

Jn 7:43
So was there dissension among the people for his sake.

Jn 7:44
And some of them would have taken him: but no man laid hands on him.

Jn 7:45
Then came the ministers to the high priests, and pharises. And they said unto them: why have ye not brought him?

Jn 7:46
The servants answered: never man spake as this man speaketh.

Jn 7:47
Then answered them the pharises: are ye also deceived?

Jn 7:48
Doth any of the rulers, or of the pharises believe on him?

Jn 7:49
But the common people which know not the law are a cursed.

Jn 7:50
Nicodemus said unto them (He that came to Iesus by night which was one of them.)

Jn 7:51
Doth our law judge any man, before it be heard, and known, what he hath done?

Jn 7:52
They answered, and said unto him: Art thou also of Galile? Search and look, for out of Galile ariseth no prophet.

Jn 7:53
And every man went unto his own house.

Jn 8:1
Iesus went unto mount olivet,

Jn 8:2
and early in the morning came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him, And he sat down, and taught them.

Jn 8:3
The scribes and pharises brought unto him a woman taken in advoutry, and set her in the midst and said unto him:

Jn 8:4
Master this woman was taken in advoutry, even as the deed was a doing.

Jn 8:5
Moses in the law commanded us that such should be stoned: What sayest thou therefore?

Jn 8:6
And this they said to tempt him: that they might have, whereof to accuse him. Iesus stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground.

Jn 8:7
And while they continued asking him, he lifted himself up, And said unto them: let him that is among you without sin, cast the first stone at her.

Jn 8:8
And again he stooped down and wrote on the ground.

Jn 8:9
As soon as they heard that, they went out one by one the eldest first. And Iesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.

Jn 8:10
When Iesus had lifted up himself again, and saw no man, but the woman, He said unto her: Woman, where are those thine accusers? Hath no man condemned thee?

Jn 8:11
She said: Sir no man. Iesus said: Neither do I condemn thee. Go hence and sin no more.

Jn 8:12
Then spake Iesus again unto them saying: I am the light of the world. He that followeth me shall not walk in darkness: but shall have the light of life.

Jn 8:13
The pharises said unto him: thou bearest record of thyself, thy record is not true.

Jn 8:14
Iesus answered and said unto them: And if I bear record of myself, my record is true for I know whence I come, and whither I go. Ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.

Jn 8:15
Ye judge after the flesh, I judge no man,

Jn 8:16
and if I judge, then is my judgement true. For I am not alone: but I and my father that sent me.

Jn 8:17
It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.

Jn 8:18
I am one that bear witness of myself, and my father that sent me beareth witness of me.

Jn 8:19
Then said they unto him: where is thy father? Iesus answered: ye neither know me, nor yet my father. If ye had known me, ye should have known my father also.

Jn 8:20
These words spake Iesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple. And no man laid hands on him, For his time was not yet come.

Jn 8:21
Then said Iesus again unto them: I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins. Whither I go thither can ye not come.

Jn 8:22
Then spake the jewes: will he kill himself, because he saith: whither I go, thither can ye not come?

Jn 8:23
And he said unto them: ye are from beneath, I am from above. Ye are of this world, I am not of this world.

Jn 8:24
I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins. For except ye believe that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.

Jn 8:25
Then said they unto him, who art thou? And Iesus said unto them: Even the very same thing that I say unto you.

Jn 8:26
I have many things to say, and to judge of you. But he that sent me is true. And I speak in the world, those things which I have heard of him.

Jn 8:27
They understood not that he spake of his father.

Jn 8:28
Then said Iesus unto them: When ye have lift up on high the son of man then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do nothing of myself, But as my father hath taught me, even so I speak.

Jn 8:29
And he that sent me is with me. My father hath not left me alone, For I do always those things that please him.

Jn 8:30
As he spake these words, many believed on him.

Jn 8:31
Then said Iesus to those jewes which believed on him: If ye continue in my saying, then are ye my very disciples:

Jn 8:32
and ye shall know the truth: And the truth shall make you free.

Jn 8:33
They answered him: We be Abraham's seed, and were never bond to any man: why sayest thou then, ye shall be made free?

Jn 8:34
Iesus answered them: verily verily I say unto you, that whosoever committeth sin, is the servant of sin.

Jn 8:35
And the servant abideth not in the house for ever: But the son abideth ever.

Jn 8:36
If the son therefore shall make you free, then are ye free in deed.

Jn 8:37
I know that ye are Abraham's seed: but ye seek means to kill me because my sayings have no place in you.

Jn 8:38
I speak that I have seen with my father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.

Jn 8:39
They answered and said unto him: Abraham is our father. Iesus said unto them. If ye were Abraham's children, ye would do the deeds of Abraham.

Jn 8:40
But now ye go about to kill me, a man that have told you the truth, which I have heard of my father. This did not Abraham.

Jn 8:41
Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they unto him: we were not born of fornication. We have one father that is God.

Jn 8:42
Iesus said unto them: if God were your father, then would ye have loved me. For I proceeded forth and come from God. Neither came I of myself, but he sent me.

Jn 8:43
Why do ye not know my speech? Because ye cannot abide the hearing of my words.

Jn 8:44
Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father, ye will follow: He was a murderer from the beginning, And abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, then speaketh he of his own. For he is a liar, and the father thereof.

Jn 8:45
And because I tell you the truth, therefore believe ye not me.

Jn 8:46
Which of you can rebuke me of sin? If I say the truth, why do not ye believe me?

Jn 8:47
He that is of God, heareth godde's words. Ye therefore hear them not, because ye are not of God.

Jn 8:48
Then answered the jewes and said unto him: Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan and hast the devil?

Jn 8:49
Iesus answered: I have not the devil: but I honour my father, and ye have dishonored me.

Jn 8:50
I seek not mine own praise: There is one that seeketh it and judgeth.

Jn 8:51
Verily verily I say unto you, if a man keep my sayings, he shall never see death.

Jn 8:52
Then said the jewes to him: Now know we that thou hast the devil. Abraham is dead, and also the prophets, and yet thou sayest: if a man keep my saying he shall never taste of death.

Jn 8:53
Art thou greater then our father Abraham? which is dead? and the prophets are dead. Whom makest thou thyself?

Jn 8:54
Iesus answered: If I praise myself, mine praise is nothing worth. It is my father that praiseth me, which ye say is your God.

Jn 8:55
And yet have ye not known him: but I know him. And if I should say, I know him not, I should be a liar like unto you, But I know him, and keep his saying.

Jn 8:56
Your father Abraham was glad to see my day, and he saw it and rejoiced.

Jn 8:57
Then said the jewes unto him: Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

Jn 8:58
Iesus said unto them: Verily verily I say unto you: yer Abraham was I am.

Jn 8:59
Then took they up stones, to cast at him. But Iesus hid himself, and went out of the temple.

Jn 9:1
And as Iesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth,

Jn 9:2
And his disciples asked him saying. Master, who did sin: this man, or his father and mother, that he was born blind?

Jn 9:3
Iesus answered: Neither this man hath sinned, nor yet his father and mother: but that the works of God should be shewed on him.

Jn 9:4
I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day. The night cometh, when no man can work.

Jn 9:5
As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

Jn 9:6
As soon as he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and rubbed the clay on the eyes of the blind,

Jn 9:7
and said unto him: Go wash thee in the pool of Siloe (which by interpretation, signifieth sent.) He went his way and washed, and came again seeing.

Jn 9:8
The neighbours, and they that had seen him before how that he was a beggar said: Is not this he that sat and begged?

Jn 9:9
Some said: this is he. Other said: he is like him. He himself said: I am even he.

Jn 9:10
They said unto him: How are thine eyes opened then?

Jn 9:11
He answered and said: The man that is called Iesus, made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me: Go to the pool Siloe, and wash. I went and washed and received my sight.

Jn 9:12
They said unto him: where is he? He said: I cannot tell.

Jn 9:13
Then brought they to the pharises, him that a little before was blind.

Jn 9:14
(It was the saboth day when Iesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.)

Jn 9:15
Then again the pharises also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them: He put clay upon mine eyes, And I washed, and I see.

Jn 9:16
Then said some of the pharises: this man is not of God, because he keepeth not the saboth day. Other said: how can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was strife among them.

Jn 9:17
Then spake they unto the blind again: What sayest thou of him, because he hath opened thine eyes? And he said: He is a prophet.

Jn 9:18
The jewes did not believe of the fellow, how that he was blind, and received his sight: until they had called the father and mother of him that had received his sight.

Jn 9:19
And they asked them saying: Is this your son, whom ye say was born blind? How doth he now see then?

Jn 9:20
His father and mother answered them and said: we wot well that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

Jn 9:21
But by what means he now seeth, that can we not tell or who hath opened his eyes can we not tell. He is old enough, ask him, let him answer for himself, of things that pertain to himself.

Jn 9:22
Such words spake his father, and mother, because they feared the jewes, for the jewes had conspired already that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be excommunicate out of the Synagogue.

Jn 9:23
Therefore said his father and mother: he is old enough, ask him.

Jn 9:24
Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him: Give God the praise, we know that this man is a sinner.

Jn 9:25
He answered and said: Whether he be a sinner or no, I cannot tell: One thing I am sure of, that I was blind, and now I see.

Jn 9:26
Then said they to him again: What did he to thee? How opened he thine eyes?

Jn 9:27
He answered them, I told you yerwhile, And ye did not hear. Wherefore would ye hear it again? Will ye also be his disciples?

Jn 9:28
Then rated they him, and said: Thou art his disciple. We are Moses' disciples.

Jn 9:29
We are sure that God spake with Moses. This fellow we know not from whence he is.

Jn 9:30
The man answered, and said unto them: this is a marvelous thing that ye wot nere whence he is, and yet hath he opened mine eyes.

Jn 9:31
We know well enough that God heareth no sinners: But if any man be a worshipper of God: and do what his will is, him heareth he.

Jn 9:32
Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.

Jn 9:33
If this man were not of God, he could have done no thing.

Jn 9:34
They answered and said unto him: thou art altogether born in sin: and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

Jn 9:35
Iesus heard that they had excommunicated him: and as soon as he had found him he said unto him: dost thou believe on the son of God?

Jn 9:36
He answered and said: And who is it Lord, that I might believe on him?

Jn 9:37
And Iesus said unto him: Thou hast seen him, and he it is that talketh with thee.

Jn 9:38
And he said: Lord I believe: And worshipped him.

Jn 9:39
Iesus said: I am come unto judgement, into this world: that they which see not, might see, and they which see might be made blind.

Jn 9:40
And some of the pharises which were with him, heard these words and said unto him: Are we then blind?

Jn 9:41
Iesus said unto them, if ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say we see, therefore your sin remaineth.

Jn 10:1
Verily verily I say unto you: Whosoever entereth not in by the door, into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way: he is a thief and a robber.

Jn 10:2
He that goeth in by the door, is the shepherd of the sheep.

Jn 10:3
To this man the porter openeth the door, and the sheep hear his voice, And he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out,

Jn 10:4
and when he hath sent forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: For they know his voice.

Jn 10:5
A stranger they will not follow, but will fly from him. For they know not the voice of strangers.

Jn 10:6
This manner of saying spake Iesus unto them. And they understood not, what things they were, which he spake unto them.

Jn 10:7
Then said Iesus unto them again: Verily verily I say unto you: that I am the door of the sheep.

Jn 10:8
All even as many as came before me, are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.

Jn 10:9
I am the door: by me, if any man enter in, he shall be safe, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

Jn 10:10
The thief cometh not but for to steal and kill, and destroy. I am come that they might have life, and have it more abundantly.

Jn 10:11
I am a good shepherd, a good shepherd giveth his life for his sheep.

Jn 10:12
An hired servant which is not the shepherd, neither the sheep are his own, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and flyeth, and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.

Jn 10:13
The hired servant flyeth because he is an hired servant, and careth not for the sheep.

Jn 10:14
I am that good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.

Jn 10:15
As my father knoweth me: even so know I my father. And I give my life for my sheep,

Jn 10:16
and other sheep I have, which are not of this fold. Them also must I bring, that they shall hear my voice. And there shall be one flock, and one shepherd.

Jn 10:17
Therefore doth my father love me, because I put my life from me, that I might take it again.

Jn 10:18
No man taketh it from me: but I put it away of myself. I have power to put it from me, and power I have to take it again. This commandment have I received of my father.

Jn 10:19
Again there was dissension among the jewes for these sayings,

Jn 10:20
and many of them said: He hath the devil, and is mad: why hear ye him?

Jn 10:21
other said, these are not the words of him that hath the devil: Can the devil open the eyes of the blind?

Jn 10:22
It was at Ierusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was the winter:

Jn 10:23
And Iesus walked in Solomon's hall.

Jn 10:24
Then came the jewes round about him, and said unto him: How long dost thou make us doubt? If thou be Christ, tell us plainly.

Jn 10:25
Iesus answered them: I told you and ye believe not: The works that I do in my father's name, bear witness of me:

Jn 10:26
but ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep. As I said unto you:

Jn 10:27
my sheep, hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me,

Jn 10:28
and I give unto them eternal life, and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.

Jn 10:29
My father which gave them me, is greater then all men, and no man is able to take them out of my father's hand.

Jn 10:30
And I and my father are one.

Jn 10:31
Then the jewes again took up stones, to stone him withall.

Jn 10:32
Iesus answered them: many good works have I shewed you from my father: for which of them will ye stone me?

Jn 10:33
The jewes answered him saying: For thy good works' sake we stone thee not: but for thy blasphemy, and because that thou being a man, makest thyself God.

Jn 10:34
Iesus answered them: Is it not written in your law: I have said, ye are goddes?

Jn 10:35
If he called them goddes unto whom the word of God was spoken (and the scripture cannot be broken)

Jn 10:36
say ye then to him, whom the father hath sanctified, and sent into the world: Thou blasphemest, because I said I am the son of God?

Jn 10:37
If I do not the works of my father, believe me not.

Jn 10:38
But though ye believe not me, yet believe the works, that ye may know and believe that the father is in me, and I in him.

Jn 10:39
Again they went about to take him, but he escaped out of their hands,

Jn 10:40
and went away again beyond Iordan, into the place where Ihon before had baptised, and there abode.

Jn 10:41
And many resorted unto him, and said: Ihon did no miracle: But all things that Ihon spake of this man are true..

Jn 10:42
And there many believed on him there.

Jn 11:1
A certain man was sick, named Lazarus of Bethania the town of Mary and her sister Martha.

Jn 11:2
It was that Mary which anointed Iesus with ointment, and wept his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick,

Jn 11:3
and his sister sent unto him saying: Lord behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

Jn 11:4
When Iesus that heard he said: this infirmity is not unto death: But for the laud of God, that the son of God might be praised by the reason of it.

Jn 11:5
Iesus loved Martha and her sister, and Lazarus.

Jn 11:6
After he heard that he was sick, then abode he two days still in the same place where he was.

Jn 11:7
Then after that said he to his disciples: let us go into jewry again.

Jn 11:8
His disciples said unto him: Master, the jewes lately sought means to stone thee, and wilt thou go thither again?

Jn 11:9
Iesus answered: are there not twelve hours in the day? If a man walk in the day he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.

Jn 11:10
If a man walk in the night he stumbleth, because there is no light in him.

Jn 11:11
This said he. And after that he said unto them: our friend Lazarus sleepeth, but I go to wake him out of sleep.

Jn 11:12
Then said his disciples: Lord if he sleep, then shall he do well enough.

Jn 11:13
Iesus spake of his death: but they thought that he had spoken of the natural sleep.

Jn 11:14
Then said Iesus unto them plainly, Lazarus is dead,

Jn 11:15
and I am glad for your sakes, that I was not there, because ye may believe. Nevertheless let us go unto him.

Jn 11:16
Then said Thomas (which is called Didymus,) unto the disciples: let us also go, that we may die with him.

Jn 11:17
Then went Iesus, and found, that he had lain in his grave four days already.

Jn 11:18
Bethanie was nye unto Ierusalem, about xv. furlongs off,

Jn 11:19
And many of the jewes came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them over their brother.

Jn 11:20
Martha as soon as she heard that Iesus was coming, went and met him. Mary sat still at home.

Jn 11:21
Then said Martha unto Iesus: Lord if thou hadst been here, my brother had not been dead:

Jn 11:22
but nevertheless, I know that whatsoever thou askest of God, God will give it thee.

Jn 11:23
Iesus said unto her: Thy brother shall rise again.

Jn 11:24
Martha said unto him: I know well, he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.

Jn 11:25
Iesus said unto her: I am the resurrection and the life. Whosoever believeth on me, Yea though he were dead, yet shall he live:

Jn 11:26
and whosoever liveth, and believeth on me, shall never die. Believest thou this?

Jn 11:27
She said unto him: yea Lord: I believe that thou art Christ the son of God, which shall come into the world.

Jn 11:28
And as soon as she had so said she went her way, and called Mary her sister secretly saying: The master is come and calleth for thee.

Jn 11:29
She as soon as she heard that, arose quickly, and came unto him.

Jn 11:30
Iesus was not yet come into the town: but was in the place where Martha met him.

Jn 11:31
The jewes then which were with her in the house, and comforted her (when they saw Mary that she rose up hastily, and went out) followed her saying: She goeth unto the grave, to weep there.

Jn 11:32
Then when Mary was come, where Iesus was and saw him she fell down at his feet, saying unto him: Lord if thou hadst been here, my brother had not been dead.

Jn 11:33
When Iesus saw her weep, and the jewes also weep, which came with her. He groaned in the spirit, and vexed himself

Jn 11:34
and said: Where have ye laid him? They said unto him: Lord come and see.

Jn 11:35
And Iesus wept.

Jn 11:36
Then said the jewes: Behold how he loved him.

Jn 11:37
Some of them said: Could not he which opened the eyes of the blind, have made also, that this man should not have died?

Jn 11:38
Iesus again groaned in himself came to the grave, it was a cave, and a stone laid on it.

Jn 11:39
Iesus said: Take ye away the stone. Martha (the sister of him that was dead) said unto him: Lord by this time he stinketh. For he hath been dead four days.

Jn 11:40
Iesus said unto her: Said I not unto thee, that if thou didst believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God.

Jn 11:41
Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid. Iesus lift up his eyes and said: Father I give thee thanks because that thou hast heard me,

Jn 11:42
I knew well that thou hearest me always: but because of the people that stand by I said it, that they might believe, that thou hast sent me.

Jn 11:43
And when he thus had spoken, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus come forth,

Jn 11:44
and he that was dead, came forth bound hand and foot, with bonds after the manner as they were wonte to bind their dead with all. And his face was bound with a napkin. Iesus said unto them: loose him, and let him go.

Jn 11:45
Then many of the jewes which came to Mary, and had seen the things which Iesus did, believed on him.

Jn 11:46
But some of them went their ways to the pharises, and told them what Iesus had done.

Jn 11:47
Then gathered the high priests and the pharises a council and said: what do we? This man doeth many miracles.

Jn 11:48
If we let him scape thus all men will believe on him. And the romaynes shall come and take away our country and people.

Jn 11:49
And one of them named Caiphas: which was the high priest that same year, said unto them: Ye perceive nothing at all

Jn 11:50
nor yet consider that it is expedient for us, that one man die for the people, and not that all the people perish.

Jn 11:51
This spake he not of himself: but being high priest that same year, prophesied he that Iesus should die for the people,

Jn 11:52
and not for the people only: but that he should gather together in one the children of God which were scattered abroad.

Jn 11:53
From that day kept they a counsel together for to put him to death.

Jn 11:54
Iesus therefore walked no more openly among the jewes: but went his way thence unto a country nye to a wilderness into a city called Ephraim, and there haunted with his disciples.

Jn 11:55
The jewes' ester was nye at hand, and many went out of the country up to Ierusalem before the ester to purify themselves.

Jn 11:56
Then sought they for Iesus, and spake between themselves as they stood in the temple: What think ye, seeing he cometh not to the feast.

Jn 11:57
The high priests and pharises had given a commandment that if any man knew where he were, he should shew it that they might take him.

Jn 12:1
Then Iesus before six days of ester, came to Bethany where Lazarus (which was dead) was, whom Iesus raised from death.

Jn 12:2
There they made him a supper, and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.

Jn 12:3
Then took Mary a pound of ointment called nardus, perfect and precious, and anointed Iesus' feet, and wept his feet with her hair, and all the house smelled of the savour of the ointment.

Jn 12:4
Then said one of his disciples named Iudas Iscarioth, Simon's son, which afterward betrayed him:

Jn 12:5
why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?

Jn 12:6
This said he, not that he cared for the poor: but because he was a thief, and kept the bag, and bare that which was given.

Jn 12:7
Then said Iesus: Let her alone, against the day of my burying she kept it.

Jn 12:8
The poor allways shall ye have with you, but me shall ye not allways have.

Jn 12:9
Much people of the jewes had knowledge that he was there. And they came not for Iesus' sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also whom he raised from death.

Jn 12:10
The high priests therefore held a council that they might put Lazarus to death also,

Jn 12:11
because that for his sake many of the jewes went away, and believed on Iesus.

Jn 12:12
On the morrow much people that were come to the feast (when they heard that Iesus should come to Ierusalem,)

Jn 12:13
took branches of palm trees and went and met him, and cried: Hosanna, blessed is he that in the name of the Lord cometh, king of Israhell.

Jn 12:14
Iesus got a young ass and sat thereon, according to that which was written:

Jn 12:15
fear not daughter of Sion: behold thy king cometh sitting on an asse's colt.

Jn 12:16
These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Iesus was glorified, then remembered they that such things were written of him, and that such things they had done unto him.

Jn 12:17
The people that was with him, when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from death, bare record.

Jn 12:18
Therefore met him the people, because they heard that he had done such a miracle.

Jn 12:19
The pharises therefore said among themselves: Ye see that we prevail nothing: lo all the world goeth away after him.

Jn 12:20
There were certain greeks among them, which came to pray at the feast,

Jn 12:21
the same came to Philip which was of Bethsaida a city in Galile, and desired him saying: Sir we would fain see Iesus.

Jn 12:22
Philip came and told Andrew. And again Andrew and Philip told Iesus.

Jn 12:23
And Iesus answered them saying: the hour is come that the son of man must be glorified.

Jn 12:24
Verily verily I say unto you, except the wheat corn fall into the ground and die, it bideth alone. If it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.

Jn 12:25
He that loveth his life shall destroy it: And he that hateth his life in this world, shall keep it unto life eternal.

Jn 12:26
If any man minister unto me, let him follow me and where I am there shall also my minister be. And if any man minister unto me, him will my father honour.

Jn 12:27
Now is my soul troubled, and what shall I say? Father deliver me from this hour: but therefore came I unto this hour.

Jn 12:28
Father glorify thy name. Then came there a voice from heaven, I have glorified it, and will glorify it again.

Jn 12:29
Then said the people that stood by and heard, it thundereth. Other said: an angel spake to him.

Jn 12:30
Iesus answered and said: this voice came not because of me: but for your sakes.

Jn 12:31
Now is the judgement of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out a doors.

Jn 12:32
And I (if were lifted up from the earth,) will draw all men unto me.

Jn 12:33
This said Iesus signifying what death he should die.

Jn 12:34
The people answered him: We have heard of the law that Christ bideth ever: and how sayest thou then that the son of man must be lifted up? who is that son of man?

Jn 12:35
Then Iesus said unto them: yet a little while is the light with you: walk while ye have light, lest the darkness come on you. He that walketh in the dark, wotteth not whither he goeth.

Jn 12:36
While ye have light, believe on the light that ye may be the children of light. These things spake Iesus and departed, and hid himself from them.

Jn 12:37
And though he had done so many miracles before them, yet believed not they on him,

Jn 12:38
that the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, that he spake. Lord who shall believe our saying? And to whom is the arm of the Lord declared?

Jn 12:39
Therefore could they not believe, because that Esaias saith again:

Jn 12:40
He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their hearts, that they should not see with their eyes, and understand with their hearts, and should be converted and I should heal them.

Jn 12:41
Such things said Esaias when he saw his glory, and spake of him.

Jn 12:42
Nevertheless among the chief rulers many believed on him, but because of the pharises they would not be a known of it, lest they should be excommunicated.

Jn 12:43
For they loved the praise that is given of men, more than the praise, that cometh of God.

Jn 12:44
Iesus cried and said: he that believeth on me believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.

Jn 12:45
And he that seeth me, seeth him that sent me.

Jn 12:46
I am come a light into the world that whosoever believeth on me should not bide in darkness,

Jn 12:47
and if any man hear my words and believe not, I judge him not. For I came not to judge the world: but to save the world.

Jn 12:48
He that putteth me away, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him. The words that I have spoken shall judge him in the last day.

Jn 12:49
For I have not spoken of myself: but the father which sent me gave me a commandment what I should say, and what I should speak.

Jn 12:50
And I know well that his commandment is life everlasting. Whatsoever I speak therefore, even as my father bade me, so I speak.

Jn 13:1
Before the feast of ester when Iesus knew that his hour was come, that he should depart out of this world unto the father. When he loved his which were in the world, unto the end he loved them.

Jn 13:2
And when supper was ended, after that the devil had put in the heart of Iudas Iscariot Simon's son, to betray him.

Jn 13:3
Iesus knowing that the father had given all things into his hands: And that he was come from God, and went to God,

Jn 13:4
he rose from supper, and laid aside his upper garments, and took a towel, and gird himself.

Jn 13:5
After that poured he water into a basin, and began to wash his disciples' feet, and to wipe them with the towel, wherewith he was gird.

Jn 13:6
Then came he to Simon Peter. And Peter said to him: Lord shalt thou wash my feet?

Jn 13:7
Iesus answered and said unto him: what I do thou wettest not now, thou shalt know here after.

Jn 13:8
Peter said unto him: Thou shalt not wash my feet while the world standeth. Iesus answered him: if I wash not thy feet, thou shalt have no part with me.

Jn 13:9
Simon Peter said unto him: Lord not my feet only: but also my hands and my head.

Jn 13:10
Iesus said to him: he that is washed, needeth not but to wash his feet, but is clean every whit. And ye are clean: but not all.

Jn 13:11
For he knew his betrayer. Therefore said he: ye are not all clean.

Jn 13:12
After he had washed their feet, and received his clothes, and was set down again, he said unto them: wot ye what I have done to you?

Jn 13:13
ye call me master and Lord, and ye say well, for so am I.

Jn 13:14
If I then your Lord and master have washed your feet, ye also ought to wash one another's feet.

Jn 13:15
For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.

Jn 13:16
Verily verily I say unto you, the servant is not greater than his master. Neither the messenger greater than he that sent him.

Jn 13:17
If ye understand these things, happy are ye if ye do them.

Jn 13:18
I speak not of you all, I know whom I have chosen. But that the scripture be fulfilled: he that eateth bread with me, Hath lifted up his heel against me.

Jn 13:19
Now tell I you before it come: that when it is come to pass ye might believe that I am he.

Jn 13:20
Verily verily I say unto you. He that receiveth whomsoever I send, receiveth me. And he that receiveth me, receiveth him that sent me.

Jn 13:21
When Iesus had thus said, he was troubled in the spirit, and testified saying: verily verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

Jn 13:22
Then the disciples looked one on another doubting of whom he spake.

Jn 13:23
There was one of his disciples which leaned on Iesus' bosom, whom Iesus loved.

Jn 13:24
To him beckoned Simon Peter that he should ask who it was of whom he spake.

Jn 13:25
He then as he leaned on Iesus' breast said unto him: Lord who is it?

Jn 13:26
Iesus answered, he it is to whom I give a sop, when I have dept it. And he wet a sop, and gave it to Iudas Iscarioth Simon's son.

Jn 13:27
And after the sop Satan entered into him. Then said Iesus unto him: that thou dost do quickly.

Jn 13:28
That wist no man at the table, for what intent he spake unto him.

Jn 13:29
Some of them thought, because Iudas had the bag, that Iesus had said unto him, buy those things that we have need of against the feast: or that he should give something to the poor.

Jn 13:30
As soon then as he had received the sop, he went immediately out. And it was night.

Jn 13:31
When he was gone out, Iesus said: now is the son of man glorified. And God is glorified by him.

Jn 13:32
If God be glorified by him, God shall also glorify him, in himself: and shall straightway glorify him.

Jn 13:33
Dear children, yet a little while am I with you. Ye shall seek me, and as I said unto the jewes whither I go, thither can ye not come. Also to you say I now.

Jn 13:34
A new commandment give I unto you, that ye love together, as I have loved you, that even so ye love one another.

Jn 13:35
By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye shall have love one to another.

Jn 13:36
Simon Peter said unto him: Lord whither goest thou? Iesus answered him: whither I go thou canst not follow me now, thou shalt follow me afterwards.

Jn 13:37
Peter said unto him Lord why cannot I follow thee now? I will give my life for thy sake.

Jn 13:38
Iesus answered him: Wilt thou give thy life for my sake? Verily verily I say unto thee, the cock shall not crow, till thou have denied me thrice.

Jn 14:1
And he said unto his disciples: Let not your hearts be troubled, believe in God, and believe in me.

Jn 14:2
In my father's house are many mansions. If it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.

Jn 14:3
I will come again, and receive you even unto myself, that where I am, there may ye be also.

Jn 14:4
And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.

Jn 14:5
Thomas said unto him: Lord we know not whither thou goest. Also how is it possible for us to know the way?

Jn 14:6
Iesus said unto him I am the way, the verity, and life. No man cometh unto the father, but by me.

Jn 14:7
If ye had known me ye had known my father also. And now ye know him. And ye have seen him.

Jn 14:8
Philip said unto him: Lord shew us thy father and it sufficeth us.

Jn 14:9
Iesus said unto him: have I been so long time with you: and yet hast thou not known me? Philip, he that hath seen me, hath seen the father. And how sayest thou then: shew us the father?

Jn 14:10
Believest thou not that I am in the father, and the father in me? The words that I speak unto you, I speak not of myself: but the father dwelling in me is he that doeth the works.

Jn 14:11
Believe that I am in the father, and the father in me. At the least believe me for the very works' sake.

Jn 14:12
Verily verily I say unto you whosoever believeth on me, the works that I do, the same shall he do, and greater works then these shall he do, because I go unto my father.

Jn 14:13
And whatsoever ye ask in my name, that will I do, that the father might be glorified by the son.

Jn 14:14
If ye shall ask any thing in my name I will do it.

Jn 14:15
If ye love me keep my commandments,

Jn 14:16
and I will pray the father, and he shall give you another comforter, that he may bide with you ever,

Jn 14:17
which is the spirit of truth whom the world cannot receive, because the world seeth him not, neither knoweth him. But ye know him. For he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.

Jn 14:18
I will not leave you comfortless: I will come unto you.

Jn 14:19
It is yet a little while and the world seeth me no more: but ye shall see me. For I live, and ye shall live.

Jn 14:20
That day shall ye know that I am in my father, and my father in me, and I in you.

Jn 14:21
He that hath my commandments and keepeth them, the same is he that loveth me, and he that loveth me shall be loved of my father, and I will love him, and will shew mine own self unto him.

Jn 14:22
Iudas said unto him (not Iudas Iscarioth) Lord what is the cause that thou wilt shew thyself unto us, and not unto the world?

Jn 14:23
Iesus answered and said unto him: if a man love me and will keep my sayings, my father also will love him, and we will come unto him, and will dwell with him.

Jn 14:24
He that loveth me not, keepeth not my sayings. And the words which ye hear are not mine, but my father's, which sent me.

Jn 14:25
This have I spoken unto you being yet present with you.

Jn 14:26
But that comforter which is the holy ghost (whom my father will send in my name) shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance whatsoever I have told you.

Jn 14:27
Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you. Not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your hearts be grieved, neither fear ye.

Jn 14:28
Ye have heard how I said unto you: I go and come again unto you. If ye loved me, ye would verily rejoice, because I said, I go unto the father. For the father is greater then I.

Jn 14:29
And now have I shewed you, before it come, that when it is come to pass, ye might believe.

Jn 14:30
Here after will I not talk many words unto you. For the chief ruler of this world cometh, and hath nought in me.

Jn 14:31
But that the world may know that I love my father, And as the father gave me commandment, even so do I. Rise let us go hence.

Jn 15:1
I am the true vine, and my father is an husbandman.

Jn 15:2
Every branch that beareth not fruit in me, He will take away. And every branch that beareth fruit will he purge that it may bring more fruit.

Jn 15:3
Now are ye clean, be that means of the words which I have spoken unto you.

Jn 15:4
Bide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it bide in the vine: no more can ye except ye abide in me.

Jn 15:5
I am the vine, and ye are the branches. He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit. For without me can ye do nothing.

Jn 15:6
If a man bide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered: and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they burneth.

Jn 15:7
If ye bide in me, and my words also bide in you: ask what ye will, and it shall be given you.

Jn 15:8
Here in is my father glorified, that ye bear much fruit, and be made my disciples.

Jn 15:9
As the father hath loved me, even so have I loved you. Continue in my love.

Jn 15:10
If ye shall keep my commandments, ye shall bide in my love, even as I have kept my father's commandments, and bide in his love.

Jn 15:11
These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

Jn 15:12
This is my commandment, that ye love together as I have loved you.

Jn 15:13
Greater love than this hath no man, than that a man bestow his life for his friends.

Jn 15:14
Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.

Jn 15:15
Henceforth call I you not servants: For the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth. But you have I called friends: For all things that I have heard of my father, I have opened to you.

Jn 15:16
Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you and ordained you that ye go, and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit remain, that whatsoever ye shall ask of my father in my name he should give it you.

Jn 15:17
This command I you, that ye love together.

Jn 15:18
If the world hate you, ye know that he hated me before he hated you.

Jn 15:19
If ye were of the world, the world would love his own. Because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore hateth you the world.

Jn 15:20
Remember the saying, that I said unto you: the servant is not greater than the lord. If they have persecuted me, so will they persecute you. If they have kept my saying, so will they keep yours.

Jn 15:21
But all these things will they do unto you for my name's sake, because they have not known him that sent me.

Jn 15:22
If I had not come and spoken unto them, they should have no sin: but now have they nothing to cloak their sin withall.

Jn 15:23
He that hateth me, hateth my father.

Jn 15:24
If I had not done works among them which none other man did, they should be without sin. But now have they seen, and yet have hated both me and my father:

Jn 15:25
Even that the saying might be fulfilled that is written in their law: they hated me without a cause.

Jn 15:26
But when the comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the father, which is the spirit of verity, which proceedeth of the father, he shall testify of me.

Jn 15:27
And ye shall bear witness also, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

Jn 16:1
These things have I said unto you be cause ye should not be hurt in your faith.

Jn 16:2
They shall excommunicate you: yea the time shall come, that whosoever killeth you, will think that he doth God true service.

Jn 16:3
And such things will they do unto you, because they have not known the father neither yet me.

Jn 16:4
These things have I told you, that when that hour is come, ye might remember then, that I told you so. These things said I not unto you at the beginning, because I was present with you.

Jn 16:5
But now go I my way to him that sent me, and none of you asketh me: whither goest thou?

Jn 16:6
but because I have said such things unto you, your hearts are full of sorrow.

Jn 16:7
Nevertheless I tell you the truth it is expedient for you that I go away. For if I go not away, that comforter will not come unto you. But if I depart, I will send him unto you.

Jn 16:8
And when he is come, he will rebuke the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgement.

Jn 16:9
Of sin, because they believe not on me:

Jn 16:10
Of righteousness, because I go to my father, and ye shall see me no more:

Jn 16:11
And of judgement, because the chief ruler of this world, is judged all ready.

Jn 16:12
I have yet many things to say unto you: but ye cannot bear them away now.

Jn 16:13
When he is once come (I mean the spirit of verity,) he will lead you into all truth. He shall not speak of himself: but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak, and he will shew you things to come.

Jn 16:14
He shall glorify me, for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew unto you.

Jn 16:15
All things that my father hath are mine. Therefore said I unto you that he shall take of mine and shew unto you.

Jn 16:16
After a while ye shall not see me, and again after a while ye shall see me: For I go to my father.

Jn 16:17
Then said some of his disciples between themselves: what is this that he saith unto us, after a while ye shall not see me, and again after a while ye shall see me: and that I go to my father.

Jn 16:18
They said therefore: what is this that he saith after a while? we cannot tell what he saith.

Jn 16:19
Iesus perceived, that they would ask him, and said unto them: This is it that ye enquire of between yourselves, that I said, after a while ye shall not see me, and again after a while ye shall see me.

Jn 16:20
Verily verily I say unto you: ye shall weep and lament, and the world shall rejoice. Ye shall sorrow: but your sorrow shall be turned to joy.

Jn 16:21
A woman when she travaileth hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of her child she remembreth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

Jn 16:22
And ye now are in sorrow: but I will see you again, and your hearts shall rejoice, and your joy shall no man take from you.

Jn 16:23
And in that day shall ye ask me no question. Verily verily I say unto you, whatsoever ye shall ask the father in my name, he will give it you.

Jn 16:24
Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name. Ask and ye shall receive it: that your joy may be full.

Jn 16:25
These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs. The time will come when I shall no more speak to you in proverbs: but I shall shew you plainly from my father.

Jn 16:26
At that day shall ye ask in mine name. And I say not unto you that I will speak unto my father for you.

Jn 16:27
For my father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

Jn 16:28
I went out from the father, and came into the world: and I leave the world again, and go to the father.

Jn 16:29
His disciples said unto him: lo now speakest thou plainly, and thou usest no proverb.

Jn 16:30
Now know we that thou understandest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee any question. Therefore believe we that thou camest from God.

Jn 16:31
Iesus answered them: Now ye do believe.

Jn 16:32
Behold the hour draweth nye, and is already come, that ye shall be scattered every man his ways, and shall leave me alone. And yet am I not alone. For my father is with me.

Jn 16:33
These words have I spoken unto you that in me ye might have peace. In the world shall ye have tribulation: but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world.

Jn 17:1
These words spake Iesus and lift up his eyes to heaven, and said: father the hour is come glorify thy son that thy son may glorify thee.

Jn 17:2
As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.

Jn 17:3
This is life eternal that they might know thee that only very God: and whom thou hast sent Iesus Christ.

Jn 17:4
I have glorified thee on the earth. I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.

Jn 17:5
And now glorify me thou father in thine own presence, with the glory which I had with thee yer the world was.

Jn 17:6
I have declared thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world. Thine they were, and thou gavest them me, and they have kept thy sayings.

Jn 17:7
Now have they known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me, are of thee.

Jn 17:8
For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me, and they have received them, and know surely that I came out from thee: and do believe that thou didst send me.

Jn 17:9
I pray for them. I pray not for the world: but for them which thou hast given me, for they are thine,

Jn 17:10
and all mine are thine, and thine are mine, and I am glorified in them.

Jn 17:11
And now am I no more in the world, but they are in the world, and I come to thee. Wholly father keep in thine own name them which thou hast given me, that they may be one as we are.

Jn 17:12
While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name. Those that thou gavest me, have I kept, and none of them is lost, but that lost child, that the scripture might be fulfilled.

Jn 17:13
Now come I to thee, and these words speak I in the world, that they might have my joy full in them.

Jn 17:14
I have given them thy doctrine, and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

Jn 17:15
I desire not that thou shouldest take them out of the world: but that thou keep them from evil.

Jn 17:16
They are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

Jn 17:17
Sanctify them in thy trueth. Thy saying is verity.

Jn 17:18
As thou didst sent me into the world, even so have I sent them into the world,

Jn 17:19
And for their sakes sanctify I myself, that they also might be sanctified thorow the truth.

Jn 17:20
I pray not for them alone: but for them also which shall believe on me thorow their preaching,

Jn 17:21
that they all may be one, as thou father art in me, and I in thee, that they may be also one in us, that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.

Jn 17:22
And that glory that thou gavest me, I have given them, that they may be one, as we are one.

Jn 17:23
I am in them and thou art in me, that they may be made perfect in one, and that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and hast loved them, as thou hast loved me.

Jn 17:24
Father I will that they which thou hast given me, be with me where I am, that they may see my glory which thou hast given me. For thou lovedest me before the making of the world.

Jn 17:25
O righteous father the very world hath not known thee: but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.

Jn 17:26
And I have declared unto them thy name, and will declare it, that the love wherewith thou hast loved me, be in them, and that I be in them.

Jn 18:1
When Iesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden into the which he entered with his disciples.

Jn 18:2
(Iudas also which betrayed him knew the place, for Iesus oftentimes resorted thither with his disciples.)

Jn 18:3
Iudas then after he had received a bond of men, and ministers of the high priests, and of the pharises came thither with lanterns, and firebrands, and weapons.

Jn 18:4
Then Iesus knowing all things that should come on him, went forth and said unto them: whom seek ye?

Jn 18:5
They answered him: Iesus of Nazareth. Iesus said unto them: I am he. Iudas also which betrayed him, stood with them.

Jn 18:6
As soon as he had said unto them I am he, they went backwards and fell to the ground.

Jn 18:7
And he asked them again: whom seek ye? They said: Iesus of Nazareth.

Jn 18:8
Iesus answered, I said unto you, I am he. If ye seek me, let these go their way.

Jn 18:9
That the saying might be fulfilled which he spake: of them which thou gavest have I not lost one.

Jn 18:10
Simon Peter had a sword, and drew him out, and smote the high priest's servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus.

Jn 18:11
Then said Iesus unto Peter: put up thy sword into the sheath: shall I not drink of the cup which my father had given me?

Jn 18:12
Then the company, and the Captain, and the ministers of the jewes, took Iesus and bound him,

Jn 18:13
and led him away to Anna first: For he was father-in-law unto Caiphas, which was the high priest that same year.

Jn 18:14
Caiphas was he that gave counsel to the jewes that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

Jn 18:15
Simon Peter followed Iesus, and another disciple, that disciple was known of the high priest, and went in with Iesus into the palace of the high priest.

Jn 18:16
But Peter stood at the door without. Then went out that other disciple which was known unto the high priest, and spake to the damsel that kept the door, and brought in Peter.

Jn 18:17
Then said the damsel that kept the door unto Peter: Art not thou one of this man's disciples? He said: I am not.

Jn 18:18
The servants and the ministers stood there, and had made a fire of coals. For it was cold, and they warmed themselves. Peter also stood among them and warmed himself.

Jn 18:19
The high priest asked Iesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.

Jn 18:20
Iesus answered him: I spake openly in the world. I ever taught in the synagogue and in the temple whither all the jewes resorted: and in secret have I said nothing:

Jn 18:21
why askest thou me? Ask them which heard me what I said unto them. Behold they can tell what I said.

Jn 18:22
When he had thus spoken, one of the ministers which stood by, smote Iesus on the face saying: Answerest thou the high priest so?

Jn 18:23
Iesus answered him: If I have evil spoken, bear witness of the evil: if I have well spoken, why smitest thou me?

Jn 18:24
Annas sent him bound unto Caiphas the high priest.

Jn 18:25
Simon Peter stood and warmed himself, and they said unto him: Art not thou also one of his disciples? He denied it, and said: I am not.

Jn 18:26
One of the servants of the high priest (his cousin whose ear Peter smote off) said unto him: did not I see thee in the garden with him?

Jn 18:27
Peter denied it again: and immediately the cock crew.

Jn 18:28
Then led they Iesus from Caiphas into the hall of judgement. It was in the morning, and they themselves went not into the judgement house lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat Pascha.

Jn 18:29
Pilate then went out unto them and said: What accusation bring ye against this man?

Jn 18:30
They answered and said unto him: If he were not an evil doer, we would not have delivered him unto thee.

Jn 18:31
Then said Pilate unto them: take him unto you, and judge him after your own law. The jewes said unto him. It is not lawful for us to put any man to death.

Jn 18:32
That the words of Iesus might be fulfilled which he spake, signifying what death he should die.

Jn 18:33
Then Pilate entered into the judgement house again, and called Iesus, and said unto him: Art thou king of the jewes?

Jn 18:34
Iesus answered: sayest thou that of thyself, or did other tell it thee of me?

Jn 18:35
Pilate answered: Am I a jew? Thine own nation and high priests have delivered thee unto me. What hast thou done?

Jn 18:36
Iesus answered: my kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world then would my ministers surely fight, that I should not be delivered to the jewes, but now is my kingdom not from hence.

Jn 18:37
Pilate said unto him: Art thou a king then? Iesus answered: Thou sayest that I am a king. For this cause was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the trueth. And all that are of the truth hear my voice.

Jn 18:38
Pilate said unto him: what is trueth? And when he had said that, he went out again unto the jewes, and said unto them: I find in him no cause at all.

Jn 18:39
Ye have a custom among you, that I should deliver you one loose at ester. Will ye that I loose unto you the king of the jewes.

Jn 18:40
Then cried they all again saying: Not him, but Barabas. Barabas was a robber.

Jn 19:1
Then Pilate took Iesus and scourged him.

Jn 19:2
And the soldiers wound a crown of thorns and put it on his head. And they did on him a purple garment,

Jn 19:3
and said: hail king of the jewes. And they smote him on the face.

Jn 19:4
Pilate went forth again, and said unto them: behold I bring him forth to you, that ye may know, that I find no fault in him.

Jn 19:5
Then came Iesus forth wearing a crown of thorns and a robe of purple. And Pilate said unto them: Behold the man.

Jn 19:6
When the high priests and ministers saw him, they cried saying: crucify him, crucify him. Pilate said unto them. Take ye him and crucify him: For I find no cause in him.

Jn 19:7
The jewes answered him. We have a law, and by our law he ought to die: because he made himself the son of God.

Jn 19:8
When Pilate heard that saying, he was the more afraid,

Jn 19:9
and went again into the judgement house, and said unto Iesus: whence art thou? Iesus gave him none answer.

Jn 19:10
Then said Pilate unto him: Speakest thou not unto me? Knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to loose thee?

Jn 19:11
Iesus answered: Thou couldest have no power at all against me, except it were given unto thee from above. Therefore he that delivered me unto thee, is more in sin.

Jn 19:12
And from thenceforth sought Pilate means to loose him: but the jewes cried saying: if thou let him go, thou art not Cesar's friend. Whosoever maketh himself a king, is against Cesar.

Jn 19:13
When Pilate heard that saying he brought Iesus forth, and sat down to give sentence, in a place called the pavement: But in the Hebrew tongue, Gabbatha.

Jn 19:14
(It was the saboth even which falleth in the ester feast, and about the sixth hour) And he said unto the jewes: Behold your king.

Jn 19:15
They cried, away with him, away with him, Crucify him. Pilate said unto them: Shall I crucify your king? The high priests answered: We have no king but Cesar.

Jn 19:16
Then delivered he him unto them to be crucified. And they took Iesus, and led him away.

Jn 19:17
And he bare his cross, and went forth into a place called the place of dead men's skulls (which is named in hebrew, Golgotha)

Jn 19:18
where they crucified him. And with him two other, on eitherside one, and Iesus in the midst.

Jn 19:19
Pilate wrote his title, and put it on the cross: The writing was, Iesus of Nazareth, king of the jewes.

Jn 19:20
This title read many of the jewes. For the place where Iesus was crucified, was nye to the city. And it was written in hebrew, greek and latin.

Jn 19:21
Then said the high priests of the jewes to Pilate: write not, king of the jewes, but that he said, I am king of the jewes.

Jn 19:22
Pilate answered: what I have written, that have I written.

Jn 19:23
The soldiers, when they had crucified Iesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part, and also his coat. The coat was without seam woven upon thorow and thorow.

Jn 19:24
And they said one to another: Let us not divide it: but cast lots who shall have it. That the scripture might be fulfilled which saith. They parted my raiment among them, and on my coat did cast lots. And the soldiers did such things in deed.

Jn 19:25
There stood by the cross of Iesus his mother, and his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.

Jn 19:26
When Iesus saw his mother, and the disciple standing whom he loved, he said unto his mother: Woman behold thy son.

Jn 19:27
Then said he to the disciple: behold thy mother. And from that hour the disciple took her for his own.

Jn 19:28
After that when Iesus perceived that all things were performed, that the scripture might be fulfilled: he said: I thirst.

Jn 19:29
There stood a vessel full of vinegar by. They filled a sponge with vinegar, and wound it about with hyssop, and put it to his mouth.

Jn 19:30
As soon as Iesus had received of the vinegar, he said: It is finished, and bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

Jn 19:31
The jewes then because it was the saboth even that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the saboth day (For that saboth day was an high day) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken and that they might be taken down.

Jn 19:32
Then came the soldiers and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with Iesus.

Jn 19:33
When they came to Iesus and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:

Jn 19:34
but one of the soldiers with a spear, thrust him into the side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.

Jn 19:35
And he that saw it bare record, and his record is true. And he knoweth that he saith true that ye might believe also.

Jn 19:36
These things were done that the scripture should be fulfilled: Ye shall not break a bone of him.

Jn 19:37
And again another scripture saith: They shall look on him, whom they pierced.

Jn 19:38
After that, Ioseph of Arimathia (which was a disciple of Iesus: but secretly for fear of the jewes) besought Pilate that he might take down the body of Iesus. And Pilate gave him license.

Jn 19:39
And there came also Nicodemus which at the beginning came to Iesus by night, and brought of myrrh and aloes mingled to gether about an hundred pound weight.

Jn 19:40
Then took they the body of Iesu and wound it in linen clothes with those confections as the manner of the jewes is to bury.

Jn 19:41
In the place where Iesus was crucified, was a garden, and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man laid.

Jn 19:42
There laid they Iesus because of the jewes' saboth even, for the sepulchre was nye at hand.

Jn 20:1
The morrow after the saboth day came Mary Magdalene early when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and saw the stone rolled away from the tomb.

Jn 20:2
Then she ran, and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Iesus loved, and said unto them: They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb and we cannot tell where they have laid him.

Jn 20:3
Peter went forth and that other disciple, and came unto the sepulchre.

Jn 20:4
They ran both to gether, and that other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

Jn 20:5
And he stooped down and saw the linen clothes, yet went he not in.

Jn 20:6
Then came Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and saw the linen clothes lie,

Jn 20:7
and the napkin that was about his head not lying with the linen cloth, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

Jn 20:8
Then went in also that other disciple which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw and believed.

Jn 20:9
For as yet they knew not the scriptures, that he should rise again from death.

Jn 20:10
And the disciples went away again unto their own home.

Jn 20:11
Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: As she wept, she bowed herself into the sepulchre

Jn 20:12
and saw two angels clothed in white sitting the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where they had laid the body of Iesus.

Jn 20:13
They said unto her: woman why weepest thou? She said unto them: They have taken away my Lord, and I wot not where they have laid him.

Jn 20:14
When she had thus said, she turned herself back and saw Iesus standing, and knew not that it was Iesus.

Jn 20:15
Iesus said unto her: woman why weepest thou? Whom seekest thou? She supposing that he had been the gardener, said unto him: Sir if thou have borne him hence tell me where thou hast laid him, that I will take him away.

Jn 20:16
Iesus said unto her: Mary. She turned herself, and said unto him: Rabboni which is to say master.

Jn 20:17
Iesus said unto her: touch me not, for I have not yet ascended to my father. But go to my brethren and say unto them, I ascend unto my father, and your father: my God and your god.

Jn 20:18
Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had spoken such things unto her.

Jn 20:19
The same day at night, which was the morrow after the saboth day, when the doors were shut (where the disciples were assembled to gedder for fear of the jewes,) came Iesus and stood in the midst, and said to them: peace be with you.

Jn 20:20
And when he had so said, he shewed unto them his hands and feet, and his side. Then were the disciples glad when they saw the Lord.

Jn 20:21
He said unto them again: peace be with you. As my father sent me, even so send I you.

Jn 20:22
And when he had said that, he blew on them, and said unto them: Receive the holy ghost.

Jn 20:23
whosoever's sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them: And whosoever's sins ye retain, they are retained.

Jn 20:24
Thomas one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Iesus came.

Jn 20:25
The other disciples said unto him: we have seen the Lord. And he said unto them: except I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger in the holes of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.

Jn 20:26
And after viij days again, his disciples were with in, and Thomas was with them. Iesus came when the doors were shut, and stood in the midst and said: peace be with you:

Jn 20:27
Than said he to Thomas: put in thy finger here, and see my hands, and put forth thy hand and thrust him into my side, and be not without faith: but believe.

Jn 20:28
Thomas answered and said unto him: my Lord, and my God.

Jn 20:29
Iesus said unto him: Thomas, because thou hast seen me, therefore hast thou believed: Happy are they that have not seen, and yet believe.

Jn 20:30
And many other signs did Iesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book.

Jn 20:31
These are written that ye might believe that Iesus is Christ the son of God. And that ye in believing ye might have life thorow his name.

Jn 21:1
After that Iesus shewed himself again at the sea of Tiberias. And on this wise shewed he himself.

Jn 21:2
There were together Simon Peter and Thomas, which is called Didymus: and Nathanael of Cana a city of Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of the disciples,

Jn 21:3
Simon Peter said unto them: I go a fishing. They said unto him: we also will go with thee. They went their way and entered into a ship straightway, and that night caught they nothing.

Jn 21:4
When the morning was now come, Iesus stood on the shore, Nevertheless the disciples knew not that it was Iesus.

Jn 21:5
Iesus said unto them: Sirs, have ye any meat? They answered him no.

Jn 21:6
And he said unto them: cast out your net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast out, and anon they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

Jn 21:7
Then said the disciple whom Iesus loved unto Peter: It is the Lord. When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he gird his mantle to him (for he was naked) and sprang into the sea.

Jn 21:8
The other disciples came by ship: For they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits, And they drew the net with fishes.

Jn 21:9
As soon as they were come to land, they saw hot coals laid and fish laid there on, and bread.

Jn 21:10
Iesus said unto them: bring of the fishes which ye have now caught.

Jn 21:11
Simon Peter stepped forth and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and .liij. And for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.

Jn 21:12
Iesus said unto them: come and dine. And none of the disciples durst ask him: what art thou? For they knew that it was the Lord.

Jn 21:13
Iesus then came and took bread, and gave them, and fish likewise.

Jn 21:14
And this is now the third time that Iesus appeared to his disciples, after that he was risen again from death.

Jn 21:15
When they had dined, Iesus said to Simon Peter: Simon Ioanna, lovest thou me more than these? He said unto him: yea Lord, thou knowest, that I love thee. He said unto him: feed my lambs.

Jn 21:16
He said to him again the second time: Simon Ioanna, lovest thou me? He said unto him: yea Lord thou knowest that I love thee. He said unto him: feed my sheep.

Jn 21:17
He said unto him the third time: Simon Ioanna, lovest thou me? Peter sorrowed because he said to him the third time, lovest thou me, and said unto him: Lord, thou knowest all things, thou knowest that I love thee. Iesus said unto him: feed my sheep.

Jn 21:18
Verily verily I say unto thee, when thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou art old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and lead thee whither thou wouldest not.

Jn 21:19
That spake he signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had said thus, he said to him: Follow me.

Jn 21:20
Peter turned about, and saw that disciple whom Iesus loved following (which also leaned on his breast at supper) and said: Lord which is he that shall betray thee?

Jn 21:21
When Peter saw him, he said to Iesus: Lord what shall he here do?

Jn 21:22
Iesus said unto him: If I will have him to tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.

Jn 21:23
Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die. And Iesus said not to him, he shall not die: but if I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?

Jn 21:24
The same disciple is he, which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things. And we know, that his testimony is true.

Jn 21:25
There are also many other things which Iesus did: the which if they should be written every one, I suppose the world could not contain the books that should be written. <Here endeth the gospell off Sainct Ihon.>

Acts 1:1
In my first treatise (Dear friend Theophilus) I have written of all that Iesus began to do and teach,

Acts 1:2
until the day in the which he was taken up, after that he thorow the holy ghost, had given commandments unto the Apostles, which he chose:

Acts 1:3
to whom also he shewed himself alive, after his passion by many tokens, appearing unto them forty days, and spake of the kingdom of God,

Acts 1:4
and gathered them together, and commanded them, that they should not depart from Ierusalem: but to wait for the promise of the father, whereof ye have heard of me.

Acts 1:5
For Ihon baptised with water but ye shall be baptised with the holy ghost, and that within this few days.

Acts 1:6
When they were come together, they asked of him, saying: Master wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israhel?

Acts 1:7
He said unto them: It is not for you to know the times, or the seasons which the father hath put in his own power:

Acts 1:8
but ye shall receive power of the holy ghost which shall come on you. And ye shall be witnesses unto me in Ierusalem, and in all iewery, and in Samary, and even unto the world's end.

Acts 1:9
And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld he was taken up, and a cloud received him up out of their sight.

Acts 1:10
And as they fastened their eyes in heaven, as he went, lo two men stood by them in white clothing,

Acts 1:11
which also said: ye men of Galile, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? This same Iesus which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come, even as ye have seen him go into heaven.

Acts 1:12
Then returned they unto Ierusalem from mount Olivete, which is nye to Ierusalem, containing a saboth day's journey.

Acts 1:13
And when they were come in, they went up into a parlour, where abode both Peter and Iames, Ihon and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartlemew and Matthew, Iames the son of Alpheus, and Simon Zelotes, and Iudas Iames' son.

Acts 1:14
