What then? Shall we sin, because we are not under the law: but under grace? God forbid.

Rom 6:16
Remember ye not how that to whomsoever ye commit yourselves as servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey: whether it be of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?

Rom 6:17
God be thanked. Ye were once the servants of sin: But now have obeyed with your hearts unto the form of doctrine where unto ye were delivered.

Rom 6:18
Ye are then made free from sin, and are become the servants of righteousness.

Rom 6:19
I will speak grossly because of the infirmity of your flesh. As ye have given your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity, from iniquity unto iniquity: even so now give your members servants unto righteousness, that ye may be sanctified.

Rom 6:20
For when ye were servants of sin, ye were not under righteousness.

Rom 6:21
What fruit had ye then in those things, where of ye are now ashamed. For the end of those things is death.

Rom 6:22
But now are ye delivered from sin, and made the servants of God, and have your fruit that ye should be sanctified, and the end everlasting life.

Rom 6:23
For the reward of sin is death: but eternal life is the gift of God, thorow Iesus Christ our Lord.

Rom 7:1
Remember ye not brethren (I speak to them that know the law) how that the law hath power over a man as long as it endureth:

Rom 7:2
For the woman which is in subjection to a man, is bound by the law to the man, as long as he liveth. If the man be dead, she is lowsed from the law of the man.

Rom 7:3
So then if while the man liveth she couple herself with another man, she shall be counted a wedlock breaker. But if the man be dead she is free from the law: so that she is no wedlock breaker, though she couple herself with another man.

Rom 7:4
Even so ye my brethren, ye also are made dead as concerning the law by the body of Christ, that ye should be coupled to another (I mean to him that is risen again from death) that we should bring forth fruit unto God.

Rom 7:5
When we were in the flesh, the lusts of sin which were stirred up by the law, reigned in our members, to bring forth fruit unto death.

Rom 7:6
But now are we delivered from the law, and dead from it, whereunto we were in bondage, that we should serve in a new conversation of the spirit, and not in the old conversation of the letter.

Rom 7:7
What shall we say then? is the law sin? God forbid: but I knew not what sin meant but by the law. For I had not known what lust had meant, except the law had said, thou shalt not lust.

Rom 7:8
But sin took an occasion by the means of the commandment, and wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For verily without the law sin was dead.

Rom 7:9
I once lived without law: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I was dead.

Rom 7:10
And the very same commandment which was ordained unto life, was found to be unto me an occasion of death.

Rom 7:11
For sin took occasion by the means of the commandment and so deceived me, and by the self commandment slew me.

Rom 7:12
Wherefore the law is holy, and the commandment holy, just, and good.

Rom 7:13
Was that then which is good made death unto me? God forbid. Nay sin was death unto me, that it might appear how that sin by the means of that which is good, had wrought death in me: that sin which is under the commandment, might be out of measure sinful.

Rom 7:14
For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin:

Rom 7:15
because I wot not what I do. For what I would, that do I not: but what I hate, that do I.

Rom 7:16
If I do now that which I would not, I grant to the law that it is good.

Rom 7:17
So then now it is not I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

Rom 7:18
For I know that in me (that is to say in my flesh) dwelleth no good thing. To will is present with me: but I find no means to perform that which is good.

Rom 7:19
For I do not that good thing which I would: but that evil do I, which I would not.

Rom 7:20
Finally, if I do that I would not, then is it not I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me doeth it.

Rom 7:21
I find then by the law that when I would do good, evil is present with me.

Rom 7:22
I delight in the law of God, as concerning the inner man.

Rom 7:23
But I see another law in my members rebelling against the law of my mind, and subduing me unto the law of sin, which is in my members.

Rom 7:24
O wretched man that I am: who shall deliver me from this body of death?

Rom 7:25
I thank God by Iesus Christ our Lord: So then I myself in my mind serve the law of God, and in my flesh the law of sin.

Rom 8:1
There is then no damnation to them which are in Christ Iesu, which walk not after the flesh: but after the spirit.

Rom 8:2
For the law of the spirit, wherein is life thorow Iesus Christ hath delivered me from the law of sin, and death.

Rom 8:3
For what the law could not do in as much as it was weak because of the flesh: that performed God, and sent his son in the similitude of sinful flesh, and by sin damned sin in the flesh:

Rom 8:4
that the righteousness required of the law, might be fulfilled in us, which walk not after the flesh: but after the spirit.

Rom 8:5
For they that are carnal, are carnally minded. and they that are spiritual are ghostly minded.

Rom 8:6
To be carnally minded is death. and to be spiritually minded is life, and peace:

Rom 8:7
because that the fleshly mind is enmity against God: For it is not obedient to the law of God, neither can be.

Rom 8:8
So then they that are given to the flesh, cannot please God.

Rom 8:9
But ye are not given to the flesh, But to the spirit: If so be that the spirit of God dwell in you. If there be any man that hath not the spirit of Christ, the same is none of his.

Rom 8:10
If Christ be in you, the body is dead because of sin: But the spirit is life for righteousness' sake.

Rom 8:11
Wherefore if the spirit of him that raised up Iesus from death, dwell in you: even he that raised up Christ from death, shall quicken your mortal bodies, because that his spirit dwelleth in you.

Rom 8:12
Therefore brethren we are now debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh:

Rom 8:13
For if ye live after the flesh, ye must die. But if ye mortify the deeds of the body, by the help of the spirit, ye shall live,

Rom 8:14
for as many as are led by the spirit of God, are the sons of God.

Rom 8:15
For ye have not received the spirit of bondage to fear any more, but ye have received the spirit of adoption whereby we cry Abba father.

Rom 8:16
The same spirit certifieth our spirit that we are the sons of God.

Rom 8:17
If we be sons, we are also heirs (the heirs I mean of God) and heirs annexed with Christ, if so be that we suffer together, that we may be glorified together.

Rom 8:18
For I suppose that the afflictions of this life, are not worthy of the glory which shall be shewed upon us.

Rom 8:19
Also the fervent desire of the creatures abideth looking when the sons of God shall appear

Rom 8:20
because the creatures are subdued to vanity against their will: but for his will which subdued them in hope.

Rom 8:21
For the very creatures shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption, into the glorious liberty of the sons of God.

Rom 8:22
For we know that every creature groaneth with us also, and travaileth in pain even unto this time.

Rom 8:23
Not they only, but even we also which have the first fruits of the spirit mourn in ourselves and wait for the adoption, and look for the deliverance of our bodies.

Rom 8:24
For we are saved by hope. But hope that is seen is no hope. For how can a man hope for that which he seeth?

Rom 8:25
but and if we hope for that we see not, then do we with patience abide for it.

Rom 8:26
Likewise the spirit also helpeth our infirmities. For we know not, what to desire as we ought: but the spirit maketh intercession mightily for us with groanings which cannot be expressed with tongue.

Rom 8:27
And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the meaning of the spirit: for he maketh intercession for the saints according to the pleasure of God.

Rom 8:28
For we know well that all things work for the best unto them that love God, which also are called of purpose.

Rom 8:29
For those which he knew before, he also ordained before, that they should be like fashioned unto the shape of his son, that he might be the first begotten son among many brethren.

Rom 8:30
Moreover which he appointed before, them he also called. And which he called, them also he justified. which he justified, them he also glorified.

Rom 8:31
What shall we then say unto these things? if God be on our side: who can be against us?

Rom 8:32
which spared not his own son, but gave him for us all: How shall he not with him give us all things also?

Rom 8:33
Who shall lay anything to the charge of godde's chosen? It is God that justifieth:

Rom 8:34
who then shall condemn? it is Christ which is dead, Ye rather which is risen again, which is also on the right hand of God and maketh intercession for us.

Rom 8:35
Who shall separate us from godde's love? shall tribulation? or anguish? or persecution, other hunger? other nakedness? other peril? other sword?

Rom 8:36
As it is written: For thy sake are we killed all day long, and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.

Rom 8:37
Nevertheless in all these things we overcome strongly thorow his help that loved us.

Rom 8:38
Yea and I am sure that neither death, neither life, neither angell, nor rule, neither power, neither things present, neither things to come,

Rom 8:39
neither height, neither lowth, neither any other creature shall be able to depart us from Godde's love, which is in Christ Iesu our Lord.

Rom 9:1
I Say the truth in Christ and lie not, in that whereof my conscience beareth me witness in the holy ghost,

Rom 9:2
that I have great heaviness, and continual sorrow in my heart.

Rom 9:3
For I have wished myself to be cursed from Christ for my brethren, which are my kinsmen as pertaining to the flesh.

Rom 9:4
Which are the Israelites, to whom pertaineth the adoption, and the glory, and the testaments, and the ordinance of the law, and the service of God, and the promises,

Rom 9:5
whose also are the fathers, and they of whom (as concerning the flesh) Christ came: which is God over all things blessed forever Amen.

Rom 9:6
I speak not these things as though the words of God had took none effect. For they are not all Israelites which came of Israhel,

Rom 9:7
Neither are they all children straightway because they are the seed of Abraham: But in Isaac shall thy seed be called,

Rom 9:8
that is to say, They which are the children of the flesh, are not the children of God. But the children of promise are counted the seed.

Rom 9:9
For this is a word of promise, about this time will I come, and Sara shall have a son.

Rom 9:10
Neither was it to with her only: but also when Rebecca was with child by one, I mean by our father Isaac,

Rom 9:11
yer the children were born, when they had neither done good neither bad (that the purpose of God which is by election, might stand) it was said unto her, not by the reason of works, but by grace of the caller,

Rom 9:12
the elder shall serve the younger.

Rom 9:13
As it is written: Iacob he loved, but Esau he hated.

Rom 9:14
What shall we say then? is there any unrighteousness with God? God forbid.

Rom 9:15
For he saith to Moses: I will shew mercy to whom I shew mercy: And will have compassion on whom I have compassion.

Rom 9:16
So lieth it not then in a man's will, or running, but in the mercy of God.

Rom 9:17
For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh: Even for this same purpose have I stirred thee up, to shew my power on thee, and that my name might be declared thorowout all the world.

Rom 9:18
So hath he mercy on whom he will. And whom he will he maketh hard hearted.

Rom 9:19
Thou wilt say then unto me: why then blameth he us yet? For who can resist his will?

Rom 9:20
But o man what art thou, which disputest with God? shall the work say to the workman: why hast thou made me on this fashion?

Rom 9:21
Hath not the potter power over the clay, even of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?

Rom 9:22
Even so, God willing to shew his wrath, and to make his power known, suffered with long patience the vessels of wrath, ordained to damnation,

Rom 9:23
that he might declare the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy, which he had prepared unto glory:

Rom 9:24
that is to say, us which he called, not of the jewes only, but also of the gentiles.

Rom 9:25
As he saith in Osee: I will call them my people which were not my people: and her beloved which was not beloved.

Rom 9:26
And it shall come to pass in the place where it was said unto them: Ye are not my people, that there shall be called the sons of the living God.

Rom 9:27
But Esaias crieth for Israhel, though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet shall a remnant be saved.

Rom 9:28
He finisheth the work verily and maketh it short in righteousness. For a short word will God make on earth.

Rom 9:29
And as Esaias said before: Except the Lord of saboth had left us seed, we had been made as Zodoma, and had been likened to Gomorra.

Rom 9:30
What shall we say then? we say that the gentiles which followed not righteousness, have overtaken righteousness I mean the righteousness which cometh of faith.

Rom 9:31
But Israel which followed the law of righteousness, could not attain unto the law of righteousness.

Rom 9:32
And wherefore? Because they sought it not by faith: but as it were by the works of the law. For they have stumbled at the stumbling stone.

Rom 9:33
As it is written: Behold I put in Syon a stumbling stone, and a rock which shall make men fall. And none that believe on him, shall be ashamed.

Rom 10:1
Brethren my heart's desire, and prayer to God for Israel is that they might be saved.

Rom 10:2
For I bear them record that they have a fervent mind to Godward, but not according to knowledge.

Rom 10:3
For they are ignorant of the righteousness which is allowed before God, and go about to establish their own righteousness and therefore are not obedient unto the righteousness which is of value before God.

Rom 10:4
For Christ is the end of the law to justify all that believe.

Rom 10:5
Moses describeth the righteousness which cometh of the law, how that the man which doth the things of the law shall live therein.

Rom 10:6
But the righteousness which cometh of faith, speaketh on this wise: Say not in thine heart: who shall ascend into heaven? (That is nothing else than to fetch Christ down.)

Rom 10:7
Other who shall descend into the deep? That is nothing else but to fetch up Christ from death.

Rom 10:8
But what saith the scripture? The word is nye thee, even in thy mouth and in thine heart. This word is the word of faith which we preach.

Rom 10:9
For if thou shalt knowledge with thy mought that Iesus is the Lord, and shalt believe with thine heart that God raised him up from death, thou shalt be safe.

Rom 10:10
For the belief of the heart justifieth: and to knowledge with the mouth maketh a man safe.

Rom 10:11
For the scripture saith: whosoever believeth on him, shall not be ashamed.

Rom 10:12
There is no difference between the iewe and the gentile. For one is Lord of all, which is rich unto all that call on him.

Rom 10:13
For whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be safe.

Rom 10:14
How shall they call on him, on whom they believed not? how shall they believe on him of whom they have not heard? how shall they hear with out a preacher?

Rom 10:15
And how shall they preach except they be sent? As it is written: how beautiful are the feet of them which bring glad tidings of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things.

Rom 10:16
But they have not all obeyed to the gospell. For Esaias saith: Lord who shall believe our sayings?

Rom 10:17
So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing cometh by the word of God.

Rom 10:18
But I ask: have they not heard? No doubt, their sound went out into all lands: and their words into the ends of the world.

Rom 10:19
But I demand whether Israhel did know or not? First Moses saith: I will provoke you for to envy by them that are no people, and by a foolish nation I will anger you.

Rom 10:20
Esaias after that is bold and saith. I am found of them that sought me not, and have appeared to them that asked not after me.

Rom 10:21
And against Israhel he saith: All day long have I stretched forth my hands unto a people that believeth not, but speaketh against me.

Rom 11:1
I say then: hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For even I verily am an Israelite of the seed of Abraham, and of the tribe of Benjamin,

Rom 11:2
God hath not cast away his people which he knew before. Other wot ye not what the scripture saith by the mouth of Helias, how he spake to God against Israhel, saying:

Rom 11:3
Lord they have killed thy prophets and digged down thine altars: and I am left only, and they seek my death.

Rom 11:4
But what saith the answer of God to him again? I have reserved unto me seven thousand men which have not bowed their knees to baal.

Rom 11:5
Even so at this time is there a remnant left thorow the election of grace.

Rom 11:6
If it be of grace then is it not by the deserving of works. For then were faveour no more faveour. If it be by the deserving of works, then is there no faveour. For then were deserving no deserving.

Rom 11:7
What then? Israhel hath not obtained that that he sought. No but yet the election hath obtained it. The remnant are blinded,

Rom 11:8
according as it is written: God hath given them the spirit of unquietness: eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear, even unto this day.

Rom 11:9
And David saith: Let their table be made a snare to take them with all, and an occasion to fall, and a reward unto them.

Rom 11:10
Let their eyes be blinded that they see not: and ever bow down their backs.

Rom 11:11
I say then: Have they therefore stumbled that they should but fall only? God forbid: but thorow their fall is health happened unto the gentiles for to provoke them with all.

Rom 11:12
Wherefore if the fall of them, be the riches of the world: and the minishing of them the riches of the gentiles: How much more should it be so if they all believed.

Rom 11:13
I speak to you gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the gentiles I will magnify mine office

Rom 11:14
that might provoke them which are my flesh: and might save some of them.

Rom 11:15
For if the casting away of them, be the reconciling of the worlde: what shall the receiving of them be, but life again from death?

Rom 11:16
For if one piece be holy, the whole heap is holy. And if the root be holy, the branches are holy also.

Rom 11:17
Though some of the branches be broken off, and thou being a wild olive tree art graft in among them, and made part taker of the root, and fatness of the olive tree,

Rom 11:18
boast not thyself against the branches. For if thou boast thyself, remember that thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

Rom 11:19
Thou wilt say then: the branches are broken off, that I might be graft in.

Rom 11:20
Thou sayest well: because of unbelief they are broken off, and thou standest steadfast in faith. Be not high minded, but fear:

Rom 11:21
seeing that God spared not the natural branches, lest haply he also spare not thee.

Rom 11:22
Behold the kindness and rigorousness of God: on them which fell, rigorousness: but towards thee kindness, if thou continue in his kindness. Or else thou shalt be hewn off,

Rom 11:23
and they if they bide not still in unbelief shall be grafted in again. For God is of power to graft them in again.

Rom 11:24
For if thou wast cut out of a natural wild olive tree, and wast graffed contrary to nature in a true olive tree: how much more shall the natural branches be graffed in their own olive tree again.

Rom 11:25
I would not that this secret should be hid from you my brethren (lest ye should be wise in your own conceits) that partly blindness is happened in Israhell, until the fullness of the gentiles be come in.

Rom 11:26
And so all Israhell shall be saved. As it is written: There shall come out of Sion he that doth deliver, and shall turn away the ungodliness of Iacob.

Rom 11:27
And this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.

Rom 11:28
As concerning the gospell, They are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are loved for the fathers' sakes.

Rom 11:29
For verily the gifts and calling of God are such, that it cannot repent him of them,

Rom 11:30
for look, as ye in time passed have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy thorow their unbelief:

Rom 11:31
even so now have they not believed the mercy which is happened unto you, That they also may obtain mercy.

Rom 11:32
God hath wrapped all nations in unbelief, that he might have mercy on all.

Rom 11:33
O the deepness of the abundant wisdom and knowledge off God: how incomprehensible are his judgements, and his ways unsearchable.

Rom 11:34
For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who was his counsellor?

Rom 11:35
other who hath given unto him first, that he might be recompensed again?

Rom 11:36
For of him, and thorow him, and unto him are all things. To him be glory forever Amen.

Rom 12:1
I beseech you therefore brethren by the mercifulness of God that ye make your bodies a quick sacrifice, holy and acceptable unto God which is your reasonable serving of God.

Rom 12:2
and fashion not yourselves like unto this worlde: But be ye changed in your shape, by the renewing of your wits, that ye may feel what thing that good, that acceptable, and perfect will of God is.

Rom 12:3
For I say (thorow the grace that unto me given is) to every man among you, that no man esteem of himself more than it becometh him to esteem: But that he discreetly judge of himself according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.

Rom 12:4
As we have many members in one body: and all members have not one office:

Rom 12:5
So we being many are one body in Christ: and every man (among ourselves) one another's members.

Rom 12:6
Seeing that we have divers gifts according to the grace that is given unto us, if any man have the gift of prophecy, let him have it that it be agreeing unto the faith.

Rom 12:7
Let him that hath an office, wait on his office.

Rom 12:8
Let him that teacheth take heed to his doctrine. Let him that exhorteth give attendance to his exhortation. If any man give, let him do it with singleness. Let him that ruleth do it with diligence. If any man shew mercy let him do it with cheerfulness.

Rom 12:9
Let love be without dissimulation. Hate that which is evil, and cleave unto that which is good.

Rom 12:10
Be kind one to another, with brotherly love. In giving honour go one before another.

Rom 12:11
Let not that business which ye have in hand be tedious to you. Be fervent in the spirit. Apply yourselves to the time.

Rom 12:12
Rejoice in hope. Be patient in tribulation, continue in prayer.

Rom 12:13
Distribute unto the necessity of the saints.

Rom 12:14
Bless them which persecute you: bless but curse not.

Rom 12:15
Be merry with them that are merry. Weep with them that weep.

Rom 12:16
Be of like affection one towards another. Be not high minded, but make yourselves equal to them of the lower sort. Be not wise in your own opinions.

Rom 12:17
Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide aforehand things honest in the sight of all men.

Rom 12:18
If it be possible, yet on your part have peace with all men.

Rom 12:19
Dearly beloved avenge not yourselves but give room unto the wrath of God. For it is written: vengeance is mine, and I will reward saith the Lord.

Rom 12:20
Therefore if thine enemy hunger feed him: if he thirst, give him drink. For in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head:

Rom 12:21
Be not overcome of evil: But overcome evil with goodness.

Rom 13:1
Let every soul submit himself unto the authority of the higher powers. There is no power but of God. The powers that be, are ordained of God.

Rom 13:2
Whosoever therefore resisteth power, resisteth the ordinance of God. They that resist, shall receive to themselves damnation.

Rom 13:3
For rulers are not to be feared for good works but for evil. Wilt thou be without fear of the power? Do well then: and so shalt thou be praised of the same.

Rom 13:4
For he is the minister of God, for thy wealth. But and if thou do evil, then fear: for he beareth not a sword for nought. for he is the minister of God, to take vengeance on them that do evil.

Rom 13:5
Wherefore ye must needs obey, not for fear of vengeance only: but also because of conscience.

Rom 13:6
Even for this cause pay ye tribute. For they are godde's ministers, serving for the same purpose.

Rom 13:7
Give to every man therefore his duetie: Tribute to whom tribute belongeth: Custom to whom custom is due: fear to whom fear belongeth: Honour to whom honour pertaineth.

Rom 13:8
Owe no thing to any man: but to love one another. For he that loveth another, fulfilleth the law.

Rom 13:9
For these commandments: Thou shalt not commit advoutry: Thou shalt not kill: Thou shalt not steal: Thou shalt not bear false witness: Thou shalt not desire: and so forth if there be any other commandment, are all comprehended in this saying: Love thine neighbor as thyself.

Rom 13:10
Love hurteth not his neighbor: Therefore is love the fulfilling of the law.

Rom 13:11
This also we know, I mean the season, how that it is time that we should now awake out of sleep. For now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.

Rom 13:12
The night is passed and the day is come nye. Let us therefore cast away the deeds of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.

Rom 13:13
Let us walk honestly as it were in the daylight: not in eating and drinking: neither in chambering and wantonness: neither in strife and envying:

Rom 13:14
but put ye on the Lord Iesus Christ. And make not provision for the flesh, to fulfill the lusts of it.

Rom 14:1
Him that is weak in the faith, receive unto you, not in disputing and troubling his conscience.

Rom 14:2
One believeth that he may eat all things. Another which is weak eateth herbs,

Rom 14:3
Let not him that eateth, despise him that eateth not. And let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth. For God hath received him.

Rom 14:4
What art thou that judgest another man's servant? Whether he stand or fall, that pertaineth unto his master. Yea, he shall stand. For God is able to make him stand.

Rom 14:5
This man putteth difference between day and day: another man counteth all days alike. See that no man waver in his own mind.

Rom 14:6
He that observeth one day more than another, doth it for the Lord's pleasure. And he that observeth not one day more than another, doth it to please the Lord, for he giveth God thanks. and he that eateth not, eateth not to please the Lord with all, and giveth God thanks.

Rom 14:7
For none of us liveth his own servant: and also none of us dieth his own servant.

Rom 14:8
If we live, we live to be at the Lord's will. And if we die, we die at the Lord's will. Whether we live therefore or die, we are the Lord's.

Rom 14:9
For Christ therefore died and rose again, and revived, that he might be Lord both of dead and quick.

Rom 14:10
But why doest thou then judge thy brother? other why dost thou despise thy brother? We shall all be brought before the judgement seat of Christ.

Rom 14:11
For it is written: As truly as I live saith the Lord, all knees shall bow to me, and all tongues shall give a knowledge to God.

Rom 14:12
So shall every one of us give accounts of himself to God.

Rom 14:13
Let us not therefore, judge one another any more. But judge this rather, that no man put a stumbling block, or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.

Rom 14:14
For I know, and surely believe in the Lord Iesus, that there is nothing common of itself: but unto him that judgeth it to be common, to him it is common.

Rom 14:15
If thy brother be grieved with thy meat, now walkest thou not charitably. Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.

Rom 14:16
Suffer ye not that your treasure be evil spoken of.

Rom 14:17
For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink, but righteousness, peace and joy, in the holy ghost.

Rom 14:18
For whosoever in these things serveth Christ, pleaseth well God: and is commended of men.

Rom 14:19
Let us follow those things which make for peace: and things wherewith one may edify another.

Rom 14:20
Destroy not the work of God for a little meat's sake. All things are pure: but it is evil for that man, which eateth with hurt of his conscience.

Rom 14:21
It is good neither to eat flesh, neither to drink wine, neither anything, whereby thy brother stumbleth, other falleth, or is made weak.

Rom 14:22
Hast thou faith? have it with thyself before God. Happy is he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.

Rom 14:23
For he that maketh conscience, is damned if he eat: Because he doth it not of faith. For whatsoever is not of faith, that same is sin.

Rom 15:1
We which are strong ought to bear the frailness of them which are weak, and not to stand in our own conceits.

Rom 15:2
Let every man please his neighbor unto his wealth and edifying.

Rom 15:3
For Christ pleased not himself: but as it is written: The rebukes of them which rebuked thee, fell on me.

Rom 15:4
Whatsoever things are written aforetime, are written for our learning that we thorow patience and comfort of the scripture should have hope.

Rom 15:5
God which is Lord of patience and consolation, give unto every one of you, that ye be like likeminded one towards another after the ensample of Iesu Christ,

Rom 15:6
that ye all agreeing together, may with one mouth praise God the father of our Lord Iesus.

Rom 15:7
Wherefore receive ye one another as Christ received us, to the praise of God.

Rom 15:8
And I say that Iesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises made unto the fathers.

Rom 15:9
And let the gentiles praise God for his mercy. As it is written: For this cause I will praise thee among the gentiles, and sing in thy name.

Rom 15:10
And again he saith: ye gentiles rejoice with his people.

Rom 15:11
Again, praise the Lord all ye gentiles, and laud him all nations.

Rom 15:12
And in another place Esaias saith: there shall be the root of Iesse, and he that shall rise to reign over the gentiles: in him shall the gentiles trust.

Rom 15:13
The God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may be rich in hope thorow the power of the holy ghost.

Rom 15:14
I myself am full certified of you my brethren that ye yourselves are full of goodness, and filled with all knowledge, and are able to counsel one another.

Rom 15:15
Nevertheless brethren I have somewhat boldly written unto you, as one that putteth you in remembrance, for the grace which is given me of God

Rom 15:16
for this purpose that I should be the minister of Iesu Christ among the gentiles, and should minister the glad tidings of God, that the gentiles might be an acceptable offering, sanctified by the holy ghost.

Rom 15:17
I have therefore whereof I may rejoice in Christ Iesu, in those things which pertain to God.

Rom 15:18
For I dare not speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me (to make the gentiles obedient) with word and deed,

Rom 15:19
in mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the spirit of God, so that from Ierusalem and the coasts round about, unto Illiricum, I have filled all countries with glad tidings of Christ.

Rom 15:20
So have I enforced myself to preach the gospell, not where Christ was named, lest I should have built on another man's foundation:

Rom 15:21
but as it is written: To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see: and they that heard not, shall understand.

Rom 15:22
For this cause I have been ofte let to come unto you:

Rom 15:23
but now seeing I have no more to do in these countries, and also have been desirous many years to come unto you,

Rom 15:24
when I shall take my journey into Spayne, I will come to you. I trust to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you after that I have somewhat enjoyed you.

Rom 15:25
Now go I unto Ierusalem, and minister unto the saints.

Rom 15:26
For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia, to make a certain distribution upon the poor saints which are at Ierusalem.

Rom 15:27
It hath pleased them verily, and their debtors are they. For if the gentiles be made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is to minister unto them in carnal things.

Rom 15:28
When I have performed this, and have shewed them this fruit, I will come back again by you into Spayne.

Rom 15:29
And I am sure when I come, that I shall come with abundance of the blessing of the gospell of Christ.

Rom 15:30
I beseech you brethren for our Lord Iesu Christe's sake, and for the love of the spirit, that ye help me in my business, with your prayers to God for me,

Rom 15:31
that I may be delivered from them which believe not in Jewry. and that this my service, which I have to Ierusalem, may be accepted of the saints,

Rom 15:32
that I may come unto you with joy, by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.

Rom 15:33
The God of peace be with all you Amen.

Rom 16:1
I commend unto you Phebe our sister (which is a minister of the congregation of Cencrea)

Rom 16:2
that ye receive her in the Lord as it becometh saints, and that ye assist her, in whatsoever business she needeth of your aid. For she hath succoured many, and mine own self also.

Rom 16:3
Greet Prisca and Aquila my helpers in Christ Iesu,

Rom 16:4
which have for my life laid down their own necks. Unto whom not I only give thanks: but also the congregations of the gentiles.

Rom 16:5
Likewise greet all the company that is in their house. Salute my well beloved Epenetes, which is the firstfruit among them of Achaia.

Rom 16:6
Greet Mary which bestowed much labour on us.

Rom 16:7
Salute Andronicus, and Iunia my cousins, which were prisoners with me also, which are well taken among the apostles, and were in Christ before me.

Rom 16:8
Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.

Rom 16:9
Salute Urban our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.

Rom 16:10
Salute Apellas approved in Christ. Salute them which are of Aristobolus' household.

Rom 16:11
Salute Herodion my kinsman. Greet them of the household of Narcissus which are in the Lord.

Rom 16:12
Salute Triphena and Triphosa, which women did labour in the Lord. Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.

Rom 16:13
Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

Rom 16:14
Greet Asincritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Mercurius, and the brethren which are with them.

Rom 16:15
Salute Philologus and Iulia, Nereus and his sister, and Olimpha, and all the saints which are with them.

Rom 16:16
Salute one another among yourselves with an holy kiss. The congregations of Christ salute you.

Rom 16:17
I beseech you brethren mark them which cause division, and give occasions of evil contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned: and avoid them.

Rom 16:18
For they that are such serve not the Lord Iesus Christ: but their own bellies. And with sweet preachings and flattering words deceive the hearts of the innocents:

Rom 16:19
for your obedience is spoken of among all men. I am glad no doubt of you. But yet I would have you wise unto that which is good. And to be innocent as concerning evil.

Rom 16:20
The God of peace tread Satan under your feet in short time. The grace of our Lord Iesu Christ be with you.

Rom 16:21
Timotheus my work fellow, and Lucius, and Iason, and Sopater, my kinsmen salute you.

Rom 16:22
I Tercius salute you, which wrote this epistle in the Lord.

Rom 16:23
Gaius mine host and the host of all the congregations, saluteth you. Erastus saluteth you, the chamberlain of the city. And Quartus a brother, saluteth you.

Rom 16:24
The grace of our Lord Iesu Christ be with you all Amen.

Rom 16:25
To him that is of power to establish you according to my gospell, wherewith I preach Iesus Christ, in opening of the mystery which was kept close since the world began,

Rom 16:26
and now is opened at this time and declared in the scriptures of prophecy, at the commandment of the everlasting God, to stir up obedience to the faith published among all nations:

Rom 16:27
To the same God, which alone is wise, be praise thorow Iesus Christ for ever Amen. <To the Romayns. Sent from Corrinthum by Phebe, she that was the minister unto the congregacion at Chenchrea.>

1Cor 1:1
Paul by vocation an apostle of Iesus Christ thorow the will of god, and brother Sostenes.

1Cor 1:2
Unto the congregation of God which is at Corinthum. To them that are sanctified in Jesus Christ, saints by calling, with all that call on the name of our Lord Iesus Christ in every place, both of theirs and of ours.

1Cor 1:3
Grace be with you and peace from God our father, and from the Lord Iesus Christ.

1Cor 1:4
I thank my god always on your behalf for the faveour of god which is given you by Iesus Christ,

1Cor 1:5
that in all things ye are made rich by him, in all speach and in all knowledge

1Cor 1:6
(even as the testimony of Iesus Christ was confirmed in you,)

1Cor 1:7
so that ye are behind in no gift, and wait for the appearing of our Lord Iesus Christ

1Cor 1:8
which shall strength you unto the end, that ye may be blameless in the day of our Lord Iesus Christ.

1Cor 1:9
God is faithful, by whom ye are called unto the fellowship of his son Iesus Christ our Lord.

1Cor 1:10
I beseech you brethren in the name of our Lord Iesus Christ, that ye all speak one thing, and that there be no dissension among you: but be ye perfect in one mind, and one meaning:

1Cor 1:11
It is shewed unto me (my brethren) of you by them that are of the house of Cloe, that there is strife among you,

1Cor 1:12
I speak of that which everyone of you sayth: I hold of Paul, Another sayth: I hold of Apollo: Another saith: I hold of Cephas: and another saith I hold of Christ.

1Cor 1:13
Is Christ divided? was Paul crucified for you? other were ye baptised in the name of Paul?

1Cor 1:14
I thank god that I christened none of you, but Crispus and Gaius,

1Cor 1:15
lest any should say that I in mine own name had baptised.

1Cor 1:16
I baptised also the house of Stephana. Furthermore know I not whether I baptised any man or no.

1Cor 1:17
For Christ sent me not to baptise, but to preach the gospell, not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should have been made of none effect.

1Cor 1:18
For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness: but unto us which are saved, it is the power of God.

1Cor 1:19
For it is written: I will destroy the wisdom of the wise and will cast away the understanding of the prudent.

1Cor 1:20
Where is the wise man? where is the scribe? where is the searcher of this world? Hath not god made the wisdom of this world foolishness?

1Cor 1:21
For when the world thorow wisdom knew not god, in the wisdom of god: it pleased god throwe foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.

1Cor 1:22
For the jews require a sign, and the greeks seek after wisdom.

1Cor 1:23
But we preach Christ crucified, unto the jews an occasion of falling and unto the greeks foolishness:

1Cor 1:24
but unto them which are called both of Jews and greeks we preach Christ the power of god, and the wisdom of god.

1Cor 1:25
For Godly foolishness is wiser than men: And godly weakness is stronger than are men.

1Cor 1:26
Brethren look on your calling how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many of high degree are called:

1Cor 1:27
But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world, to confound the wise. And hath chosen the weak things of the world, to confound things which are mighty.

1Cor 1:28
And vile things of the world, and things which are despised, hath god chosen yea and things of no reputation, for to bring to nought things of reputation,

1Cor 1:29
that no flesh should rejoice in his presence.

1Cor 1:30
And unto him pertain ye, in Christ Iesu, which of god is made unto us wisdom, and also righteousness, and sanctifying, and redemption.

1Cor 1:31
That according as it is written: he which rejoiceth, should rejoice in the Lord.

1Cor 2:1
And I brethren when I came to you, came not in gloriousness of words or of wisdom, shewing unto you the testimony of God.

1Cor 2:2
Neither shewed I myself that I knew any thing among you save Iesus Christ, even the same that was crucified.

1Cor 2:3
And I was among you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.

1Cor 2:4
And my words, and my preaching were not with enticing words of man's wisdom: but in shewing of the spirit and of power,

1Cor 2:5
that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men: but in the power of god.

1Cor 2:6
We speak that which is wisdom among them that are perfect: not the wisdom of this world neither of the rulers of this world (which goeth to nought,)

1Cor 2:7
but we speak the wisdom of god, which is in secret and lieth hid, which god ordained before the world unto our glory:

1Cor 2:8
which wisdom none of the rulers of the world knew. For had they known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory:

1Cor 2:9
but as it is written: The eye hath not seen, and the ear hath not heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which god hath prepared for them that love him.

1Cor 2:10
But God hath opened them unto us by his spirit. For the spirit searcheth all things, yea the bottom of godde's secrets.

1Cor 2:11
For what man knoweth the things of a man: save the spirit of a man which is within him? Even so the things of god knoweth no man, but the spirit of god.

1Cor 2:12
And we have not received the spirit of the world: but the spirit which cometh of god, for to know the things that are given to us of god,

1Cor 2:13
which things also we speak, not in the cunning words of man's wisdom, but with the cunning words of the holy ghost, making spiritual comparisons of spiritual things.

1Cor 2:14
For the natural man perceiveth not the things of the spirit of god: For they are but foolishness unto him. Neither can he perceive them because he is spiritually examined:

1Cor 2:15
but he that is spiritual discusseth all things: yet he himself is judged of no man.

1Cor 2:16
For who knoweth the mind of the Lord, other who shall inform him? but we understand the mind of Christ.

1Cor 3:1
And I could not speak unto you brethren as unto spiritual: but as unto carnal, even as it were unto babes in Christ.

1Cor 3:2
I gave you milk to drink and not meat. For ye then were not strong, no neither yet are strong.

1Cor 3:3
For ye are yet carnal. As long verily as there is among you envying, strife and dissension: are ye not carnal, and walk after the manner of men?

1Cor 3:4
As long as one saith: I hold of Paul, and another, I am of Apollo, are ye not carnal?

1Cor 3:5
What is Paul? what thing is apollo? but ministers by whom ye believed even as the Lord gave every man grace.

1Cor 3:6
I have planted: Apollo watered: but god gave increase.

1Cor 3:7
So then, neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth: but god which gave the increase.

1Cor 3:8
He that planteth, and he that watereth, are neither better than the other. Every man yet shall receive his reward according to his labour.

1Cor 3:9
We are goddis laborers: ye are goddis husbandry, ye are goddis building.

1Cor 3:10
According to the grace of god given unto me, as a wise builder have I laid the foundation, another hath built theron: but let every man take heed how he buildeth upon.

1Cor 3:11
For other foundation can no man lay, than that which is laid, which is Iesus Christ.

1Cor 3:12
If any man build on this foundation, gold, silver, precious stones, timber, hay, or stubble:

1Cor 3:13
every man's work shall appear. For the day shall declare it, and it shall be shewed in fire, and the fire shall try every man's work what it is.

1Cor 3:14
If any man's work that he hath built upon, bide, he shall receive a reward.

1Cor 3:15
If any man's work burn, he shall suffer loss: but he shall be safe himself: nevertheless yet as it were thorow fire.

1Cor 3:16
Are ye not ware that ye are the temple of god, and how that the spirit of god dwelleth in you?

1Cor 3:17
If any man defile the temple of god, him shall god destroy. For the temple of God is holy, which temple are ye.

1Cor 3:18
Let no man deceive himself. If any man seem wise among you, let him be a fool in this world, that he may be wise.

1Cor 3:19
For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written: he compasseth the wise in their craftiness.

1Cor 3:20
And again, God knoweth the thoughts of the wise that they be vain.

1Cor 3:21
Therefore let no man rejoice in men. For all things are yours,

1Cor 3:22
whether it be Paul, other Apollo, either Cephas: whether it be the world, either life, either death, whether they be present things or things to come: all are yours,

1Cor 3:23
and ye are Christe's, and Christ is goddis.

1Cor 4:1
Let men this wise esteem us, even as the ministers of Christ, and disposers of the secrets of god.

1Cor 4:2
Furthermore it is required of the disposers that they be found faithful.

1Cor 4:3
With me is it but a very small thing, that I should be judged of you, either of man's day. No I judge not mine own self.

1Cor 4:4
I know nought by myself: yet am I not thereby justified. It is the Lord that judgeth me.

1Cor 4:5
Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, which will lighten things that are hid in darkness: and open the counsels of the hearts. And then shall every man have praise of God.

1Cor 4:6
These things brethren I have described in mine own person, and Apollos: for your sakes, that ye might learn by us that no man count of himself beyond that which is above written: that one swell not against another for any man's cause.

1Cor 4:7
For who preferreth thee? What hast thou, that thou hast not received? if thou have received it: why rejoicest thou as though thou haddest not received it?

1Cor 4:8
Now ye are full: now ye are made rich: ye reign as kings without us: and I would to god ye did reign, that we might reign with you.

1Cor 4:9
Me thinketh that god hath shewed us which are apostles, for the hindmost of all, as it were men appointed to death. For we are a gazingstock unto the world, and to the angels, and to men,

1Cor 4:10
we are fools for Christe's sake, and ye are wise thorow Christ: we are weak, and ye are strong. Ye are honorable, and we are despised.

1Cor 4:11
Even unto this day we hunger and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted with fists, and have no certain dwelling place,

1Cor 4:12
and labour working with our own hands. We are reviled, and yet we bless. We are persecuted, and suffer it.

1Cor 4:13
We are evil spoken of, and we pray. We are made as it were the filthiness of the world, the offscouring of all things, even unto this time.

1Cor 4:14
I write not these things to shame you: but as my beloved sons I warn you.

1Cor 4:15
For though ye have ten thousand instructors in Christ: yet have ye not many fathers. In Christ Iesu, I have begotten you thorow the gospell.

1Cor 4:16
Wherefore I desire you to counterfeit me.

1Cor 4:17
For this cause have I sent unto you Timotheus, which is my dear son, and faithful in the Lord, which shall put you in remembrance of my ways which I have in Christ, even as I teach everywhere in all congregations.

1Cor 4:18
Some swell as though I would come no more at you:

1Cor 4:19
but I will come to you shortly, if god will, and will know, not the words of them which swell, but the power.

1Cor 4:20
For the Kingdom of God is not in words, but in power.

1Cor 4:21
What will ye? Shall I come unto you with a rod, or else in love, and in the spirit of meekness?

1Cor 5:1
There goeth a common saying that there is fornication among you, and such fornication as is not once named among the gentiles: that one should have his father's wife.

1Cor 5:2
And ye swell and have not rather sorrowed, that he which hath done this deed might be put from among you.

1Cor 5:3
For I verily as absent in body, even so present in spirit, have determined already (as though I were present) of him that hath done this deed,

1Cor 5:4
in the name of our Lord Iesu Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of the Lord Iesus Christ,

1Cor 5:5
to deliver him unto Satan, for the destruction of the flesh that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Iesus.

1Cor 5:6
Your rejoicing is not good. Know ye not that a little leaven soureth the whole lump of dough?

1Cor 5:7
Purge therefore the old leaven, that ye may be new dough as ye are sweet bread. For Christ our ester lamb is offered up for us.

1Cor 5:8
Therefore let us keep holyday, not with old leaven, neither with the leaven of maliciousness and wickedness but with the sweet bread of pureness and truth.

1Cor 5:9
I wrote unto you in the pistel that ye should not company with fornicators.

1Cor 5:10
And I meant not at all of the fornicators of this world, either of the covetous, or of extortioners, either of idolaters: for then must ye needs have gone out of the world:

1Cor 5:11
but now I have written unto you that ye company not together. If any that is called a brother, be a fornicator, or covetous, or a worshipper of images, either a railer, either a drunkard, or an extortioner: with him that is such see ye eat not.

1Cor 5:12
For what have I to do to judge them which are without? Do ye not judge them that are within?

1Cor 5:13
Them that are without, god shall judge. Put away from among you that evil person.

1Cor 6:1
How dare one of you having business with another, go to law under the wicked? and not rather under the saints?

1Cor 6:2
Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? If the world shall be judged by you: are ye not good enough to judge small trifles.

1Cor 6:3
Know ye not how that we shall judge the angels? How much more may we judge things that pertain to the life?

1Cor 6:4
If ye have judgements of worldly matters, take them which are despised in the congregation, and make them judges.

1Cor 6:5
This I say to your shame. Is there utterly no wise man among you? what not one at all? that can judge between brother and brother?

1Cor 6:6
but one brother goeth to law with another: and that under the unbelievers?

1Cor 6:7
Now therefore there is utterly a fault among you, because ye go to law one with another. Why rather suffer ye not wrong? why rather suffer ye not yourselves to be robbed?

1Cor 6:8
Nay ye yourselves do wrong, and rob: and that the brethren.

1Cor 6:9
Do ye not remember how that the unrighteous shall not inherit the kingdom of god? Be not deceived. For neither fornicators, neither worshippers of images, neither whoremongers, neither weaklings, neither abusers of themselves with mankind,

1Cor 6:10
neither thieves, neither the covetous, neither drunkards, neither cursed speakers, neither pillers, shall inherit the kingdom of god.

1Cor 6:11
And such were ye verily: but ye are washed: ye are sanctified: ye are justified by the name of the Lord Iesus: And by the spirit of our God.

1Cor 6:12
All things are lawful unto me: but all things are not profitable. I may do all things: but I will be brought under no man's power.

1Cor 6:13
Meats are ordained for the belly, and the belly for meats: but God shall destroy both him and them. Let not the body be applied unto fornication, but unto the Lord, and the Lord unto the body.

1Cor 6:14
God hath raised up the Lord, and shall raise us up by his power.

1Cor 6:15
Other remember ye not, that your bodies are the members of Christe? Shall I now take the members of Christ, and make them the members of an harlot? God forbid.

1Cor 6:16
Do ye not understand that he which coupleth himself with an harlot, is become one body? For two (saith he) shall be one flesh:

1Cor 6:17
but he that is joined unto the Lord is one spirit.

1Cor 6:18
Flee fornication. All sins that a man doth, are without the body. But he that is a fornicator, sinneth against his own body.

1Cor 6:19
Know ye not how that your bodies are the temple of the holy ghost, which is in you, whom he have of God, and how that ye are not your own?

1Cor 6:20
For ye are dearly bought. Therefore glorify ye god in your bodies and in your spirits, for they are goddis.

1Cor 7:1
As concerning the things whereof ye wrote unto me: It is good for a man, not to touch a woman.

1Cor 7:2
Nevertheless to avoid fornication, let every man have his wife: and let every woman have her husband.

1Cor 7:3
Let the man give unto the wife due benevolence. Likewise also the wife unto the man.

1Cor 7:4
The wife hath not power over her own body: but the husband: And likewise the man hath not power over his own body: but the wife.

1Cor 7:5
Withdraw not your selves one from another except it be with consent for a time, for to give yourselves to fasting and prayer, and afterward come again to the same thing, lest Satan tempt you for your incontinency.

1Cor 7:6
This I say of favour, not of commandment.

1Cor 7:7
For I would that all men were as I my self am: but every man hath his proper gift of god, one after this manner, another after that.

1Cor 7:8
I say unto the unmarried men, and widows: it is good for them if they abide even as I do:

1Cor 7:9
but and if they cannot abstain, let them marry. For it is better to marry than to burn.

1Cor 7:10
Unto the married command not I, but the Lord: that the wife separate not herself from the man.

1Cor 7:11
If she separate herself, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled unto her husband again. And let not the husband put away his wife from him.

1Cor 7:12
To the remnant speak I, and not the Lord: if any brother have a wife that believeth not, if she be content to dwell with him, let him not put her away.

1Cor 7:13
And the woman which hath to her husband an infidel, if he consent to dwell with her, let her not put him away.

1Cor 7:14
For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife: and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband. Or else were your children unclean: but now are they pure.

1Cor 7:15
But and if the unbelieving depart, let him depart. A brother or a sister is not in subjection to such. God hath called us in peace.

1Cor 7:16
For how knowest thou o woman, whether thou shalt save thy husband or not? Other how knowest thou o man, whether thou shalt save the wife or not?

1Cor 7:17
but even as god hath distributed to every man. As the Lord hath called every person, so let him walk: and so ordain I in all congregations.

1Cor 7:18
If any man be called being circumcised, let him add nothing thereto. If any be called uncircumcised: let him not be circumcised.

1Cor 7:19
Circumcision is nothing, uncircumcision is nothing: but the keeping of the commandments of god is altogether.

1Cor 7:20
Let every man abide in the same state wherein he was called.

1Cor 7:21
Art thou called a servant? care not for it. Nevertheless if thou mayst be free, use it rather.

1Cor 7:22
For he that is called in the Lord being a servant, is the Lord's freeman. Likewise he that is called being free, is Christe's servant.

1Cor 7:23
Ye are dearly bought, be not men's servants.

1Cor 7:24
Brethren let every man wherein he is called, therein abide with god.

1Cor 7:25
As concerning virgins, I have no commandment of the Lord: yet give I counsel as one that hath obtained of the Lord to be faithful.

1Cor 7:26
I suppose that it is good for the present necessity. For it is good for a man so to be.

1Cor 7:27
Art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be lowsed. Art thou lowsed from a wife? seek not a wife.

1Cor 7:28
But and if thou take a wife, thou hast not sinned. Likewise if a virgin marry, she hath not sinned: nevertheless such shall have trouble in their flesh: but I favor you.

1Cor 7:29
This say I brethren, the time is short. It remaineth that they which have wives, be as though they had none:

1Cor 7:30
and they that weep, be as though they wept not: and they that rejoice, be as though they rejoiced not: And they that buy, be as though they possessed not:

1Cor 7:31
And they that use this world, be as though they used it not: For the fashion of this world goeth away.

1Cor 7:32
I would have you without care, the single man careth for the things of the Lord, how he may please the Lord:

1Cor 7:33
but he that hath married, careth for the things of the world, how he may please his wife.

1Cor 7:34
There is difference between a virgin and a wife. The single woman careth for the things of the Lord, that she may be pure both in body and also in spirit: but she that is married, careth for the things of the world, how she may please her husband.

1Cor 7:35
This speak I for your profit, not to tangle you in a snare: but for that which is honest and comely unto you And that ye may quietly cleave unto the Lord without separation.

1Cor 7:36
If any man think that it is uncomely for his virgin if she pass the time of marriage, and if so need require, let him do what he listeth, he sinneth not: let them be coupled in marriage.

1Cor 7:37
Nevertheless, he that purposeth surely in his heart, having none need: but hath power over his own will: and hath so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, doth well.

1Cor 7:38
So then he that joineth his virgin in marriage doth well. And he that joineth not his virgin in marriage doth better.

1Cor 7:39
The wife is bound to the law as long as her husband liveth. If her husband sleep, she is at liberty to marry with whom she will only in the Lord.

1Cor 7:40
But she is happier if she so abide, in my judgement. And I think verily that I have the spirit of God.

1Cor 8:1
To speak of things dedicate unto idols, we are sure that we all have knowledge. Knowledge maketh a man swell: but love edifieth.

1Cor 8:2
If any man think that he knoweth any thing, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.

1Cor 8:3
But if any man love god, the same is known of him.

1Cor 8:4
To speak of meat dedicat unto idols, we are sure that there is none idol in the world: and that there is none other god but one.

1Cor 8:5
And though there be that are called goddes, whether in heaven or in earth (as there be goddes many and lords many)

1Cor 8:6
but unto us is there one god, which is the father, of whom are all things, and we in him: and one Lord Iesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.

1Cor 8:7
But every man hath not knowledge. For some suppose that there is an idol, until this hour, and eat as of a thing offered unto the idol, and so their consciences being yet weak are defiled.

1Cor 8:8
Meat maketh us not acceptable to god: Neither if we eat are we the better: Neither if we eat not are we the worse.

1Cor 8:9
But take heed that your liberty cause not the weak to fall.

1Cor 8:10
For if some man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idol's temple shall not the conscience of him which is weak be boldened to eat those things which are offered unto the idol?

1Cor 8:11
And so thorow thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish for whom Christ died.

1Cor 8:12
When we sin so against the brethren and wound their weak consciences, we sin against Christ.

1Cor 8:13
Wherefore if meat hurt my brother, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth, because I will not hurt my brother.

1Cor 9:1
Am I not an apostle? am I not free? have I not seen Iesus Christ our Lord? Are not ye my work in the Lord.

1Cor 9:2
If I be not an apostle unto other, yet am I unto you. For the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.

1Cor 9:3
Mine answer to them that ask me, is this:

1Cor 9:4
Have we not power to eat and to drink?

1Cor 9:5
Either have we not power to lead about a sister to wife as well as other apostles, and as the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?

1Cor 9:6
Either only I and Barnabas have not power this to do?

1Cor 9:7
Who goeth a warfare any time at his own cost? who planteth a vineyard and eateth not of the fruit? or who feedeth a flock and eateth not of the milk?

1Cor 9:8
Say I these things after the manner of men? or sayth not the law the same also?

1Cor 9:9
For it is written in the law of Moses: Thou shall not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn. Doth god take thought for oxen?

1Cor 9:10
Either saith he it not all together for our sakes? For our sakes no doubt this is written: that he which eareth should ear in hope: and that he which throsheth in hope, should be part taker of his hope.

1Cor 9:11
If we sow unto you spiritual things: is it a great thing if we reap your carnal things?

1Cor 9:12
If other be part takers of this power over you? wherefore are not we rather. Nevertheless we have not used this power: but suffer all things lest we should hinder the gospell of Christ.

1Cor 9:13
Do ye not understand how that they which minister in the temple: have their finding of the temple? And they which wait at the altar are partakers with the altar?

1Cor 9:14
Even so also did the Lord ordain, that they which preach the gospell, should live of the gospell:

1Cor 9:15
But I have used none of these things. Neither wrote I these things that it should be so done unto me. It were better for me to die than any man should take this rejoicing from me.

1Cor 9:16
In that I preach the gospell I have nothing to rejoice of. For necessity is put unto me. Woe is it unto me if I preach not the gospell.

1Cor 9:17
If I do it with a good will, I have a reward. If I do it against my will, an office is committed unto me.

1Cor 9:18
What is my reward then? Verily that when I preach the gospell, I make the gospell of Christ free, that I misuse not mine authority in the gospell.

1Cor 9:19
For though I be free from all men, yet have I made myself servant unto all men, that I might win the more.

1Cor 9:20
And unto the iewes, I became as a iewe, to win the iewes. To them that were under the law, was I made as though I had been under the law, to win them that were under the law.

1Cor 9:21
To them that were without law, became I as though I had been without law (when I was not without law as pertaining to god, but under a law as concerning Christ) to win them that were without law.

1Cor 9:22
To the weak became I as weak, to win the weak. In all thing I fashioned myself to all men, to save at the leastway some.

1Cor 9:23
And this I do for the gospel's sake, that I might have my part thereof.

1Cor 9:24
Perceive ye not how that they which run in a course, run all, yet but one receiveth the reward? So run that ye may obtain.

1Cor 9:25
Every man that proveth masteries abstaineth from all things. And they do it to obtain a corruptible crown: but we to obtain an everlasting crown:

1Cor 9:26
I therefore so run, not as at an uncertain thing. So fight I, not as one that beateth the air:

1Cor 9:27
but I tame my body and bring him into subjection, lest after that I have preached to other, I myself should be a castaway.

1Cor 10:1
Brethren I would not that ye should be ignorant of this, how that our fathers were all under a cloud, and all passed thorow the sea,

1Cor 10:2
and were all baptised under Moses in the cloud and in the sea:

1Cor 10:3
and did all eat of one spiritual meat,

1Cor 10:4
and did all drink of one manner of spiritual drink. And they drank of that spiritual rock that followed them, which rock was Christ.

1Cor 10:5
But in many of them had god no delight. For they were overthrown in the wilderness.

1Cor 10:6
These are examples to us that we should not lust after evil things, as they lusted.

1Cor 10:7
Neither be ye worshippers of images as were some of them according as it is written: The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up again to play.

1Cor 10:8
Neither let us commit fornication as some of them committed fornication, and were destroyed in one day xxiij. thousand.

1Cor 10:9
Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them tempted and were destroyed of serpents.

1Cor 10:10
Neither murmur ye as some of them murmured, and were destroyed of the destroyer.

1Cor 10:11
All these things happened upon them for ensamples, and were written to put us in remembrance, whom the ends of the world are come upon.

1Cor 10:12
Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth, take heed lest he fall.

1Cor 10:13
There hath none other temptation taken you, but such as followeth the nature of man. God is faithful, which shall not suffer you to be tempted above your strength: but shall in the midst of the temptation make a way to escape out.

1Cor 10:14
Wherefore my dear beloved, flee from worshipping of idols.

1Cor 10:15
I speak as unto them which have discretion, judge ye what I say.

1Cor 10:16
Is not the cup of blessing which we bless, partaking of the blood of Christ? is not the bread which we break, partaking of the body of Christ?

1Cor 10:17
because that we (though we be many) yet are one bread, and one body in as much as we all are partakers of one bread.

1Cor 10:18
Behold Israhell which walketh carnally. Are not they which eat of the sacrifice, partakers of the altar?

1Cor 10:19
What say I then? that the image is anything? or that it which is offered to images is anything?

1Cor 10:20
Nay, but I say, that those things which the gentiles offer, they offer to devils, and not to god. And I would not that ye should have fellowship with the devils.

1Cor 10:21
Ye cannot drink of the cup of the Lord, and of the cup of the devils. Ye can not be partakers of the Lord's table, and of the table of devils.

1Cor 10:22
Other shall we provoke the Lord? other are we stronger then he?

1Cor 10:23
All things are lawful unto me, but all things are not expedient. All things are lawful, but all things edify not.

1Cor 10:24
Let no man seek his own profit: but let every man seek his neighbors wealth.

1Cor 10:25
Whatsoever is sold in the market, that eat, and ask no questions for conscience sake.

1Cor 10:26
For the earth is the Lord's, and all that therein is.

1Cor 10:27
If any of them which believe not bid you to a feast, and if ye be disposed to go, whatsoever is set before you eat, asking no question for conscience sake.

1Cor 10:28
but and if any man say unto you: this is dedicate unto idols, eat not of it for his sake that shewed it, and for hurting of conscience: the earth is the Lord's and all that therein is.

1Cor 10:29
Conscience I say, not thine: but the conscience of that other. Why should my liberty be judged of another man's conscience?

1Cor 10:30
For if I take my part with thanks: why am I evil spoken of for that thing wherefore I give thanks?

1Cor 10:31
Whether therefore ye eat or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the praise of God.

1Cor 10:32
See that ye give none occasion of evil, neither to the jewes, nor yet to the gentiles, neither to the congregation of god:

1Cor 10:33
even as I please all men in all things not seeking mine own profit, but the profit of many, that they might be saved.

1Cor 11:1
Follow me as I do Christ.

1Cor 11:2
I commend you brethren that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances which I gave to you.

1Cor 11:3
I would ye knew that Christ is the head of every man. and the woman's head is the man. and Christe's head is God.

1Cor 11:4
Every man praying or prophesying having any thing on his head, shameth his head.

1Cor 11:5
Every woman that prayeth or prophesieth bare headed, dishonesteth her head. For it is even all one, and the very same thing even as though she were shaven.

1Cor 11:6
If the woman be not covered, let her also be shaven. If it be shame for a woman to be shaven or shorn, let her cover her head.

1Cor 11:7
A man ought not to cover his head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of god. The woman is the glory of the man.

1Cor 11:8
For the man is not of the woman, but the woman of the man.

1Cor 11:9
Neither was the man created for the woman's sake: but the woman for the man's sake.

1Cor 11:10
For this cause ought the woman to have power in her head, for the angels' sake.

1Cor 11:11
Nevertheless, neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man in the Lord.

1Cor 11:12
For as the woman is of the man, even so is the man by the woman: but all is of god.

1Cor 11:13
Judge in yourselves whether it be comely that a woman pray unto god bareheaded.

1Cor 11:14
Or else doth not nature teach you, that it is a shame for a man, if he have long hair:

1Cor 11:15
and a praise to a woman if she have long hair? For her hair is given her to cover her withall.

1Cor 11:16
If there be any man among you that lusteth to strive, let him know that we have no such customes, neither the congregations of God.

1Cor 11:17
This I warn you of, and commend not that ye come together after a worse manner, and not after a better.

1Cor 11:18
First of all when ye come together in the congregation, I hear that there is dissension among you: And I partly believe it.

1Cor 11:19
For there must be sects among you, that they which among you are perfect might be known.

1Cor 11:20
When ye come together in one place, a man cannot eat the Lord's supper.

1Cor 11:21
For every man beginneth afore to eat his own supper. And one is hungry, and another is drunken.

1Cor 11:22
Have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? Or else despise ye the congregation of God? and shame them that have not? what shall I say unto you? shall I praise you? in this praise I you not.

1Cor 11:23
That which I gave unto you I received of the Lord. For the Lord Iesus the same night in the which he was betrayed, took bread:

1Cor 11:24
and thanked and brake, and said. Take ye, and eat ye this is my body which is broken for you. This do ye in the remembrance of me.

1Cor 11:25
After the same manner he took the cup when supper was done saying: This cup is the new testament in my blood, this do as oft as ye drink it, in the remembrance of me.

1Cor 11:26
For as often as ye shall eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye shall shew the Lord's death, till he come.

1Cor 11:27
Wherefore whosoever shall eat of this bread, or drink of the cup unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

1Cor 11:28
Let a man therefore examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup.

1Cor 11:29
For he that eateth or drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh his own damnation, because he maketh no difference of the Lordi's body.

1Cor 11:30
For this cause many are weak and sick among you, and many sleep.

1Cor 11:31
If we had truly judged ourselves, we should not have been judged.

1Cor 11:32
When we are judged of the Lord we are chastened, because we should not be damned with the world.

1Cor 11:33
Wherefore my brethren, when ye come togedder to eat, tarry one for another.

1Cor 11:34
If any man hunger, let him eat at home, that ye come not together unto condemnation. Other things will I set in order when I come.

1Cor 12:1
In spiritual things brethren I would not have you ignorant.

1Cor 12:2
Ye know that ye were gentiles, and went your ways unto dumb idols, even as ye were led.

1Cor 12:3
Wherefore I declare unto you that no man speaking in the spirit of god defieth Iesus. Also no man can say that Iesus is the Lord: but by the holy ghost.

1Cor 12:4
There are diversities of gifts verily, yet but one spirit.

1Cor 12:5
And there are differences of administrations, and yet but one Lord.

1Cor 12:6
And there are divers manners of operations, and yet but one God, which worketh all things that are wrought in all creatures.

1Cor 12:7
The gifts of the spirit are given to every man to profit the congregation.

1Cor 12:8
To one is given the utterance of wisdom: to another is given the utterance of knowledge by the same spirit:

1Cor 12:9
to another is given faith, by the same spirit. To another the gifts of healing, by the same spirit.

1Cor 12:10
To another power to do miracles: To another prophecy, To another judgement of spirits, To another diverse tongues: To another the interpretation of tongues:

1Cor 12:11
and these all worketh even the self same spirit, dividing to every man several gifts even as he will.

1Cor 12:12
For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of one body though they be many, yet are but one body: even so is Christ.

1Cor 12:13
For in one spirit are we all baptised to make one body, whether we be jewes or gentiles: whether we be bond or free, and have all drunk of one spirit.

1Cor 12:14
For the body is not one member, but many.

1Cor 12:15
If the foot say: I am not the hand, therefore I am not of the body: is he therefore not of the body?

1Cor 12:16
and if the ear say I am not the eye: therefore I am not of the body: is he therefore not of the body?

1Cor 12:17
if all the body were an eye: where were then the ear? if all were hearing: where were the smelling?

1Cor 12:18
But now hath god disposed the members, every one of them in the body, at his own pleasure.

1Cor 12:19
If they were all one member: where were the body?

1Cor 12:20
Now are there many members, yet but one body.

1Cor 12:21
And the eye cannot say unto the hand: I have no need of thee: nor the head also to the feet: I have no need of you.

1Cor 12:22
Yea rather a great deal those members of the body which seem to be most feeble, are most necessary.

1Cor 12:23
And upon those members of that body which we think least honest, put we most honesty on. And our ungodly parts have most beauty on.

1Cor 12:24
For our honest members need it not: but God hath so disposed the body, and hath given most honour to that part which lacked,

1Cor 12:25
lest there should be any strife in the body: but that the members should indifferently care for one another.

1Cor 12:26
And if one member suffer all suffer with him: if one member be had in honour, all members be glad also.

1Cor 12:27
Ye are the body of Christ, and members one of another.

1Cor 12:28
And God hath also ordained in the congregation, first the apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, then them that do miracles, after that, the gifts of healing, helpers, governors, diversity of tongues.

1Cor 12:29
Are all apostles? are all prophets? Are all teachers? are all doers of miracles?

1Cor 12:30
have all the gifts of healing? Do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?

1Cor 12:31
Covet after the best gifts. And yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.

1Cor 13:1
Though I spake with the tongues of men and angels, and yet had no love, I were even as sounding brass: and as a tinkling cymbal.

1Cor 13:2
And though I could prophesy, and understood all secrets, and all knowledge: yea, if I had all faith so that I could move mountains out of their places, and yet had no love, I were nothing.

1Cor 13:3
And though I bestowed all my goods to feed the poor, and though I gave my body even that I burned, and yet had no love, it profiteth me nothing.

1Cor 13:4
Love suffereth long, and is courteous. Love envieth not. Love doth not frowardly, swelleth not,

1Cor 13:5
dealeth not dishonestly, seeketh not her own, is not provoked to anger, thinketh not evil

1Cor 13:6
rejoiceth not in iniquity: but rejoiceth in the truth,

1Cor 13:7
suffereth all things, believeth all things hopeth all things, endureth in all things.

1Cor 13:8
Though that prophesying fail, or tongues shall cease, or knowledge vanish away: yet love falleth never away.

1Cor 13:9
For our knowledge is unperfect, and our prophesying is unperfect:

1Cor 13:10
but when that which is perfect is come: then that which is unperfect shall be done away.

1Cor 13:11
When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I imagined as a child: but as soon as I was a man I put away childishness.

1Cor 13:12
Now we see in a glass even in a dark speaking: but then shall we see face to face. Now I know unperfectly: but then shall I know even as I am known.

1Cor 13:13
Now abideth faith, hope, and love, even these three: but the chief of these is love.

1Cor 14:1
Labour for love, and covet spiritual gifts: and most chiefly for to prophesy.

1Cor 14:2
For he that speaketh with tongues speaketh not unto men, but unto god. No man heareth him: For in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.

1Cor 14:3
But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men, for their edifying, and comfort.

1Cor 14:4
He that speaketh with tongues, profiteth himself: he that prophesieth edifieth the congregation.

1Cor 14:5
I would that ye all spake with tongues: but rather that ye prophesied. For greater is he that prophesieth, than he that speaketh with tongues, except he expound it also, that the congregation may have edifying.

1Cor 14:6
Now brethren if I come unto you speaking with tongues: what shall I profit you? except I speak unto you, either by revelation, or knowledge, or prophesying, or doctrine.

1Cor 14:7
Moreover when things without life give sound: whether it be a pipe, or an harp: except they make a distinction in the sounds: how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

1Cor 14:8
And also if the trumpet give an uncertain voice, who shall prepare himself to fight?

1Cor 14:9
Even so likewise when ye speak with tongues, except ye speak words that have signification, how shall it be understood what is spoken? For ye shall but speak in the air.

1Cor 14:10
Many kinds of voices are in the world, and none of them are without signification.

1Cor 14:11
If I know not what the voice meaneth, I shall be unto him that speaketh an alien: and he that speaketh shall be an alien unto me.

1Cor 14:12
Even so ye (for as much as ye covet spiritual gifts) seek that ye may have plenty unto the edifying of the congregation.

1Cor 14:13
Wherefore let him that speaketh with tongues, pray that he may interpret also.

1Cor 14:14
If I pray with tongues, my spirit prayeth: but my mind is without fruit.

1Cor 14:15
