Let no filthy communication proceed out of your mouths: but that which is good to edify withall, when need is: that it may have favour with the hearers.

Eph 4:30
And grieve not the holy spirit of God, by whom ye are sealed unto the day of redemption.

Eph 4:31
Let all bitterness, fierceness and wrath, roaring and cursed speaking, be put away from you, with all maliciousness.

Eph 4:32
Be ye courteous one to another, be merciful forgiving one another, even as God for Christe's sake forgave you.

Eph 5:1
Be ye followers of God as dear children,

Eph 5:2
and walk in love even as Christ loved us, and gave himself for us, an offering and a sacrifice of a sweet savour to God.

Eph 5:3
So that fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, be not once, named among you, as it becometh saints:

Eph 5:4
neither filthiness, neither foolish talking, neither jestings, which are not comely: but rather giving of thanks.

Eph 5:5
For this ye know, that no whoremonger, either unclean person, or covetous person (which is the worshipper of images) hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ, and of God.

Eph 5:6
Let no man deceive you with vain words. For thorow such things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of unbelief.

Eph 5:7
Be not therefore companions with them.

Eph 5:8
Ye were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord. Walk as children of light.

Eph 5:9
For the fruit of the spirit is, in all goodness, righteousness, and truth.

Eph 5:10
Accept that which is pleasing to the Lord:

Eph 5:11
and have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness: but rather rebuke them.

Eph 5:12
For it is shame even to name those things which are done of them in secret:

Eph 5:13
but all things, when they are rebuked of the light, are manifest. For whatsoever is manifest, that same is light.

Eph 5:14
Wherefore he saith: awake thou that sleepest, and stand up from death, and Christ shall give thee light.

Eph 5:15
Take heed therefore that ye walk circumspectly: not as fools: but as wise,

Eph 5:16
redeeming the time: for the days are evil:

Eph 5:17
wherefore, be ye not unwise, but understand what the will of the Lord is,

Eph 5:18
and be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess: but be fulfilled with the spirit,

Eph 5:19
speaking unto yourselves in psalms, and hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and playing to the Lord in your hearts,

Eph 5:20
giving thanks allways for all things in the name of our Lord Iesu Christ to God the father:

Eph 5:21
submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

Eph 5:22
Women submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

Eph 5:23
For the husband is the wife's head, even as Christ is the head of the congregation, and the same is the saviour of the body.

Eph 5:24
Therefore as the congregation is in subjection to Christ, likewise let the wives be in subjection to their husbands in all things.

Eph 5:25
Husbands love your wives, even as Christ loved the congregation, and gave himself for it,

Eph 5:26
to sanctify it, and cleansed it in the fountain of water thorow the word,

Eph 5:27
to make it unto himself, a glorious congregation without spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing: but that it should be holy and without blame.

Eph 5:28
So ought men to love their wives, as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife, loveth himself.

Eph 5:29
For no man ever yet, hated his own flesh: But nourisheth, and cherisheth it: even as the Lord doth the congregation:

Eph 5:30
for we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

Eph 5:31
For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall continue with his wife, and two shall be made one flesh.

Eph 5:32
This is a great secret, but I speak between Christ and the congregation.

Eph 5:33
Nevertheless do ye so that every one of you love his wife truly even as himself: And let the wife see that she fear her husband.

Eph 6:1
Children obey your fathers and mothers in the Lord: for so is it right.

Eph 6:2
Honour father and mother, that is the first commandment that hath any promise,

Eph 6:3
that thou mayst be in good estate, and live long on the earth.

Eph 6:4
Fathers, move not your children to wrath: but bring them up with the nurture and information of the Lord.

Eph 6:5
Servants be obedient unto your carnal masters, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your hearts, as unto Christ:

Eph 6:6
not with service in the eye sight, as men pleasers: but as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart

Eph 6:7
with good will, even as though ye served the Lord, and not men.

Eph 6:8
And remember that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, that shall he receive again of the Lord, whether he be bond or free.

Eph 6:9
And ye masters, do even the same things unto them, putting away threatenings: and remember that even your master also is in heaven, neither is there any respect of person with him.

Eph 6:10
Finally, my brethren be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.

Eph 6:11
Put on the armour of God, that ye may stand steadfast against the crafty assaults of the devil.

Eph 6:12
For we wrestle not against flesh and blood: but against rule, against power, and against worldly rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in heavenly things.

Eph 6:13
For this cause take unto you the armour of God, that ye may be able to resist in the evil day, and to stand perfect in all things.

Eph 6:14
Stand therefore and your loins gird about with verity, having on the breastplate of righteousness,

Eph 6:15
and shod with shoes prepared by the gospell of peace.

Eph 6:16
Above all take to you the shield of faith, wherewith ye may quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.

Eph 6:17
And take the helmet of health, and the sword of the spirit, which is the word of God,

Eph 6:18
and pray always with all manner prayer and supplication: and that in the spirit: and watch thereunto with all instance and supplication for all saints,

Eph 6:19
and for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mought boldly, to utter the secrets of the gospell,

Eph 6:20
whereof I am a messenger in bonds, that therein I may speak freely, as it becometh me to speak.

Eph 6:21
But that ye may also know that condition I am in, and what I do, Tichicus my dear brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall shew you of all things,

Eph 6:22
whom I sent unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know what case I stand in, and that he might comfort your hearts.

Eph 6:23
Peace be with the brethren, and love with faith from God the father, and from the Lord Iesu Christ.

Eph 6:24
Grace be with all them which love our Lord Iesus Christ in pureness, Amen. <Sent from Rome unto the Ephesyans by Tichicus.>

Phil 1:1
Paul and Timotheus the servants of Iesu Christ. To all the saints in Christ Iesu which are at Philippos, with the bishops and deacons.

Phil 1:2
Grace be with you and peace from God our father, and from the Lord Iesus Christe.

Phil 1:3
I thank my God with all remembrance of you,

Phil 1:4
always in all my prayers for you all, and pray with gladness,

Phil 1:5
because of the fellowship which ye have in the gospell from the first day unto now,

Phil 1:6
and am surely certified of this, that he which began a good work in you shall perform it until the day of Iesus Christ,

Phil 1:7
as it becometh me so to judge of you all, because I have you in my heart, and have you also every one companions of grace with me, even in my bonds as I defend, and stablish the gospell.

Phil 1:8
God beareth me record how greatly I long after you all from the very heart root in Iesus Christ.

Phil 1:9
And this I pray, that your love may increase more and more in knowledge, and in all fealing,

Phil 1:10
that ye might accept things most excellent, that ye might be pure and such as should hurt no man's conscience, until the day of Christ,

Phil 1:11
filled with the fruits of righteousness, which fruits come by Iesus Christ unto the glory and laud of God.

Phil 1:12
I would ye understood brethren that my business is happened unto the greater furthering of the gospell.

Phil 1:13
So that my bonds in Christ are manifest thorow out all the judgement hall: and in all other places,

Phil 1:14
In so much that many of the brethren in the Lord are boldened thorow my bonds, and dare more largely speak the word without fear.

Phil 1:15
Some there are which preach Christ of envy and strife, and some of goodwill.

Phil 1:16
The one part preacheth Christ of strife, and not purely, supposing to add more adversity to my bonds.

Phil 1:17
The other part of love, because they see that I am set to defend the gospell.

Phil 1:18
What thing is this? Notwithsanding by all manner ways, whether it be by occasion or of truth, yet Christ is preached: and therefore I joy. Yea and will joy.

Phil 1:19
For I know that this shall be for my health, thorow your prayer, and ministering of the spirit of Iesu Christ,

Phil 1:20
as I heartily look for and hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed: but that with all confidence, as always in times past, even so now Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be thorow life, or else death.

Phil 1:21
For Christ is to me life, and death is to me advantage.

Phil 1:22
If it chance me to live in the flesh, that is to me fruitful for to work, and what to choose I wot not.

Phil 1:23
I am constrained of two things: I desire to be lowsed, and to be with Christ, which thing is best of all:

Phil 1:24
Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.

Phil 1:25
And this am I sure of, that I shall abide, and with you all continue, for the furtherance and joy of your faith,

Phil 1:26
that ye may more abundantly rejoice in Iesus Christ throwe me, by my coming to you again.

Phil 1:27
Only let your conversation be, as it becometh the gospell of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may yet hear of you, that ye continue in one spirit, and in one soul laboring as we do to maintain the faith of the gospell,

Phil 1:28
and in nothing fearing your adversaries: which is to them a token of perdition, and to you a sign of health, and that of God.

Phil 1:29
For unto you it is given, that not only ye should believe on Christ: but also suffer for his sake,

Phil 1:30
and have even the same fight which ye saw me have and now hear of me.

Phil 2:1
If there be among you any consolation in Christ, if there be any comfortable love, if there be any fellowship of the spirit, if there be any compassion of mercy:

Phil 2:2
fulfil my joy, that ye draw one way, having one love, being of one accord, and of one mind,

Phil 2:3
that nothing be done thorow strife or vain glory, but in meekness of mind. Let every person think every other man better than himself,

Phil 2:4
so that ye consider every man, not what is in himself: But what is in wother men.

Phil 2:5
Let the same mind be in you the which was in Christ Iesu:

Phil 2:6
Which being in the shape of God, and thought it not robbery to be equal with God.

Phil 2:7
Nevertheless he made himself of no reputation, and took on him the shape of a servant, and became like unto men, and was found in his apparel as a man.

Phil 2:8
He humbled himself and became obedient unto the death, even the death of the cross.

Phil 2:9
Wherefore God hath exalted him, and given him a name above all names:

Phil 2:10
that in the name of Iesus should every knee bow, both of things in heaven, and things in earth and things under earth,

Phil 2:11
and that all tongues should confess that Iesus Christ is the Lord unto the praise of God the father.

Phil 2:12
Wherefore my dearly beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not when I was present only, but now much more in mine absence, even so perform your own health with fear and trembling.

Phil 2:13
For it is God which worketh in you, both the will and also the deed, even of good will.

Phil 2:14
Do all thinge without murmuring and disputing,

Phil 2:15
that ye may be faultless, and pure, and the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked, and a perverse nation, among which see that ye shine as lights in the world,

Phil 2:16
holding fast the word of life, unto my rejoicing in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither have laboured in vain.

Phil 2:17
Yea and though I be offered up on your sacrifice and of your serving of God in the faith: I rejoice and rejoice with you all.

Phil 2:18
For the same cause also, rejoice ye, and rejoice ye with me.

Phil 2:19
I trust in the Lord Iesus for to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know what case ye stand in.

Phil 2:20
For I have no man that is so like minded to me, which with so pure affection careth for your matters.

Phil 2:21
For all others seek their own, and not that which is Iesus Christe's.

Phil 2:22
Ye know the proof of him, how that as a son with the father, so with me bestowed he his labour upon the gospell.

Phil 2:23
Him I hope to send as soon as I know how it will go with me.

Phil 2:24
I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

Phil 2:25
I supposed it necessary to send brother Epaphreditus unto you, my companion in labour and fellowsoldier, your apostle, and my minister at my needs.

Phil 2:26
For he longed after you, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard say that he should be sick,

Phil 2:27
and no doubt he was sick, and that nye unto death, but God had mercy on him: not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have had sorrow upon sorrow.

Phil 2:28
I sent him therefore the diligentlier, that when ye should see him, ye might rejoice again, and I might be the less sorrowful.

Phil 2:29
Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness, and make much of such:

Phil 2:30
because that for the work of Christ he went so far, that he was nye unto death, and regarded not his life, to fulfil that service which was lacking on your part toward me.

Phil 3:1
Moreover brethren mine, rejoice in the Lord. It grieveth me not to write the very same things unto you. For to you it is a sure thing.

Phil 3:2
Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers. Beware of dissension:

Phil 3:3
For we are circumcision which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Iesu, and have no confidence in the flesh:

Phil 3:4
though I have whereof I might rejoice in the flesh. If any other man thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh: much more I:

Phil 3:5
circumcised the eighth day, of the kindred of Israhell, of the tribe of Benjamin an Hebrew born of the Hebrews: as concerning the law, a pharise,

Phil 3:6
and as concerning ferventness I persecuted the congregation, and as touching the righteousness which is in the law I was such a one as no man could complain on.

Phil 3:7
But the things that were winning unto me I counted loss for Christe's sake.

Phil 3:8
Yea I think all things but loss for that excellent knowledge's sake of Christ Iesu my Lord. For whom I have counted all thing loss, and do judge them but dung, that I might win Christ,

Phil 3:9
and might be found in him, not having mine own righteousness which is of the law: But that which springeth of the faith which is in Christ. I mean the righteousness which cometh of God throwe faith

Phil 3:10
in knowing him, and the virtue of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his passions, that I might be conformable unto his death,

Phil 3:11
if by any means I might attain unto the resurrection from death.

Phil 3:12
Not as though I had all ready received it, either were all ready perfect: but I follow, if that I may comprehend that, wherein I am comprehended of Christ Iesu.

Phil 3:13
Brethren I count not myself that I have gotten it: but one thing I say: I forget that which is behind me, and stretch myself unto that which is before me

Phil 3:14
and press unto that mark appointed, to obtain the reward of the high calling of God in Christ Iesu.

Phil 3:15
Let us therefore as many as be perfect be thus wise minded: and if ye be other wise minded, I pray God open even this unto you.

Phil 3:16
Nevertheless in that whereunto we are come, let us proceed by one rule, that we may be of one accord.

Phil 3:17
Brethren be followers of me, and look on them which walk even so, as ye have us for an ensample.

Phil 3:18
For many walk (of whom I have told you often, and now tell you weeping) that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ,

Phil 3:19
whose end is damnation, whose God is their belly and glory to their shame, which are worldly minded.

Phil 3:20
But our conversation is in heaven, from whence we look for the saviour Iesus Christ,

Phil 3:21
which shall change into another fashion our vile bodies, that they may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able to subdue all things unto himself.

Phil 4:1
Herefore brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so continue beloved in the Lord.

Phil 4:2
I pray Euodias, and beseech Sintiches that they be of one accord in the Lord.

Phil 4:3
Yea and I beseech thee faithful yokefellow, help the women which laboured with me in the gospell, and with Clement also, and with other my labourfellows, whose names are in the book of life.

Phil 4:4
Rejoice in the Lord alway, and again I say rejoice.

Phil 4:5
Let your softness be known unto all men. The Lord is even at hand.

Phil 4:6
Be not carefull: but in all things shew your petition unto God in prayer and supplication with giving of thanks.

Phil 4:7
And the peace of God which passeth all understanding keep your hearts, and minds in Christ Iesu.

Phil 4:8
Furthermore brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things pertain to love, whatsoever things are of honest report, if there be any virtuous thing, if there be any laudable thing, those same have ye in your mind,

Phil 4:9
which ye have both learned and received, heard and also seen in me: those things do, and the God of peace shall be with you.

Phil 4:10
I rejoice in the Lord greatly, that now at the last ye are revived, and are waxed mindfull of me again in that wherein ye were also mindfull, but ye lacked opportunity.

Phil 4:11
I speak not because of necessity. For I have learned in whatsoever estate I am, therewith to be content.

Phil 4:12
I can both cast down myself, I can also exceed. Everywhere, and in all things I am instructed, both to be full, and to be hungry: to have plenty, and to suffer need.

Phil 4:13
I can do all things thorow the help of Christ, which strengtheneth me.

Phil 4:14
Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye bare part with me in my tribulation.

Phil 4:15
Ye of Philippos know that in the beginning of the gospell, when I departed from Macedonia, no congregation bare part with me as concerning giving and receiving but ye only.

Phil 4:16
For when I was in Thessalonica, ye sent once, and afterward again, unto my needs:

Phil 4:17
not that I desire gifts: but I desire abundant fruit on your part.

Phil 4:18
I received all, and have plenty. I was even filled after that I had received of Epaphroditus, that which came from you, an odor that smelleth sweet, a sacrifice accepted and pleasant to God.

Phil 4:19
My God fulfil all your needs thorow his glorious riches in Iesu Christ.

Phil 4:20
Unto God and our father be praise for ever more Amen.

Phil 4:21
Salute all the saints in Christ Iesu. The brethren which are with me greet you.

Phil 4:22
All the saints salute you: and most of all they which are of the emperors household.

Phil 4:23
The grace of our Lord Iesu Christ be with you all Amen. <Sent from Rome by Epaphroditus.>

Col 1:1
Paul an apostle of Iesu Christ by the will of God, and brother Timotheus.

Col 1:2
To the saints which are at Colossa, and brethren that believe in Christ. Grace be with you and peace from God our father, and from the Lord Iesu Christ.

Col 1:3
We give thanks to God the father of our Lord Iesus Christ alway praying for you in our prayers,

Col 1:4
since we heard of your faith which ye have in Christ Iesu: and of the love which ye bear to all saints

Col 1:5
for the hope's sake which is laid up in store for you in heaven, of which hope ye have heard by the true word of the gospell,

Col 1:6
which is come unto you, even as it is into all the world, and is fruitful as it is among you, from the first day in the which ye heard of it, and had experience in the grace of God in the truth,

Col 1:7
as ye learned of Epaphra our dear fellow servant, which is for you a faithful minister in Christ,

Col 1:8
which also declared unto us your love, which ye have in the spirit.

Col 1:9
For this cause we also, since the day we heard of it have not ceased praying for you, and desiring that ye might be fulfilled with the knowledge of his will, in all wisdom and spiritual understanding,

Col 1:10
that ye might walk worthy of the Lord in all things that please, being fruitful in all good works and increasing in the knowledge of God

Col 1:11
strengthed with all might, throwe his glorious power, unto all patience, and long suffering, with joyfulness,

Col 1:12
giving thanks unto the father which hath made us meet to be part takers of the inheritance of saints in light.

Col 1:13
Which hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translated us into the kingdom of his dear son,

Col 1:14
in whom we have redemption thorow his blood, that is to say, forgiveness of sins,

Col 1:15
which is the image of the invisible God, first begotten before all creatures:

Col 1:16
for by him were all things created, things that are in heaven, and things that are in earth: things visible, and things invisible: whether they be majesty or lordship, either rule or power.

Col 1:17
All things are created by him, and in him, and he is before all things, and in him all things have their being.

Col 1:18
And he is the head of the body, that is to wit of the congregation, he is the beginning and first begotten of the dead, that in all things he might have the preeminence.

Col 1:19
For it pleased the father that in him should all fullness dwell,

Col 1:20
and by him to reconcile all thinge unto himself, and to set at peace by him throw the blood of his cross both things in heaven and things in earth.

Col 1:21
And you (which were in times past strangers and enemies, because your minds were set in evil works) hath he now reconciled

Col 1:22
in the body of his flesh thorow death, to make you holy, and such as no man could complain on, and without fault in his own sight,

Col 1:23
if ye continue grounded and stablished in the faith, and be not moved away from the hope of the gospell, whereof ye have heard, how that it is preached among all creatures, which are under heaven, whereof I Paul am made a minister.

Col 1:24
Now joy I in my passions which I suffer for you, and fulfil that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body's sake, which is the congregation,

Col 1:25
whereof am I made a minister according to the ordinance of God, which ordinance was given me unto you ward, to fulfil the word of God,

Col 1:26
that mystery hid since the world began, and since the beginning of generations: But now is opened to his saints,

Col 1:27
to whom God would make known the glorious riches of this mystery among the gentiles, which riches is Christ in you, the hope of glory,

Col 1:28
whom we preach warning all men, and teaching all men in all wisdom, to make all men perfect in Christ Iesu:

Col 1:29
Wherein I also labour and strive, even as far forth as his working worketh in me mightily.

Col 2:1
I would ye knew what fighting I have for your sakes and for them of Laodicia, and for as many as have not seen my person in the flesh,

Col 2:2
that their hearts might be comforted and knit together in love, and in all riches of full understanding, for to know the mystery of God the father and of Christ

Col 2:3
in whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

Col 2:4
This I say lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.

Col 2:5
For though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I present with you in the spirit joying and beholding the order that ye keep, and your steadfast faith in Christ.

Col 2:6
As ye have therefore received Christ Iesu the Lord, even so walk rooted and built in him,

Col 2:7
and steadfast in the faith, as ye have learned: and therin be plenteous in giving thanks.

Col 2:8
Beware lest any man come and spoil you thorow philosophy and deceitful vanity, thorow the traditions of men, and ordinances after the world, and not after Christ.

Col 2:9
For in him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily,

Col 2:10
and ye are full in him, which is the head of all rule and power,

Col 2:11
in whom also ye are circumcised with circumcision made without hands, by putting off the sinful body off the flesh, thorow the circumcision that is in Christ,

Col 2:12
in that ye are buried with him thorow baptism, in whom ye are also risen again thorow faith, that is wrought by the operation of God which raised him from death.

Col 2:13
And hath with him quickened you also which were dead in sin in the uncircumcision of your flesh, and hath forgiven our trespasses,

Col 2:14
and hath put out the obligation that was against us, made in the law written, and that hath he taken out of the way, and hath fastened it on his cross,

Col 2:15
and hath spoiled rule and power, and hath made a shew of them openly, and hath triumphed over them in his own person.

Col 2:16
Let no man therefore trouble your consciences about meat and drink: or for a piece of an holyday, as the holyday of the new moon or of the saboth daye,

Col 2:17
which are nothing but shadows of things to come: but the body is in Christ.

Col 2:18
Let no man make you shoot at a wrong mark, which after his own imagination walketh in the humbleness and holiness of angels, things which he never saw: causeless puffed up with his fleshly mind,

Col 2:19
and holdeth not the head, whereof all the body by joints and couples receiveth nourishment, and is knit together, and increaseth with the increasing that cometh of God.

Col 2:20
Wherefore if ye be dead with Christ from doctrine of the world: Why as though ye yet lived in the world, are ye led with traditions of them that say?

Col 2:21
Touch not, Taste not, Handle not:

Col 2:22
which all perish with the using of them, and are after the commandments, and doctrines of men:

Col 2:23
which things have the similitude of wisdom in chosen holiness, and humbleness, and in that they spare not the body, and do the flesh no worship unto his need.

Col 3:1
If ye be then risen again with Christ seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.

Col 3:2
Set your affection on things that are above, and not on things which are on the earth.

Col 3:3
For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.

Col 3:4
When Christ which is our life shall shew himself, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.

Col 3:5
Mortify therefore your members which are on the earth, fornication, uncleanness, unnatural lust, evil concupiscence, and covetousness which is worshipping of idols:

Col 3:6
for which thing's sakes the wrath of God falleth on the children of unbelief.

Col 3:7
In which things ye walked once, when ye lived in them.

Col 3:8
But now put ye also away from you all things, wrath, fierceness, maliciousness, cursed speaking, filthy speaking out of your mouths.

Col 3:9
Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his works,

Col 3:10
and have put on the new, which is renewed in knowledge, after the image of him that made him,

Col 3:11
where is neither greek nor iewe, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarous or Sithian, bond or free: But Christe is all in all things.

Col 3:12
Now therefore as elect of God, holy and beloved, put on tender mercy, kindness, humbleness of minde, meekness, long suffering,

Col 3:13
forbearing one another, and forgiving one another (if any man have a quarrel to another) even as Christ forgave you, even so do ye.

Col 3:14
Above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfectness,

Col 3:15
and the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which peace ye are called in one body: and see that ye be thankful.

Col 3:16
Let the word of God dwell in you plenteously in all wisdom. Teach and exhort your own selves, in psalms, and hymns, and spiritual songs which have favour with them, singing in your hearts to the Lord.

Col 3:17
And all things (whatsoever ye do in word or deed) do in the name of the Lord Iesu, giving thanks to God the father by him.

Col 3:18
Wives submit your own selves unto your own husbands, as it is comely in the Lord.

Col 3:19
Husbands love your wives and be not bitter unto them.

Col 3:20
Children obey your fathers and mothers, in all things, for that is well pleasing unto the Lord.

Col 3:21
Fathers rate not your children, lest they be of a desperate mind.

Col 3:22
Servants be obedient unto your bodily masters in all things: not with eye service as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart fearing God.

Col 3:23
And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily as though ye did it to the Lord, and not unto men,

Col 3:24
remembering that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of inheritance, for ye serve the Lord Christ.

Col 3:25
But he that doth wrong shall receive for the wrong that he hath done: for there is no respect of persons.

Col 4:1
Ye masters do unto your servants that which is just and egal, remembering that ye have also a master in heaven.

Col 4:2
Continue in prayer and watch in the same with thanksgiving,

Col 4:3
praying also for us that God open unto us the door of utterance, that we may speak the mystery of Christ (wherefore I am also in bonds)

Col 4:4
that I may utter it, as it becometh me to speak.

Col 4:5
Walk wisely to them that are without, and redeem the time.

Col 4:6
Let your speech alwaye have faveoure with it and be salted, that ye may know how to answer every man.

Col 4:7
The dear brother Tichicos shall tell you of all my business, which is a faithful minister, and fellow servant in the Lord,

Col 4:8
whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know how ye do, and might comfort your hearts,

Col 4:9
with one Onesimus a faithful, and a beloved brother, which is one of you. They shall shew you of all things which are a doing here.

Col 4:10
Aristarchus my prison fellow saluteth you, And Marcus Barnabassis' sister's son: touching whom, ye received commandments. If he come unto you receive him:

Col 4:11
and Iesus which is called Iustus, which are of the circumcision. These only are my workfellows unto the kingdom of God, which were unto my consolation.

Col 4:12
Epaphras the servant of Christ, which is one of you, saluteth you, and always laboureth fervently for you in prayers that ye may stand perfect, and full in all that is the will of God.

Col 4:13
I bear him record that he hath a fervent mind toward you, and toward them of Laodicia and them of Hierapolis.

Col 4:14
Dear Lucas the physician greeteth you, and Demas.

Col 4:15
Salute the brethren which are of Laodicia, and salute Nymphas, and the congregation which is in his house.

Col 4:16
And when the pistel is read of you, make that it be read in the congregation of the Laodicians also: and that ye likewise read the pistel of Laodicia.

Col 4:17
And say to Archippus: Take heed to thine office that thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

Col 4:18
The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds Grace be with you, Amen. <Sent from Rome by Tichicus, and Onesimus.>

1Th 1:1
Paul Silvanus and Timotheus. Unto the congregation of the Thessalonians, in God the father, and in the Lord Iesus Christ. Grace be with you, and peace from God our father, and from the Lord Iesus Christ.

1Th 1:2
We give God thanks alwaye for you all, making mention of you in our prayers

1Th 1:3
without ceasing, and call to remembrance your work in the faith, and labour in love and perseverance in the hope of our Lord Iesus Christ, in the sight of God our father:

1Th 1:4
because we know brethren beloved of God, how that ye are elect.

1Th 1:5
For our gospell came not unto you in word only, but also in power, and also in the holy ghost and in much certainty, as ye know that we behaved ourselves among you, for your sakes.

1Th 1:6
And ye counterfeited us, and of the Lord: and received the word in much affliction, with joy of the holy ghost:

1Th 1:7
so that ye were an example to all that believe in Macedonia, and Achaia.

1Th 1:8
For from you sounded out the word of the Lord, not in Macedonia and in Achaia only: but your faith also which ye have unto God, spread herself abroad in all quarters, so greatly that it needeth not us to speak anything at all:

1Th 1:9
for they themselves shew of you what manner of entering in we had unto you, and how ye turned to God from images for to serve the living and true God,

1Th 1:10
and for to look for his son from heaven, whom he raised from death: I mean Iesus which delivereth us from wrath to come.

1Th 2:1
For ye yourselves brethren know of our entrance in unto you, how that it was not in vain:

1Th 2:2
but even after that we had suffered before and were shamefully entreated at Philippos (as ye well know) then were we bold in our God to speak unto you the gospell of God, with much striving.

1Th 2:3
Our exhortation was not to bring you to error, nor yet to uncleanness, neither was it with guile:

1Th 2:4
but as we were allowed of God, that the gospell should be committed unto us: even so we speak, not as though we intended to please men, but God, which trieth our hearts.

1Th 2:5
Neither was our conversation at any time with flattering words (as ye well know) neither in cloaked covetousness, God is record:

1Th 2:6
neither sought we praise of men, neither of you, nor yet of any other, when we might have been chargable, as the apostles of Christ:

1Th 2:7
but were tender among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children,

1Th 2:8
so was our affection toward you our good will was to have dealt unto you, not the gospell of God only: but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.

1Th 2:9
Ye remember brethren our labour and travail. For we laboured day and night, because we would not be grievous unto any of you, and preached you the gospell of God.

1Th 2:10
Ye are witnesses, and so is God, how holily and justly (that no man could blame us) we behaved ourselves among you that believe,

1Th 2:11
as ye know how that we exhorted and comforted, and besought every one of you, as a father his children,

1Th 2:12
that ye would walk worthy of the Lord, which hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

1Th 2:13
For this cause thank we God without ceasing, because that when ye received of us the word, wherewith God was preached, ye received it not as the word of man: but even as it was in deed, the word of God, which worketh in you that believe.

1Th 2:14
For ye brethren did counterfeit the congregations of God which in jewry are in Christ Iesu: for ye have suffered like things of your kinsmen, as we our selves have suffered of the Jewes,

1Th 2:15
which as they killed the Lord Iesus and their own prophets, even so have they persecuted us, and God they please not, and are contrary to all men:

1Th 2:16
and forbid us to preach unto the gentiles, that they might be saved, to fulfil their sins: For the wrath of God is come on them, even to the utmost.

1Th 2:17
For as much brethren as we are kept from you for a season, as concerning the bodily presence but not in the heart, we enforced the more to see you personally with great desire,

1Th 2:18
and therefore we would have come unto you, I Paul once and again: but Satan withstood us.

1Th 2:19
For what is our hope or joy, or crown of rejoicing? are not ye it in the presence of our Lord Iesus Christ at his coming?

1Th 2:20
yes ye are our glory and joy.

1Th 3:1
Wherefore since we could no longer forbear, it pleased us to remain at Athens alone,

1Th 3:2
and sent Timotheus our brother and minister of God, and our labourfellow in the gospell of Christ, to stablish you, and to comfort you over your faith,

1Th 3:3
that no man should be moved in these afflictions. For ye yourselves know that we are even appointed thereunto.

1Th 3:4
For verily when I was with you, I told you before that we should suffer tribulation even as it came to pass, and as ye know.

1Th 3:5
For this cause, when I could no longer forbear, I sent that I might have knowledge of your faith, lest haply the tempter had tempted you, and that our labour had been bestowed in vain.

1Th 3:6
Now lately when Timotheus came from you unto us and declared to us your faith, and your love, and how that ye have good remembrance of us always, desiring to see us, as we desire to see you.

1Th 3:7
Therefore brethren had I consolation in you, in all our adversity, and necessity through your faith.

1Th 3:8
For now are we alive if ye stand steadfast in the Lord.

1Th 3:9
For what thanks can we recompense to God again for you, over all the joy that we joy for your sakes before our God,

1Th 3:10
while we night and day pray exceedingly, that we might see you presently, and might fulfil that which is lacking in your faith.

1Th 3:11
God himself our father, and our Lord Iesus Christ guide our journey unto you:

1Th 3:12
and the Lord increase you, and make you flow over in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we do toward you,

1Th 3:13
to stablish your hearts that they might be without ought to be complained on, in holiness before God our father, at the coming of our Lord Iesus Christ, with all his saints.

1Th 4:1
Furthermore we beseech you brethren, and exhort you in the Lord Iesus, that ye increase more and more, even as ye have received of us, how ye ought to walk and to please God.

1Th 4:2
Ye remember what commandments we gave you in the name of our Lord Iesu.

1Th 4:3
For this is the will of God, which is your sanctifying, that ye should abstain from fornication,

1Th 4:4
that every one of you should know how to keep his vessel in sanctifying and honour,

1Th 4:5
and not in the lust of concupiscence, as do the heathen, which know not God,

1Th 4:6
that no man go beyond, and defraud his brother in bargaining, because the Lord is avenger of all such things: as we told you before time, and testified unto you.

1Th 4:7
For God hath not called us unto uncleanness: but unto sanctifying.

1Th 4:8
He therefore that despiseth, despiseth not man, but God, which hath sent his holy spirit among you.

1Th 4:9
But as touching brotherly love, ye need not that I write unto you. For ye are taught of God to love one another.

1Th 4:10
Ye and that thing verily ye do unto all the brethren, which are thorowout all Macedonia. We beseech you brethren that ye increase, more and more,

1Th 4:11
and that ye study to be quiet, and to meddle with your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you:

1Th 4:12
that ye may behave yourselves honestly toward them that are without and that nothing be lacking unto you.

1Th 4:13
I would not brethren have you ignorant concerning them which are fallen asleep, that ye sorrow not as other do which have no hope.

1Th 4:14
For if we believe that Iesus died, and rose again: even so them also which sleep by Iesus, will God bring again with him.

1Th 4:15
And this say we unto you in the word of the Lord, that we which live and are remaining in the coming of the Lord, shall not come yer they, which sleep.

1Th 4:16
For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, and the voice of the archangel, and trumpe of God. And the dead in Christe shall arise first:

1Th 4:17
then shall we which live and remain, be caught up with them also in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And so shall we ever be with the Lord.

1Th 4:18
Wherefore comfort your selves one another with these words.

1Th 5:1
Of the times and seasons brethren ye have no need that I write unto you:

1Th 5:2
for ye your selves know perfectly, that the day of the Lord shall come even as a thief in the night.

1Th 5:3
When they shall say peace and no danger, then cometh on them sudden destruction, as the travailing of a woman with child, and they shall not escape.

1Th 5:4
But ye brethren are not in darkness, that that day should come on you as it were a thief.

1Th 5:5
Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, neither of darkness.

1Th 5:6
Therefore let us not sleep as do other: but let us watch and be sober.

1Th 5:7
For they that sleep, sleep in the night: and they that be drunken, are drunken in the night.

1Th 5:8
But let us which are of the day be sober, armed with the breast plate of faith and love, and with hope of health, as an helmet.

1Th 5:9
For God hath not appointed us unto wrath: but to obtain health by the means of our Lord Iesu Christ,

1Th 5:10
which died for us: that whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

1Th 5:11
Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as ye do.

1Th 5:12
We beseech you brethren, that ye know them which labour among you, and have the oversight of you in the Lord,

1Th 5:13
and give you exhortation, that ye have them the more in love, For their work's sake, and be at peace with them.

1Th 5:14
We desire you brethren warn them that are unruly, comfort the feeble minded, forbear the weak have continual patience toward all men.

1Th 5:15
See that none recompense evil for evil unto any man: but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.

1Th 5:16
Rejoice ever.

1Th 5:17
Pray continually.

1Th 5:18
In all things give thanks. For this is the will of God in Christ Iesu toward you.

1Th 5:19
Quench not the spirit,

1Th 5:20
despise not prophesying.

1Th 5:21
Examine all things. Reap that which is good.

1Th 5:22
Abstain from all suspicious thing.

1Th 5:23
The very God of peace sanctify you thorowout. And I pray God that your whole spirit, soul, and body, be kept faultless unto the coming of our Lord Iesus Christ.

1Th 5:24
Faithful is he, which called you: which will also do it.

1Th 5:25
Brethren, pray for us.

1Th 5:26
Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.

1Th 5:27
I charge you in the Lord, that this pistel be read unto all the wholly brethren.

1Th 5:28
The grace of the Lord Iesus Christe be with you. Amen. <The first pistle unto the Tessalonyans written from Athens.>

2Th 1:1
Paul, Sylvanus and Timotheus. Unto the congregation of the Thessalonians, which are in God our father, and in the Lord Iesus Christ.

2Th 1:2
Grace be with you and peace from God our father, and from the Lord Iesus Christ.

2Th 1:3
We are bound to thank God always for you brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and every one of you swimmeth in love toward another between yourselves,

2Th 1:4
so that we ourselves rejoice of you in the congregations of God, over your patience and faith in all your persecutions, and tribulations that ye suffer:

2Th 1:5
which is a token of the righteous judgment of God, that ye are counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which ye also suffer.

2Th 1:6
It is verily a righteous thing with God, to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you:

2Th 1:7
and to you which are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Iesus shall shew himself from heaven, with his mighty angels,

2Th 1:8
in flaming fire, rendering vengeance unto them that know not God, and to them that obey not unto the gospell of our Lord Iesus Christ,

2Th 1:9
which shall be punished with everlasting damnation, from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power,

2Th 1:10
when he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be made marvelous in all them that believe: because our testimony that we had unto you, was believed even the same day that we preached it.

2Th 1:11
Wherefore we pray always for you that our God make you worthy of the calling, and fulfil all delectation of goodness, and the work of faith, with power:

2Th 1:12
that the name of our Lord Iesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, thorow the grace of our God, and of the Lord Iesus Christ.

2Th 2:1
We beseech you brethren by the coming of our Lord Iesu Christ, and in that we shall assemble unto him,

2Th 2:2
that ye be not suddenly moved from your mind, and be not troubled, neither by spirit, neither by words, nor yet by letter, which should seem to come from us, as though the day of Christ were at hand.

2Th 2:3
Let no man deceive you by any means, for the Lord cometh not, except there come a departing first, and that that sinful man be opened, the son of perdition

2Th 2:4
which is an adversary, and is exalted above all that is called God, or that is worshipped: so that he shall sit in the temple of god, and shew himself as god.

2Th 2:5
Remember ye not, that when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

2Th 2:6
And now ye know what withholdeth: even that he might be uttered at his time.

2Th 2:7
For already the mystery of iniquity worketh. Only he that holdeth, let him now hold, until hit be taken out of the way,

2Th 2:8
and then shall that wicked be uttered, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the appearance of his coming,

2Th 2:9
even him whose coming is by the working of Satan, with all lying power, signs, and wonders:

2Th 2:10
and in all deceivableness of unrighteousness, among them that perish: because they received not the love of the trueth, that they might have been saved.

2Th 2:11
And therefore God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe lies:

2Th 2:12
that all they might be damned which believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.

2Th 2:13
We are bound to give thanks alwaye to God for you brethren beloved of the Lord, for because that God hath from the beginning chosen you to health, thorow sanctifying of the spirit, And thorow believing the trueth:

2Th 2:14
whereunto he called you by our gospell, to obtain the glory that cometh of our Lord Iesu Christ.

2Th 2:15
Therefore brethren stand fast and keep the ordinations, which ye have learned: whether it were by our preaching, or by our pistel:

2Th 2:16
Our Lord Iesu Christ himself, and God our father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation, and good hope thorow grace,

2Th 2:17
comfort your hearts, and establish you in all saying, and good doing.

2Th 3:1
Furthermore brethren pray for us, that the word of God may have free passage, and be glorified, as it is with you:

2Th 3:2
and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and evil men. For all men have not faith:

2Th 3:3
but the Lord is faithful, which shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.

2Th 3:4
We have confidence throw the Lord to youward, that ye both do, and will do, that which we command you.

2Th 3:5
And the Lord guide your hearts unto the love of God, and patience of Christ.

2Th 3:6
We require you brethren in the name of our Lord Iesu Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh inordinately, and not after the institution which ye received of us.

2Th 3:7
Ye yourselves know how ye ought to counterfeit us: For we behaved not ourselves inordinately among you.

2Th 3:8
Neither took we bread of any man for nought: but wrought with labour and travail night and day, because we would not be grievous to any of you:

2Th 3:9
not but that we had authority: but to make ourselves an ensample unto you, to counterfeit us.

2Th 3:10
For when we were with you, this we warned you of, that if there were any which would not work, that the same should not eat.

2Th 3:11
We have heard say no doubt that there are some which walk among you inordinately, and work not at all, but are busybodies.

2Th 3:12
Them that are such, we command and exhort in the name of our Lord Iesu Christ, that they work with quietness, and eat their bread.

2Th 3:13
Brethren be not weary in well doing.

2Th 3:14
If any man obey not our sayings, send us word of him by a letter: and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed:

2Th 3:15
And count him not as an enemy: but warn him as a brother.

2Th 3:16
The very Lord of peace, give you peace always, by all means. The Lord be with you all.

2Th 3:17
The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand. This is the token in all pistels. So I write.

2Th 3:18
The grace of our Lord Iesus be with you all Amen. <Sent from Athens.>

1Tim 1:1
Paul an apostle of Iesus Christ, by the commandment of God our saviour, and of the Lord Iesu Christ, which is our hope.

1Tim 1:2
Unto Timothy his natural son in the faith. Grace mercy and peace from God our father, and from the Lord Iesu Christ.

1Tim 1:3
As I besought thee to abide still in Ephesus when I departed into Macedonia, even so do that thou command some that they teach no other wise:

1Tim 1:4
neither give heed to fables and genealogies, which are endless, and breed doubts, more than Godly edifying which is by faith:

1Tim 1:5
for the end of the commandment is love that cometh of a pure heart and of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned:

1Tim 1:6
from the which things, some have erred, and have turned unto vain jangling,

1Tim 1:7
because they would be doctors in the scripture, and yet understand not what they speak, neither whereof they affirm.

1Tim 1:8
We know that the law is god, if a man use it lawfully,

1Tim 1:9
understanding this, how that the law is not given unto a righteous man, but unto the unrighteous and disobedient, to the ungodly and to sinners, to unholy and unclean, to murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, to manslayers

1Tim 1:10
and whoremongers: to them that defile themselves with mankind: to menstealers: to liars and to perjured, and so forth if there be any other thing that is contrary to wholesome doctrine

1Tim 1:11
according to the glorious gospell of the holy God, which gospel is committed unto me.

1Tim 1:12
And I thank him that hath made me strong in Christ Iesu our Lord: for he counted me true, and put me in office,

1Tim 1:13
when before I was a blasphemer, and a persecuter, and a tyrant. Nevertheless I obtained mercy because I did it ignorantly, in unbelief:

1Tim 1:14
but the grace of our Lord was more abundant, with faith and love, which is in Christ Iesu.

1Tim 1:15
This is a true saying, and by all means worthy to be received, that Christ Iesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am chief:

1Tim 1:16
Notwithstanding unto me was mercy given, that Iesus Christ should first shew on me all long patience, unto the ensample of them which shall in time to come believe on him unto eternal life.

1Tim 1:17
So then unto God, king everlasting, immortal, invisible, and wise only, be honour and praise for ever and ever Amen.

1Tim 1:18
This commandment commit I unto thee son Timotheus, according to the prophecies which in time past were prophesied of thee, that thou in them shouldest fight a good fight,

1Tim 1:19
having faith and good conscience, which some have put away from them, and as concerning faith have made shipwreck.

1Tim 1:20
Of whose number is Himeneus, and Alexander, which I have delivered unto Satan, that they might be taught not to blaspheme.

1Tim 2:1
I exhort therefore that above all things prayers, supplications, petitions, and giving of thanks, be had for all men:

1Tim 2:2
for kings, and for all that are in preeminence, that we may live a quiet and a peaceable life, in all godliness and honesty.

1Tim 2:3
For that is good and accepted in the sight of god our saviour,

1Tim 2:4
which would have all men saved, and come unto the knowledge of the truth.

1Tim 2:5
For there is one God, and one mediator between God and man, which is the man Christ Iesus,

1Tim 2:6
which gave himself a ransom for all men, that it should be preached at his time,

1Tim 2:7
whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle (I tell the truth in Christ and lie not) being the teacher of the gentiles in faith and verity.

1Tim 2:8
I woll therefore that the men pray every where, lifting up pure hands without wrath, or arguing.

1Tim 2:9
Likewise also the women that they array themselves in mannerly apparel with shamefastness, and honest behavior, not with broided hair, other gold, or pearls, or costly array:

1Tim 2:10
but with such as becometh women that profess the worshipping of God thorow good works.

1Tim 2:11
Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

1Tim 2:12
I suffer not a woman to teach, neither to have authority over the man: but for to be in silence.

1Tim 2:13
For Adam was first formed, and then Eve.

1Tim 2:14
Also Adam was not deceived, but the woman was deceived, and was in transgression.

1Tim 2:15
Notwithstanding they shall be saved thorow bearing of children, if they continue in the faith and in love, and in sanctifying.

1Tim 3:1
This is a true saying: If a man covet the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

1Tim 3:2
Yea and a bishop must be faultless, the husband of one wife, sober, of honest behavior, honestly apparelled, harbourous, apt to teach,

1Tim 3:3
not drunken, no fighter, not given to filthy lucre: but gentle, abhorring fighting, abhorring covetousness,

1Tim 3:4
and one that ruleth his own house honestly, having children under obedience, with all honesty.

1Tim 3:5
For if a man cannot rule his own house, how shall he care for the congregation of God.

1Tim 3:6
He may not be a young man, lest he swell and fall into the judgment of the evil speaker.

1Tim 3:7
He must also be well reported of among them which are without forth, lest he fall into rebuke, and into the snare of the evil speaker.

1Tim 3:8
Likewise must the deacons be honest, not double tongued, not given unto much drinking, neither unto filthy lucre:

1Tim 3:9
but having the mystery of the faith in pure conscience.

1Tim 3:10
And let them first be proved, and then let them minister, if they be found faultless.

1Tim 3:11
Even so must their wives be honest, not evil speakers: but sober, and faithful in all things.

1Tim 3:12
Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife and such as rule their children well, and their own households.

1Tim 3:13
For they that minister well, get themselves good degree, and great liberty in the faith, which is in Christ Iesu.

1Tim 3:14
These things write I unto thee, trusting to come shortly unto thee.

1Tim 3:15
And if I come not, that thou mayst yet have knowledge how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the congregation of the living God, the pillar and ground of truth.

1Tim 3:16
And without nay great is that mystery of godliness. God was shewed in the flesh, was justified in the spirit, was seen of angels, was preached unto the gentiles, was believed on in earth and received up in glory.

1Tim 4:1
The spirit speaketh evidently that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, and shall give heed unto spirits of error,

1Tim 4:2
and devilish doctrine of them which speak false thorow hypocrisy, and have their consciences marked with an hot iron,

1Tim 4:3
forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with giving thanks, of them which believe, and know the truth,

1Tim 4:4
for all the creatures of God are good: and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:

1Tim 4:5
For it is sanctified by the word of God, and prayer.

1Tim 4:6
If thou shalt put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Iesu Christ which hast been nourished up in the words of the faith, and good doctrine, which doctrine thou hast continually followed.

1Tim 4:7
But cast away unghostly and old wives' fables. Exercise thyself unto godliness.

1Tim 4:8
For bodily exercise profiteth little: But godliness is good unto all things, as a thing which hath promises of the life that is now, and of the life to come.

1Tim 4:9
This is a sure saying, and of all parties worthy to be received.

1Tim 4:10
For therefore we labour and suffer rebuke, because we believe in the living God, which is the saviour of all men: but specially of those that believe.

1Tim 4:11
Such things command and teach.

1Tim 4:12
Let no man despise thy youth: but be unto them that believe, an ensample, in word, in conversation, in love, in spirit, in faith and in pureness.

1Tim 4:13
Till I come give attendance to reading, to exhortation, and to doctrine.

1Tim 4:14
Despise not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee thorow prophecy, and with laying on of the hands of a senior.

1Tim 4:15
These things exercise, and give thyself unto them, that all men may see how thou profitest.

1Tim 4:16
Take heed unto thyself and unto learning, and continue therein. For if thou shalt so do thou shalt save thyself, and them that hear thee.

1Tim 5:1
Rebuke not a senior: but exhort him as a father, and the younger men as brethren,

1Tim 5:2
the elder women as mothers, the younger as sisters, with all pureness.

1Tim 5:3
Honour widows which are true widows.

1Tim 5:4
If any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to rule their own houses godly, and to recompense their elders. For that is good and acceptable before God.

1Tim 5:5
She that is a very widow, and friendless, putteth her trust in God, and continueth in supplication and prayer night and day:

1Tim 5:6
but she that liveth in pleasure, is dead even yet alive.

1Tim 5:7
And such things command, that they may be without fault.

1Tim 5:8
If there be any that provideth not for his own, and namely for them of his household, the same denieth the faith, and is worse than an infidel.

1Tim 5:9
Let no widow be chosen under threescore year old, and such a one as was the wife of one man,

1Tim 5:10
and well reported of in good works: if she have nourished children, if she have been liberal to strangers, if she have washed the saints' feet, if she have ministered unto them which were in adversity, if she were continually given unto all manner good works.

1Tim 5:11
The younger widows refuse. For when they have begun to wax wanton, to the dishonour of Christ, then will they marry,

1Tim 5:12
having damnation, because they have despised their first faith.

1Tim 5:13
And also they learn to go from house to house idle, yea not idle only, but also trifling and busybodies, speaking things which are not comely.

1Tim 5:14
I will therefore that the younger women marry and bear children, and guide the house, and give none occasion to the adversary to speak evil.

1Tim 5:15
For many of them are all ready turned back, and are gone after Satan.

1Tim 5:16
And if any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them minister unto them, and let not the congregation be charged: that it may have sufficient for them that are widows in deed.

1Tim 5:17
The seniors that rule well are worthy of double honour, most specially they which labour in the word and in teaching.

1Tim 5:18
For the scripture saith: Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn. And the laborer is worthy of his reward.

1Tim 5:19
Against an senior receive none accusation: but under two or three witnesses.

1Tim 5:20
Them that sin rebuke openly that other may fear.

1Tim 5:21
I testify before God, and the Lord Iesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without hasty judgment, and do nothing partially.

1Tim 5:22
Lay hands suddenly on no man neither be part taker of other men's sins: Keep thyself pure.

1Tim 5:23
Drink no longer water, but use a little wine, for thy stomach's sake, and thine often diseases.

1Tim 5:24
Some men's sins are open beforehand and go before unto judgement: some men's sins follow after.

1Tim 5:25
Likewise also good works are manifest beforehand, and they that are otherwise, cannot be hid.

1Tim 6:1
Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God, and his doctrine be not evil spoken of.

1Tim 6:2
See that they which have believing masters despise them not because they are brethren: but so much the rather do service, for as much as they are believing and beloved and part takers of the benefite. These things teach and exhort.

1Tim 6:3
If any man teach otherwise, and is not content with the wholesome words of our Lord Iesu Christ, and with the doctrine of godliness,

1Tim 6:4
he is puffed up and knoweth nothing: but wasteth his brains about questions, and strife of words, whereof spring envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings

1Tim 6:5
superfluous disputings in scowls of men with corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, which think that lucre is godliness. From such separate thyself.

1Tim 6:6
Godliness is great riches, if a man be content with that he hath.

1Tim 6:7
For we brought nothing into the world, and it is a plain case that we can carry nothing out.

1Tim 6:8
When we have food and raiment, let us therewith be content.

1Tim 6:9
They that will be rich, fall into temptation and snares, and into many foolish and noisome lusts, which drown men in perdition, and destruction.

1Tim 6:10
For covetousness is the root of all evil, which while some lusted after, they erred from the faith, and tangled themselves with many sorrows.

1Tim 6:11
But thou which art the man of God, fly such things. Follow righteousness, godliness, love, patience, meekness.

1Tim 6:12
Fight the good fight of faith. Lay hand on eternal life, whereunto thou art called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.

1Tim 6:13
I give thee charge in the sight of God, which quickeneth all things, and before Iesus Christ, which under Pontius Pilate witnessed a good witnessing,

1Tim 6:14
that thou keep the commandment without spot, so that no man find fault with thee, until the appearing of our Lord Iesus Christ,

1Tim 6:15
which appearing (when the time is come) he shall shew that is blessed and mighty only, king of kings, and Lord of lords,

1Tim 6:16
which only hath immortality, and dwelleth in light that no man can obtain, whom never man saw, neither can see: unto whom be honour and rule everlasting Amen.

1Tim 6:17
Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not exceeding wise, and that they trust not in the uncertain riches, but in the living God, which giveth us abundantly all things to enjoy them,

1Tim 6:18
and that they do good and be rich in good works, and ready to give and to distribute,

1Tim 6:19
laying up in store for themselves, a good foundation against the time to come, that they may obtain eternal life.

1Tim 6:20
O Timothy save that which is given thee to keep, and avoid unghostly vanities of voices, and oppositions of science falsely so called,

1Tim 6:21
which science, while some professed, they have erred as concerning the faith. Grace be with thee Amen. <Sent from Laodicea, which is the chefest cite of Phrigia Pacaciana.>

2Tim 1:1
Paul an apostle of Iesu Christ, by the will of God, to preach the promise of life, which life is in Christ Iesu.

2Tim 1:2
To Timothy his beloved son. Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the father, and from Iesus Christ our Lord.

2Tim 1:3
I thank God, whom I serve from mine elders with pure conscience, that without ceasing I make mention of thee in my prayers night and day,

2Tim 1:4
desiring to see thee, mindful of thy tears: so that I am filled with joy,

2Tim 1:5
when I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and in thy mother Eunica: and am assured that it dwelleth in thee also.

2Tim 1:6
Wherefore I warn thee that thou stir up the gift of God which is in thee, by the putting on of my hands.

2Tim 1:7
For God hath not given to us the spirit of fear: but of power, and of love, and of honest behavior.

2Tim 1:8
Be not ashamed to testify our Lord, neither be ashamed of me, which am bound for his sake: but suffer adversity with the gospell also thorow the power of God,

2Tim 1:9
which saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not after our deeds, but for his purpose and grace, which grace was given us thorow Christ Iesu before the world was,

2Tim 1:10
but is now declared openly by the appearing of our saviour Iesu Christ, which hath put away death, and hath brought life and immortality unto light thorow the gospell,

2Tim 1:11
whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the gentiles:

2Tim 1:12
for the which cause I also suffer this. Nevertheless I am not ashamed. For I know whom I have believed, and am sure that he is able keep that which I have committed to his keeping against that day.

2Tim 1:13
See thou have the example of the wholesome words which thou heardest of me, in faith and love which is in Iesu Christ.

2Tim 1:14
That good thing which was committed to thy keeping, keep in the holy ghost which dwelleth in us.

2Tim 1:15
This thou knowest how that all they which are in Asia be turned from me. Of which sort are Phigellos and Hermogenes.

2Tim 1:16
The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:

2Tim 1:17
but when he was at Rome he sought me out very diligently, and found me.

2Tim 1:18
The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy with the Lord at that day. And in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus thou knowest very well.

2Tim 2:1
Thou therefore my son be strong in the grace that is in Christ Iesu.

2Tim 2:2
And what things thou hast heard of me, many bearing witness, the same deliver to faithful men, which are apt to teach other.

2Tim 2:3
Thou therefore suffer affliction as a good soldier of Iesu Christ.

2Tim 2:4
No man that warreth, entangleth himself with worldly business, and that because he would please him that hath chosen him to be a soldier.

2Tim 2:5
And though a man strive for a mastery, yet is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.

2Tim 2:6
The husbandman that laboureth must first receive of the fruits.

2Tim 2:7
Consider what I say. The Lord give thee understanding in all things.

2Tim 2:8
Remember that Iesus Christ being of the seed of David, rose again from death according to my gospell,

2Tim 2:9
wherein I suffer trouble as an evil doer, even unto bonds. But the word of God was not bound.

2Tim 2:10
Herefore I suffer all things, for the elects' sakes, that they might also obtain that health which is in Christ Iesu, with eternal glory.

2Tim 2:11
It is a true saying, if we be dead with him, we also shall live with him.

2Tim 2:12
If we be patient, we shall also reign with him. If we deny him, he also shall deny us.

2Tim 2:13
If we believe not, yet abideth he faithful. He cannot deny himself.

2Tim 2:14
Of these things put them in remembrance, and testify before the Lord, that they strive not about words, which is to no profit, but to pervert the hearers.

2Tim 2:15
Study to shew thyself laudable unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, dividing the word of truth justly.

2Tim 2:16
Unghostly and vain voices pass over. For they shall increase unto greater ungodliness,

2Tim 2:17
and their words shall fret even as doth a cancre: of whose number is Hymeneos and Philetos,

2Tim 2:18
which as concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past all ready, and do destroy the faith of diverse persons.

2Tim 2:19
But the sure ground of God remaineth, and hath this seal: the Lord knoweth them that are his, and let every man that calleth on the name of Christ, depart from iniquity.

2Tim 2:20
Notwithstanding in a great house are not only vessels of gold and of silver: but also of wood and of earth: Some for honour, and some unto dishonour.

2Tim 2:21
If a man purge himself from such fellows, he shall be a vessel sanctified unto honour meet for the Lord, and prepared unto all good works.

2Tim 2:22
Lusts of youth avoid, and follow righteousness, faith, love, and peace, with them that call on the Lord with pure heart.

2Tim 2:23
Foolish and unlearned questions put from thee, remembering that they do but make strife.

2Tim 2:24
But the servant of the Lord must not strive: but must be peaceable unto all men, and ready to teach,

2Tim 2:25
and one that can suffer the evil in meekness, and can inform them that resist, if that God at any time will give them repentance for to know the truth:

2Tim 2:26
that they may wake out of sleep again, out of the snare of the devil, which are now taken of him at his will.

2Tim 3:1
This understand, that in the last days shall come parlous times:

2Tim 3:2
For the men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, cursed speakers, disobedient to father and mother, unthankful, unholy,

2Tim 3:3
churlish, stubborn, false accusers, rioters, fierce, despisers of them which are good,

2Tim 3:4
traitors, heady, high minded, greedy upon voluptuousness more then the lovers of God,

2Tim 3:5
having a similitude of godly living, but have denied the power there of. Such abhor.

2Tim 3:6
For of this sort are they which enter into houses, and bring into bondage women laden with sin, which women are led of divers lusts,

2Tim 3:7
ever learning, and never able to come unto the knowledge of the truth.

2Tim 3:8
As Iannes and Iambres withstood Moses, even so do these resist the truth, men they are of corrupt minds, and lewd as concerning the faith:

2Tim 3:9
but they shall prevail no longer. For their madness shall be uttered unto all men as theirs was:

2Tim 3:10
but thou hast seen the experience of my doctrine, ordinance, purpose, faith, long suffering, love, patience,

2Tim 3:11
persecutions, and afflictions which happened unto me at Antioche, at Iconium, and at Lystra: which persecutions I suffered patiently, And from them all the Lord delivered me.

2Tim 3:12
Yea and all that will live godly in Christ Iesu, must suffer persecutions.

2Tim 3:13
But the evil men and deceivers, shall wax worse and worse, while they deceive, and are deceived themselves.

2Tim 3:14
But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned, which also were committed unto thee seeing thou knowest of whom thou hast learned them.

2Tim 3:15
and for as much also as thou hast known holy scripture of a child, which is able to make thee wise unto health throwe faith, which is in Christ Iesu.

2Tim 3:16
For all scripture given by inspiration of God, is profitable to teach, to improve, to inform, and to instruct in righteousness,

2Tim 3:17
that the man of God may be perfect, and prepared unto all good works.

2Tim 4:1
I testify therefore before God, and before the Lord Iesu Christ, which shall judge quick and dead at his appearing in his kingdom,

2Tim 4:2
preach the word, be fervent, be it in season, or out of season. Improve, rebuke, exhort with all long suffering.

2Tim 4:3
For the time will come, when they will not suffer wholesome doctrine: but after their own lusts shall they (whose ears itch) get them an heap of teachers,

2Tim 4:4
and shall turn their ears from the truth, and shall be given unto fables:

2Tim 4:5
But watch thou in all things, and suffer adversity, and do the work of an evangelist, fulfil thine office unto the utmost.

2Tim 4:6
For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departing is at hand.

2Tim 4:7
I have fought a good fight, and have fulfilled my course, and have kept the faith.

2Tim 4:8
From henceforth is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord that is a righteous judge shall give me at that day: not to me only: but unto all them that love his coming.

2Tim 4:9
Make speed to come unto me at once.

2Tim 4:10
For Demas hath left me, and hath loved this present world, and is departed into Thessalonica. Crescens is gone to Galatia, and Titus unto Dalmacea.

2Tim 4:11
Only Lucas is with me. Take Mark and bring him with thee, for he is necessary unto me for to minister.

2Tim 4:12
And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

2Tim 4:13
The cloak that I left at Troada with Carpus when thou comest bring with thee, and the books, but specially the parchment.

2Tim 4:14
Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil, the Lord reward him according to his deeds,

2Tim 4:15
of whom be thou ware also. For he withstood our preaching sore.

2Tim 4:16
At my first answering for myself, no man assisted me, but all forsook me. I pray God, that it may not be laid to their charges:

2Tim 4:17
notwith stonding the Lord assisted me, and strengthed me, that by me the preaching should be fulfilled to the utmost and that all the gentiles should hear. And I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

2Tim 4:18
And the Lord shall deliver me from all evil doing, and shall keep me unto his heavenly kingdom. To whom be praise for ever and ever Amen.

2Tim 4:19
Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

2Tim 4:20
Erastus abode at Corinthum. Trophimos I left at Miletum sick.

2Tim 4:21
Make speed to come before winter. Eubolus greeteh thee, and Pudes, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

2Tim 4:22
The Lord Iesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you Amen. <The second pistle written from Rome unto Timothy, when Paul was presented the second time up, before the Emperor Nero.>

Ti 1:1
Paul the servant of God and an Apostle of Iesu Christ, to preach the faith of goddis elect, and the knowledge of that truth,

Ti 1:2
which truth is in serving God in hope of eternal life, which life God cannot lie, hath promissed before the world began:

Ti 1:3
but hath at the time appointed opened his word by preaching, which preaching is committed unto me, by the commandment of God our saviour.

Ti 1:4
To Titus his natural son in the common faith. Grace mercy and peace from God the father, and from the Lord Iesu Christ our saviour.

Ti 1:5
For this cause left I thee in Creta, that thou shouldest perform that which was lacking and shouldest ordain seniors in every city as I appointed thee.

Ti 1:6
If any be such as no man can complain on, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, which are not sclandred of riot, neither are disobedient.

Ti 1:7
For a bishop must be such as no man can complain on, as it be cometh the minister of God not stubborn, not angry, no drunkard, no fighter, not given to filthy lucre:

Ti 1:8
but harbourous, one that loveth goodness, of honest behavior, righteous, holy temperate,

Ti 1:9
and such as cleaveth unto the true word of doctrine, that he may be able to exhort with wholesome learning, and to improve them that say against it.

Ti 1:10
For there are many disobedient and talkers of vanity, and deceivers of minds, namely they of the circumcision,

Ti 1:11
whose mouths must be stopped, which pervert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, because of filthy lucre.

Ti 1:12
One being of themselves, which was a poet of their own said: The Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and slowbellies.

Ti 1:13
This witness is true, wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

Ti 1:14
and not taking heed to jewes fables, and commandments of men, which turn from the truth.

Ti 1:15
Unto the pure, are all things pure: but unto them that are defiled, and unbelieving, is nothing pure: but even the very minds and consciences of them are defiled.

Ti 1:16
They confess that they know God: but with deeds they deny him and are abominable, and disobedient, and unto all good works discommendable.

Ti 2:1
But speak thou that which becometh wholesome learning:

Ti 2:2
That the elder men be sober, honest, discreet, sound in the faith, in love and in patience.

Ti 2:3
And the elder women likewise that they be in such raiment, as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much drinking, but teachers of honest things,

Ti 2:4
that they nurture the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

Ti 2:5
to be of honest behaviour, chaste, housewifely, good, and obedient unto their own husbands, that the word of God be not evil spoken of.

Ti 2:6
Young men likewise exhort that they be of honest manners.

Ti 2:7
Above all things shew thyself an ensample of good works in the doctrine, shew uncorruption, honesty,

Ti 2:8
and the wholesome word which cannot be rebuked, that he which withstandeth may be ashamed, having no thing in you that he may dispraise.

Ti 2:9
The servants exhort to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please in all things, not answering again,

Ti 2:10
neither be pickers, but that they shew all good faithfulness, that they may do worship to the doctrine of God our saviour in all things.

Ti 2:11
For the grace of God, that bringeth health unto all men, hath appeared

Ti 2:12
and teacheth us that we should deny ungodliness and worldly lusts, and that we should live honestly, righteously, and godly in this present world,

Ti 2:13
looking for that blessed hope and glorious appearing of the mighty God, and of our saviour Iesu Christ:

Ti 2:14
which gave himself for us, to redeem us from all unrighteousness, and to purge us a peculiar people unto himself, fervently given unto good works.

Ti 2:15
These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke, with all commanding. See that no man despise thee.

Ti 3:1
Warn them that they submit themselves to rule and power, to obey the officers, that they be prompt unto all good works,

Ti 3:2
that they speak evil of no man, that they be no fighters, but soft, shewing all meekness unto all men.

Ti 3:3
For we ourselves also were in times past, unwise, disobedient, deceived, in danger to lusts, and to divers manners of voluptuousness, living in maliciousness and envy, full of hate, hating one another.

Ti 3:4
But after that the kindness and love of our saviour to manward appeared,

Ti 3:5
not of the deeds of righteousness which we wrought, but of his mercy, he saved us, by the fountain of the new birth, and with the renewing of the holy ghost,

Ti 3:6
which he shed on us abundantly, thorow Iesus Christ our saviour,

Ti 3:7
that we once justified by his grace, should be heirs of eternal life, thorow hope.

Ti 3:8
